analyzed: dbul ba/_bcu gcig pa lam brten pa/_bcu gnyis pa yongs su bsngo ba bya

analyzed: dang bcas pa 'khor yug dkar nag gnyis kyis bskor ba la hri las pad+ma/_a

analyzed: las zla ba'i gdan lo las nyi ma'i gdan/_phu las klu'i rgyal po chen po brgyad/

analyzed: 'bru'i lha ni/_gdan de'i steng du rang gi sems kyi ngo bo hum mthing kha bcu bdun

analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od kyi mun pa bcom pa bzhin/_'gro ba drug gi nyon mongs pa kun byang

analyzed: dang /_spos phor dang /_me tog dang /_mar me dang /_dri'i dung chos

analyzed: dang /_lcags kyu dang /_zhags pa dang /_lcags sgrog dang /_dril bu/

analyzed: sbrul chen rigs lnga ni rgyal rigs dkar pos rna brgyan byas/_bram ze ser pos phyag gdub byas pa/_rje rigs dmar pos zhabs gdub byas pa/_rmangs
translated: The five great snakes are white for the kṣatriya caste, which adorns his ears; yellow for the brahmin caste, which adorns his

analyzed: rigs ljang khus do shal byas pa/_gdol rigs nag po zhal du za ba/_sku
translated: arms; red for the vaiśya caste, which adorns his feet; green for the śūdra caste, which adorns his necklace; and black for the untouchable caste, which he eats.🔽His body is

analyzed: lus la bskal pa'i me 'bar ba'i gseb nas 'dab chags dang khro chung dang / gcan zan gyi tshhogs dpag tu med pa 'phro ba/_bsgrub bya thun pur thu ba/
translated: In the midst of the fire of the eon that blazes on the body, countless flocks of birds, small wrathful ones, and carnivorous beasts emanate.

analyzed: rtshibs brgyad kyi steng gi phyag mtshhan rnams las ded dpon chen po brgyad bskyed
translated: The eight directional guardians are generated from the hand implements on the eight sides of the charnel grounds.

analyzed: pa ni/_om yag sha badzra pa ni hri ta na ye hum phat/_zhes pas shar phyogs kyi

analyzed: rtshibs nas rdo rje mthu chen/_rdo rje rtshe gsum la gdengs pa/_shar lhor rdo rje

original: gug gdengs pa/_byang du rdo rje dbyings las rgyal rgya gram gdengs pa/_byang
analyzed: gug gdengs pa/_byang du rdo rje dbyings las rgyal rgya gram gdengs pa/_byang

analyzed: shar du rdo rje bgegs las skyob pa ral gri gdengs pa/_thams cad kyang sku
translated: All of them have

analyzed: mdog mthing nag_/g.yon pa thams cad sdigs mdzub dang dril bu skur bsten
translated: blue-black colored bodies, with all left hands holding threatening-hand gestures and bells,🔽and the two legs in the posture of right leg extended and left leg drawn in.

original: pa/_zhabs gnyis g.yas brkyang g.yon skum pa/_sma ra dang stag gi chas dang sbrul gyis brgyan pa la/_ye shes kyi me dpung 'bar ba'i nang na bzhugs pa la/

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The Actual Consecration🔽The four goddesses of the four corners are as follows:

original: gru chad bzhi'i lha mo bzhi ni/_du pu hri a bzhi las shar lhor bdug pa mo dkar🔽mo spos phor thogs pa/_lho nub du me tog ma ser mo me tog thogs pa nub byang
analyzed: gru chad bzhi'i lha mo bzhi ni/_du pu hri a bzhi las shar lhor bdug pa mo dkar mo spos phor thogs pa/_lho nub du me tog ma ser mo me tog thogs pa nub byang

analyzed: du mar me ma dmar mo mar me thogs pa/_byang shar du dri mchog ma ljang khu dri
translated: From dri hri a, in the northeast is Supreme Fragrance Lady, green, holding supreme fragrance.

analyzed: mchog bsnams pa/_dza hum bam ho las/_shar du lcags kyu ma dkar mo lcags kyu

analyzed: thogs pa/_lhor zhags pa ma ser mo zhags pa thogs pa/_nub du lcags sgrog

analyzed: ma ser dmar mo lcags sgrog thogs pa/_byang du dril bu ma ljang khu dril bu thogs pa/
translated: In the south, yellow Pāṇḍaravāsinī holds a noose. In the west, yellow-red Padmanartteśvarī holds a chain. In the north, green Bhṛkuṭī holds a bell.

original: 'khor yug gi 'khor lo dkar po'i steng na las las grub pa'i gnod sbyin chen po🔽nyi shu ni om yak+sha yak+sha badzra hu~m phat zhes pas/_seng ge'i mgo can sku mdog ser
analyzed: 'khor yug gi 'khor lo dkar po'i steng na las las grub pa'i gnod sbyin chen po nyi shu ni om yak+sha yak+sha badzra hu~m phat zhes pas/_seng ge'i mgo can sku mdog ser
translated: On the white wheel in the outer ring, the twenty great yakṣas created from karma are yellow.🔽Om yakṣa yakṣa vajra hūṃ phaṭ. They have the heads of a lion, and all right hands brandish a vajra marked with their individual seed syllable.

original: po g.yas pa kun thams cad rang rtags kyi rdo rje gsor ba la/_g.yon pa lcags🔽kyu 'dzin pa/_khyung gi mgo can nag po 'khor lo thogs pa/_stag gi mgo🔽can dmar po mda' gzhu thogs pa/_khra'i mgo can sngon po mdung thogs pa/🔽gzig gi mgo can kham pa bam thogs pa/_bya rgod kyi mgo can ser po zhags pa
analyzed: po g.yas pa kun thams cad rang rtags kyi rdo rje gsor ba la/_g.yon pa lcags kyu 'dzin pa/_khyung gi mgo can nag po 'khor lo thogs pa/_stag gi mgo can dmar po mda' gzhu thogs pa/_khra'i mgo can sngon po mdung thogs pa/ gzig gi mgo can kham pa bam thogs pa/_bya rgod kyi mgo can ser po zhags pa
translated: The left hands hold an iron hook.🔽The head of a garuḍa is black and holds a chakram. The head of a tiger is red and holds a bow and arrow. The head of a vulture is blue and holds a spear.

analyzed: thogs pa dom gyi mgo can nag po brag thogs pa/_kam ka'i mgo can dri shu la
translated: The head of a leopard is brown and holds a club. The head of a vulture is yellow and holds a noose. The head of a bear is black and holds a rock. The head of a kāmka is white and holds a skull.🔽The head of a crow is black and holds a sword. The head of a jackal is red and holds a trident. The head of a fox is green and holds a hammer. The head of a cat is yellow and holds a lasso. The head of a mongoose is white and holds a jewel. The head of a monkey is red and holds a skull. The head of a bat is black and holds a wheel. The head of a rat is white and holds a jewel.

original: thogs pa/_dred kyi mgo can sngon po ral gri thogs pa/_bzhad kyi mgo can🔽kham pa dgra sta thogs pa/_spre'u mgo can ser po lcags sgrog thogs pa/_'ug

translated: The blue one with a bear’s head holds a sword; the one with a jackal’s head🔽holds an axe; the yellow one with a monkey’s head holds iron shackles; the🔽black one with an owl’s head holds a curved knife; the red one with a goat’s

analyzed: pa'i mgo can nag po gri gug thogs pa/_ra'i mgo can dmar po gri thogs pa/

analyzed: rma bya'i mgo can sngon po chu zor thogs pa/_spyang khu'i mgo can kham pa phur pa

analyzed: 'phar ba'i mgo can sngon po tho ba thogs pa/_ba glang gi mgo can kham pa gri

analyzed: thogs pa'o/_/'khor yug 'thing kha'i steng na bsrung ba'i khro bo sum cu rtsha gnyis
translated: On the outer ring, which is green, are thirty-two wrathful protectors.🔽They are all dark blue and blazing, and their right hands hold blazing

analyzed: sku mdog 'thing nag 'bar ba la/_phyag g.yas pa rdo rje 'bar ba thogs pa la/

analyzed: g.yon pa sdigs mdzub dril bur bcas pa zhal phyi nang sprad la bsgom/_om badzra
translated: Meditate on the left hand as a threatening gesture with a bell, with the mouth of the bell facing inward.🔽Om vajra yaksha hum phat.🔽The deity of subtle meditative concentration is as follows:

original: yak+sha hu~m phat/_drug pa ting 'dzin phra mo'i lha ni/_spyi bo dang /_lce rtshe dang / snying kha dang /_mgrin pa dang /_lte ba rnams su om hum a hum ram rnams gyur pa
analyzed: yak+sha hu~m phat/_drug pa ting 'dzin phra mo'i lha ni/_spyi bo dang /_lce rtshe dang / snying kha dang /_mgrin pa dang /_lte ba rnams su om hum a hum ram rnams gyur pa
translated: Om, hum, ah, hum, and ram transform into the following at the crown, uvula, heart, throat, and navel.

original: las/_spyi bor 'khor lo dkar po rtshibs bcu gnyis pa la/_yi ge bcu
analyzed: las/_spyi bor 'khor lo dkar po rtshibs bcu gnyis pa la/_yi ge bcu
translated: At the crown, a white wheel with twelve spokes is marked with the thirteen syllables.

analyzed: gsum gyis mtshhan pa/_lce rtsher rdo rje gsum pa las/_yi ge bcu gsum pa tshhar
translated: At the uvula, the three vajras radiate the thirteen syllables in three directions.

translated: At the throat, an eight-petaled red lotus is adorned with the thirteen red syllables.🔽At the heart, a five-pronged vajra is surrounded by the thirteen blue syllables.

original: mthing khas bskor ba/_lte ba ram las re dmig bcu gnyis pa/_yi ge bcu
analyzed: mthing khas bskor ba/_lte ba ram las re dmig bcu gnyis pa/_yi ge bcu
translated: At the navel, a ram becomes a red triangle marked with the thirteen syllables.🔽Imagine that fire blazes from the thirteen syllables.

original: gsum pa las me 'bar bar bsams la/_rigs kyi bdag pos dbu la mtshhan
analyzed: gsum pa las me 'bar bar bsams la/_rigs kyi bdag pos dbu la mtshhan
translated: The master of the family adorns the crown.

original: pa zhes pas gtsho bo la ni mi bskyod pa'o/_/phyogs bzhi'i lha rnams la rigs bzhi
analyzed: pa zhes pas gtsho bo la ni mi bskyod pa'o/_/phyogs bzhi'i lha rnams la rigs bzhi
translated: The syllable pa indicates that Akṣobhya is in the center.

original: po ye shes pa spyan drangs pa la mchod pas mnyes par byas la rigs kyi bdag po🔽rnams dang tha mi dad du bzhugs pa dang /_snying po'i yi ge bcu gsum pa gtsho
analyzed: po ye shes pa spyan drangs pa la mchod pas mnyes par byas la rigs kyi bdag po rnams dang tha mi dad du bzhugs pa dang /_snying po'i yi ge bcu gsum pa gtsho
translated: The four families of the invited gnostics of the four directions are pleased by the offerings to them.🔽The lords of the families are not different from the gnostics.

original: bo la brgya rtsha brgyad/_'khor rnams la yak+sha nyi shu rtsha re re/_gzung dang bcas
analyzed: bo la brgya rtsha brgyad/_'khor rnams la yak+sha nyi shu rtsha re re/_gzung dang bcas
translated: The thirteen syllable essence mantra is recited one hundred and eight times for the central figure and twenty-one times for each of the retinue.

original: pa bzlas la bstod pa byas la/_dbang gi cho ga byas pa ni 'gro bzangs ma'o//_//🔽slob dpon klu grub kyi mdo gzungs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas/_lha dgu'i
analyzed: pa bzlas la bstod pa byas la/_dbang gi cho ga byas pa ni 'gro bzangs ma'o//_// slob dpon klu grub kyi mdo gzungs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas/_lha dgu'i
translated: Having recited with retention, one should perform the praise and the empowerment rite. This is the “good to go.”🔽Following the sūtra dhāraṇī of Ācārya Nāgārjuna, the clear realization of the maṇḍala of the nine deities is as follows:

original: dkyil 'khor gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa sngon du song ba'i
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa sngon du song ba'i
translated: After first gathering the accumulations,🔽the actual generation of the maṇḍala is as follows:

original: rjes la dkyil 'khor dngos bskyed pa ni/_e las nam mkha' yam las rlung /
analyzed: rjes la dkyil 'khor dngos bskyed pa ni/_e las nam mkha' yam las rlung /
translated: From e, there is space; from yaṃ, wind;

original: kham las chu/_sam las gser/_lam las rin po che/_ram las me/_bru las
analyzed: kham las chu/_sam las gser/_lam las rin po che/_ram las me/_bru las
translated: from vaṃ, water; from laṃ, gold; from maṃ, jewels; from raṃ, fire; from vaṃ,

original: gzhal yas khang /_'khor lo rtshibs bzhi pa/_gru chad la sgo btod pa can/
analyzed: gzhal yas khang /_'khor lo rtshibs bzhi pa/_gru chad la sgo btod pa can/
translated: The celestial palace is a four-tiered wheel with four gates on the four corners.

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The visualization is called The Pearl Rosary.

original: rta babs kyis mtshhan pa/_khor yug rim pa gsum du bskor ba la gdan bskyed
analyzed: rta babs kyis mtshhan pa/_khor yug rim pa gsum du bskor ba la gdan bskyed
translated: The palace is marked with archways and surrounded by three concentric walls.

original: pa ni/_zla ba dang /_nyi ma/_pad+ma'i steng du phu las sbrul chen po brgyad khyung
analyzed: pa ni/_zla ba dang /_nyi ma/_pad+ma'i steng du phu las sbrul chen po brgyad khyung
translated: The seats are created as follows: Upon moon, sun, and lotus seats, from puṃ, eight great snakes are eaten by garuḍas.

original: gis za ba dang /_rtshibs bzhi la nyi zla pad+ma'i gdan/_sgo bzhir zla ba'i gdan
analyzed: gis za ba dang /_rtshibs bzhi la nyi zla pad+ma'i gdan/_sgo bzhir zla ba'i gdan
translated: On the four tiers are seats of sun, moon, and lotus, and at the four gates are moon seats.

original: la/_gsung yig 'bru/_hum re re gyur pa las thugs phyag mtshhan/_rdo rje/
analyzed: la/_gsung yig 'bru/_hum re re gyur pa las thugs phyag mtshhan/_rdo rje/
translated: Upon each of these seats, from the seed syllables of the enlightened body, speech, and mind—oṃ āḥ hūṃ—appear vajras, lotuses, and hūṃs.

original: dri shul/_ral gri/_dbyug to/_'khor lo dang lnga/_lcags kyu/_zhags pa/🔽lcags sgrog_/dril bu'o/_/de 'phros shing 'dus pa las/_dbus su gsang
analyzed: dri shul/_ral gri/_dbyug to/_'khor lo dang lnga/_lcags kyu/_zhags pa/ lcags sgrog_/dril bu'o/_/de 'phros shing 'dus pa las/_dbus su gsang
translated: From the hūṃs appear the enlightened mind emblems—a vajra, sword, discus, club, wheel, iron hook, lasso, fettering chain, and bell.

original: ba'i bdag po zhal cig phyag gnyis pa/_rdo rje dang /_sdigs mdzub/
analyzed: ba'i bdag po zhal cig phyag gnyis pa/_rdo rje dang /_sdigs mdzub/
translated: These emanate and reabsorb into the central seat, transforming it into Guhyapati with one face and two hands, holding a vajra and making a threatening gesture.

original: seng+ge'i lpags pa'i stod g.yogs/_stag gi sham thabs can la/_ded dpon
analyzed: seng+ge'i lpags pa'i stod g.yogs/_stag gi sham thabs can la/_ded dpon
translated: He is wearing a tiger-skin skirt and an upper garment made of lion skin.

original: bzhi ni/_shar du rgyal rigs dkar po chung ma dang bcas pa'i steng du/_rdo rje
analyzed: bzhi ni/_shar du rgyal rigs dkar po chung ma dang bcas pa'i steng du/_rdo rje
translated: The four escorts are as follows: In the east, on top of a small white man of the kṣatriya caste and his wife, is Vajra Yakṣa,

original: gnod sbyin mthing kha/_rdo rje dang tri shul rtshe gsum thogs pa/_lhor klu bram🔽ze'i steng du rdo rje srin po rdo rje dang ral gri thogs pa/_nub tu klu rje rigs kyi🔽steng du rdo rje gdon chen rdo rje dang dbyug to thogs pa/_byang du klu gdol rigs
analyzed: gnod sbyin mthing kha/_rdo rje dang tri shul rtshe gsum thogs pa/_lhor klu bram ze'i steng du rdo rje srin po rdo rje dang ral gri thogs pa/_nub tu klu rje rigs kyi steng du rdo rje gdon chen rdo rje dang dbyug to thogs pa/_byang du klu gdol rigs
translated: blue in color, holding a vajra and a trident. In the south, on top of a brahmin nāga, is Vajra Rākṣasa,🔽holding a vajra and a sword. In the west, on top of a nāga of the royal caste, is Vajra Mahābhūta,🔽holding a vajra and a club. In the north, on top of a nāga of the untouchable caste, is Vajra Vetāla,

original: kyi steng du rdo rje ro langs thams cad sku mdog mthing nag rdo rje dang 'khor lo🔽thogs pa/_dar sngon po'i stod g.yogs dang smad g.yogs/_stag sham dang bcas pa'o/_/dza hum bam ho bzhi las/_shar du lcags kyu ma dkar mo lcags kyu
analyzed: kyi steng du rdo rje ro langs thams cad sku mdog mthing nag rdo rje dang 'khor lo thogs pa/_dar sngon po'i stod g.yogs dang smad g.yogs/_stag sham dang bcas pa'o/_/dza hum bam ho bzhi las/_shar du lcags kyu ma dkar mo lcags kyu
translated: all of them blue in color, holding a vajra and a wheel. They are wearing upper garments and lower garments of blue silk and tiger-skin skirts.🔽From jḥuṃ vaṃ hoḥ, in the east is white Hook Lady holding a hook;🔽in the south is yellow Noose Lady holding a noose; in the west is red Chain Lady holding a chain;

original: thogs pa/_lhor zhags pa ma ser mo zhags pa thogs pa/_nub du lcags sgrog
analyzed: thogs pa/_lhor zhags pa ma ser mo zhags pa thogs pa/_nub du lcags sgrog
translated: and in the north is green Bell Lady holding a bell.

original: ma dmar mo lcags sgrog thogs pa/_byang du dril bu ma ljang khu dril bu thogs pa/
analyzed: ma dmar mo lcags sgrog thogs pa/_byang du dril bu ma ljang khu dril bu thogs pa/
translated: Red Māmakī in the south holds an iron hook. Green Ghaṇṭā in the west holds a bell. Green Ghaṇṭā in the north holds a bell.

original: khro mo bzhi po de yang stag gi sham thabs dang sbrul gyi chun pos brgyan pa'o/_/de🔽nas lus bsrung zhing brtan par bya ba ni/_rdo rje go cha'i/_phyag rgyas gnas
analyzed: khro mo bzhi po de yang stag gi sham thabs dang sbrul gyi chun pos brgyan pa'o/_/de nas lus bsrung zhing brtan par bya ba ni/_rdo rje go cha'i/_phyag rgyas gnas
translated: All four of the wrathful ones are adorned with tiger-skin skirts and snakes.🔽Next, for the protection and stabilization of the body, touch the five places with the armoring mudra of the vajra:

original: lngar gtugs de/_spyi bo mgrin pa/_snying kha/_gsang gnas su gtug go/_/
analyzed: lngar gtugs de/_spyi bo mgrin pa/_snying kha/_gsang gnas su gtug go/_/
translated: touch the forehead, throat, heart, navel, and secret place.

original: na ma sa man ta badzra ka ba tsha hum zhes pas/_lus kyi ba spu'i bu ga thams cad rdo
analyzed: na ma sa man ta badzra ka ba tsha hum zhes pas/_lus kyi ba spu'i bu ga thams cad rdo
translated: With “namaḥ samantabuddhānāḥ, vajra kavaca hūṃ,” meditate that all the pores of the body are vajra nets.

original: rje'i dra bar bsgom mo/_//de nas rdo rje rtshe lnga'i phyag rgya byas te/_na ma sa man
analyzed: rje'i dra bar bsgom mo/_//de nas rdo rje rtshe lnga'i phyag rgya byas te/_na ma sa man
translated: Then, make the mudra of the five-pronged vajra and say:

original: ta badzra nan/_badzra pa ni hum/_zhes pas spyi gtshug tu rgyas btab pas/_lus
analyzed: ta badzra nan/_badzra pa ni hum/_zhes pas spyi gtshug tu rgyas btab pas/_lus
translated: namaḥ samantabuddhānāṃ, vajra pāṇi hūṃ.

original: thams cad rdo rje'i dra dmig rnams khro chung mtshhon gang bas gtams par bsams
analyzed: thams cad rdo rje'i dra dmig rnams khro chung mtshhon gang bas gtams par bsams
translated: Since the crown is sealed, imagine that the entire body is filled with the holes of a vajra net, filled with wrathful ones the size of mustard seeds.

original: te byin gyis brlabs pa'o/_/ting 'dzin sems dpa' ni lha rang rang gi thugs
analyzed: te byin gyis brlabs pa'o/_/ting 'dzin sems dpa' ni lha rang rang gi thugs
translated: The samādhi sattva is the individual deity’s hand implement.

original: khar phyag mtshhan de'i lte ba la hum re re bsams la/_rigs kyi bdag pos dbu
analyzed: khar phyag mtshhan de'i lte ba la hum re re bsams la/_rigs kyi bdag pos dbu
translated: The hūṃ is visualized in the center of the hand implement at the heart of each deity, and the master of the family is imagined to be crowning the head of each deity.

original: brgyan par bsam zhing ye shes pa spyan drang ba ni/_hum de las 'od 'phros pas
analyzed: brgyan par bsam zhing ye shes pa spyan drang ba ni/_hum de las 'od 'phros pas
translated: The invocation of the gnosis beings is as follows: Light radiates from the hūṃ and invokes the gnosis beings from Akaniṣṭha.

original: 'og min nas spyan drangs pa la yan lag bdun pa byas la/_rang la thim pa
analyzed: 'og min nas spyan drangs pa la yan lag bdun pa byas la/_rang la thim pa
translated: The seven-branch service is performed, and the gnosis beings dissolve into oneself.

original: dang bzlas pa byas te/_tad+ya tha/_ni lam badzra b+ha ra d+ha ra badzra pa ni ra dz+nya pa ya
analyzed: dang bzlas pa byas te/_tad+ya tha/_ni lam badzra b+ha ra d+ha ra badzra pa ni ra dz+nya pa ya
translated: Recite the mantra: tadyathā | nīlāmbaradharavajravarāha vajrapāṇi rājñāpiya🔽ti svāhā.🔽Recite this one hundred and eight times.

original: ti swa ha/_zhes brgya rtsha brgyad dang /_yak+sha badzra pa ni hri ta ya hum phat/_zhes
analyzed: ti swa ha/_zhes brgya rtsha brgyad dang /_yak+sha badzra pa ni hri ta ya hum phat/_zhes
translated: The mantra of the retinue is yakṣavajrapāṇi hṛdaya ya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: bzlas pa ni/_'khor gyi'o/_/bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni klu grub
analyzed: bzlas pa ni/_'khor gyi'o/_/bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni klu grub
translated: After the praise, the empowerment is conferred.🔽This is the maṇḍala of the thirteen-deity Vajrapāṇi according to the sutra tradition.

original: mdo lugs kyi'o/_/ bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje bcu gsum lcags sbugs ma'i dkyil 'khor
analyzed: mdo lugs kyi'o/_/ bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje bcu gsum lcags sbugs ma'i dkyil 'khor
translated: The maṇḍala of the thirteen-deity Vajrapāṇi according to the tantra tradition is as follows.

original: bskyed pa ni/_sngon du 'gro ba thams cad sngar dang 'dra ba las khyad par du/
analyzed: bskyed pa ni/_sngon du 'gro ba thams cad sngar dang 'dra ba las khyad par du/
translated: The creation stage is the same as before, except for the following differences.

original: rgyu las gzhal yas khang 'khor lo rtshibs bzhi pa/_gru chad la sgo btod pa/🔽rdo rje me ris bskor ba'i nang du/_nyi zla pad+ma'i gdan stengs su hum las rdo rje de
analyzed: rgyu las gzhal yas khang 'khor lo rtshibs bzhi pa/_gru chad la sgo btod pa/ rdo rje me ris bskor ba'i nang du/_nyi zla pad+ma'i gdan stengs su hum las rdo rje de
translated: The celestial mansion arises from the cause, the syllable hūṃ, which transforms into a vajra marked with hūṃ.🔽From that, oneself appears as the blue Lord of Secrets with three faces, four arms, and two legs.

original: las gsang ba'i sngon po bdag po zhal gsum pa/_phyag bzhi pa/_dbu gzhan
analyzed: las gsang ba'i sngon po bdag po zhal gsum pa/_phyag bzhi pa/_dbu gzhan
translated: The upper right face is white, the upper left face is red, and the other two faces are black.

original: 'phrul dbang byed du sleb pa/_zhabs rgya mtshho'i gting du brkyang pa/_ri rab
analyzed: 'phrul dbang byed du sleb pa/_zhabs rgya mtshho'i gting du brkyang pa/_ri rab
translated: The lower two legs are extended into the depths of the ocean, and the upper two legs are in the posture of a dancing posture.🔽The right hands hold a flaying knife and a vajra scepter, and the left hands hold a skull cup and a lasso.

original: la stegs byas pa/_phyag g.yas dang po rdo rje gdengs pa/_g.yon dang po na
analyzed: la stegs byas pa/_phyag g.yas dang po rdo rje gdengs pa/_g.yon dang po na
translated: The lower two hands hold a flaying knife and a skull cup.🔽The four shoulders are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.

original: dril bu 'phyar ba/_'og ma gnyis kyis sbrul za ba/_stag gi sham thabs dang / yan lag sbrul gyis brgyan pa/_rtshibs bzhi la rigs bzhi las grub pa'i phyag🔽mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: dril bu 'phyar ba/_'og ma gnyis kyis sbrul za ba/_stag gi sham thabs dang / yan lag sbrul gyis brgyan pa/_rtshibs bzhi la rigs bzhi las grub pa'i phyag🔽mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.🔽The four corners are adorned with the four heads of the animal heads.

original: na rdo rje bzhi/_'khor lo dang rin po che dang /_pad+ma dang /_rgya khram dang / dril bu 'phyar ba/_gru chad bzhi la rigs bzhi'i khyung bzhi sbrul za ba/_sgo
analyzed: na rdo rje bzhi/_'khor lo dang rin po che dang /_pad+ma dang /_rgya khram dang / dril bu 'phyar ba/_gru chad bzhi la rigs bzhi'i khyung bzhi sbrul za ba/_sgo
translated: At the four gates are the four gate guardians.

original: bzhir sgo ba bzhi'o/_/thugs khar phyag mtshhan las hum gis mtshhan pa/_dbu
analyzed: bzhir sgo ba bzhi'o/_/thugs khar phyag mtshhan las hum gis mtshhan pa/_dbu
translated: In the heart center is a hūṃ marked by a hand implement.

original: rnams la mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rigs lngas mtshhan pa'o/_/ye shes pa spyan drang
analyzed: rnams la mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rigs lngas mtshhan pa'o/_/ye shes pa spyan drang
translated: The heads are marked by the five families, such as Akṣobhya, and so on.🔽Invite the awareness beings, they dissolve into oneself, and one recites:

original: zhing rang la thim pa dang bzlas pa ni/_om badzra tshan ta sarba dush+tan a ta ka ha na🔽da ha pa tsha hu~m phat/_zhes brgya rtsha brgyad bzlas la/_bstod pa byas nas dbang
analyzed: zhing rang la thim pa dang bzlas pa ni/_om badzra tshan ta sarba dush+tan a ta ka ha na da ha pa tsha hu~m phat/_zhes brgya rtsha brgyad bzlas la/_bstod pa byas nas dbang
translated: oṃ vajra-caṇḍa-mahā-roṣa sarva-duṣṭāna-taṭaka-hana-dada-paca-hūṃ phaṭ

original: gi cho ga bya ba ni lcags sbugs ma'o/_/
analyzed: gi cho ga bya ba ni lcags sbugs ma'o/_/
translated: Recite that one hundred and eight times, do the praise, and then perform the empowerment ritual, which is the iron hook.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gsang ldan gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gsang ldan gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs
translated: The actual practice of Ārya Mañjuśrī with the Secret:

original: bsag pa'i dkyil 'khor sngon du btang nas/_'dir dkyil 'khor bsgom
analyzed: bsag pa'i dkyil 'khor sngon du btang nas/_'dir dkyil 'khor bsgom
translated: Having performed the maṇḍala of the accumulation of the site beforehand, here the maṇḍala is meditated on.

original: pa ni/_'byung ba lnga'i dal sngon la bskyed la/_bru las gzhal yas khang /
analyzed: pa ni/_'byung ba lnga'i dal sngon la bskyed la/_bru las gzhal yas khang /
translated: The creation of the celestial palace from the seed syllables

original: nang re dmig dgu pa/_phyi 'khyams rta babs sgo dang bcas pa'i nang du/_nyi
analyzed: nang re dmig dgu pa/_phyi 'khyams rta babs sgo dang bcas pa'i nang du/_nyi
translated: In the center of the celestial palace, which has nine chambers inside and an outer courtyard with archways and gates, upon a sun, moon, and lotus,

original: zla pad+ma'i steng du dbus su mu las pad+ma/_de las ye shes sems dpa' zhal drug
analyzed: zla pad+ma'i steng du dbus su mu las pad+ma/_de las ye shes sems dpa' zhal drug
translated: from mu arises a lotus, and from that, the gnosis being, the six-faced one.

original: pa/_sku mdog ser po phyag gnyis na me tog pad+ma dmar po dang sngon po gnyis
analyzed: pa/_sku mdog ser po phyag gnyis na me tog pad+ma dmar po dang sngon po gnyis
translated: His body is yellow, and in his two hands he holds a red and a blue lotus,

original: kyi steng du po ti re re bzhag pa dang /_thugs khar zla ba'i steng du a las 'od🔽'phros pas hum sa e ha bzhi las/_rdo rje sems ma dang /_rin chen sems ma
analyzed: kyi steng du po ti re re bzhag pa dang /_thugs khar zla ba'i steng du a las 'od 'phros pas hum sa e ha bzhi las/_rdo rje sems ma dang /_rin chen sems ma
translated: each of which supports a book. In his heart, upon a moon, is an a, from which light radiates

original: dang /_pad+ma'i sems ma dang /_las kyi sems ma bzhi bsgom par bya'o/_/hum
analyzed: dang /_pad+ma'i sems ma dang /_las kyi sems ma bzhi bsgom par bya'o/_/hum
translated: and invites the four heart yoginis—from hum, sa, e, and ha, Vajra- sattva, Ratna-sattva, Padma-sattva, and Karma-sattva.

original: om a ham las/_shar du hum las rdo rje ral gri sngon po rdo rje dang ral gri thogs pa/
analyzed: om a ham las/_shar du hum las rdo rje ral gri sngon po rdo rje dang ral gri thogs pa/
translated: From hum, om, and ah, in the east, from hum arises blue Vajra Sword, who holds a vajra and a sword.

original: lhor am las shes rab ye shes dkar po ral gri dang 'khor lo bsnams pa/_nub
analyzed: lhor am las shes rab ye shes dkar po ral gri dang 'khor lo bsnams pa/_nub
translated: In the south, from am arises white Wisdom Wisdom, who holds a sword and a chakram. In the west,🔽from om arises red Lotus Wisdom, who holds a lotus and a chakram. In the north, from hri arises green Karma Wisdom, who holds a sword and a chakram.

original: du a las a ra pa tsha na dmar po phyag gnyis na ral gri dang pu ti bsnams pa/
analyzed: du a las a ra pa tsha na dmar po phyag gnyis na ral gri dang pu ti bsnams pa/
translated: In the east, from a, a red Arapacana arises, holding a sword and a book.

original: byang du ham las ye shes sku can/_ljang khu ral gri dang sna tshhogs rdo rje 'dzin pa/
analyzed: byang du ham las ye shes sku can/_ljang khu ral gri dang sna tshhogs rdo rje 'dzin pa/
translated: In the north, from ham, arises Jnanakaya, green, holding a sword and a vajra cross.🔽In the east, from a, a, i, and i, respectively, are generated Vajrasattva, Vajraraja, Rakta, and Siddhartha.

original: shar phyogs su a a i i bzhi las rdo rje sems dpa' dang /_rdo rje rgyal po dang / chags pa dang legs pa bzhi bskyed par bya'o/_/u u e e bzhi las rdo rje rin🔽chen dang /_gzi brjid dang /_rgyal mtshhan dang /_bzhad pa bzhi lho phyogs su
analyzed: shar phyogs su a a i i bzhi las rdo rje sems dpa' dang /_rdo rje rgyal po dang / chags pa dang legs pa bzhi bskyed par bya'o/_/u u e e bzhi las rdo rje rin chen dang /_gzi brjid dang /_rgyal mtshhan dang /_bzhad pa bzhi lho phyogs su
translated: From u, u, e, and e, respectively, are generated Vajraratna, Tejoraja, Dhvaja, and Hasita.

original: bskyed par bya'o/_/o o am a las chos rab dang /_rnon po dang /_'khor
analyzed: bskyed par bya'o/_/o o am a las chos rab dang /_rnon po dang /_'khor
translated: In the south, from o, o, am, and ah, respectively, are generated Dharmaprabha, Tikanaka, Cakravartin, and Vit.🔽In the west, from a, a, e, and ai, respectively, are generated Vajrakarma, Raksa, Yaksha, and Mudgara.

original: lo pa dang /_smu ba bzhi nub du'o/_/a a e e bzhi las rdo rje las dang / bsrung ba dang /_gnod sbyin dang /_khu tshhur bzhi byang du'o/_/'khyams la
analyzed: lo pa dang /_smu ba bzhi nub du'o/_/a a e e bzhi las rdo rje las dang / bsrung ba dang /_gnod sbyin dang /_khu tshhur bzhi byang du'o/_/'khyams la
translated: In the north, from o, o, am, and ah, respectively, are generated Bhadra, Bhadrakarnin, Bhadravajra, and Bhadra.

original: skal bzang bcu drug_/sgo dang gru chad zur la yo byad ma lha mo bcu gnyis bskyed
analyzed: skal bzang bcu drug_/sgo dang gru chad zur la yo byad ma lha mo bcu gnyis bskyed
translated: In the intermediate directions, generate the twelve goddesses of the articles.

original: la rigs kyi bdag pos mtshhan pa dang /_ye shes pa spyan drang zhing mchod nas/
analyzed: la rigs kyi bdag pos mtshhan pa dang /_ye shes pa spyan drang zhing mchod nas/
translated: The knowledge beings are invoked and offered worship.

original: bzlas pa bya ba ni/_thugs khar 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' mtshhon gang
analyzed: bzlas pa bya ba ni/_thugs khar 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' mtshhon gang
translated: The recitation is as follows: In the heart of Mañjuśrī is the awareness being Mañjuśrī, marked with the family type of the deity.

original: ba re'i thugs khar zla ba'i steng du a las wa gi shwa ris bskor bar bsams la/
analyzed: ba re'i thugs khar zla ba'i steng du a las wa gi shwa ris bskor bar bsams la/
translated: In the heart of each of those is an A, from which arises a Vairocana, surrounded by the mantra.

original: om wa gi shwa ri mu zhes ci rigs par bzlas la bstod pa byas la/_dbang gi cho ga
analyzed: om wa gi shwa ri mu zhes ci rigs par bzlas la bstod pa byas la/_dbang gi cho ga
translated: Recite the mantra Oṃ vajra-heruka as much as you can, and then do the praise.

original: bya ba ni 'jam dpal gsang ldan gyi'o/🔽tshan tra go mi'i lugs kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni tshhogs stshog pa yang sngon
analyzed: bya ba ni 'jam dpal gsang ldan gyi'o/ tshan tra go mi'i lugs kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni tshhogs stshog pa yang sngon
translated: The rite of empowerment is that of the Secret Assembly of Mañjuśrī.🔽The rite of the mandala of the Śata-Sahaśraka is as follows: Having previously gathered the accumulations, here the meditation on the mandala is as follows:

original: du song nas/_'dir dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ni/_'byung ba lnga'i dkyil
analyzed: du song nas/_'dir dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ni/_'byung ba lnga'i dkyil
translated: The mandala of the five elements is generated as before.

original: 'khor sngar bzhin bskyed la/_bru las gzhal yas khang rtsha ba'i lha bcu bdun/
analyzed: 'khor sngar bzhin bskyed la/_bru las gzhal yas khang rtsha ba'i lha bcu bdun/
translated: From the syllables arise the celestial mansion and the seventeen resident deities,

original: sems dpa' dang bcas pa yan lag gi lha rigs bsdus pa shakya thub pa la sogs
analyzed: sems dpa' dang bcas pa yan lag gi lha rigs bsdus pa shakya thub pa la sogs
translated: together with the bodhisattvas and the condensed family deities such as Śākyamuni.

original: pa bcu drug gi khyams dang /_sa lo dbang gi khyams dang /_dpal ldan rgyu skar🔽gyi khyams so/_/de ltar pho brang khyams bzhi rtsheg gzhal yas khang dang bcas pa
analyzed: pa bcu drug gi khyams dang /_sa lo dbang gi khyams dang /_dpal ldan rgyu skar gyi khyams so/_/de ltar pho brang khyams bzhi rtsheg gzhal yas khang dang bcas pa
translated: the courtyard of the sixteen vowels, the courtyard of the syllables of power, and the courtyard of the glorious planets.🔽Thus, having generated well the palace with the four courtyards and the celestial mansion, the generation of the deities within it is as follows:

original: legs par bskyed la/_de'i nang du lha bskyed pa ni/_mu hum tram hri ha rnams las/
analyzed: legs par bskyed la/_de'i nang du lha bskyed pa ni/_mu hum tram hri ha rnams las/
translated: From the seed syllables MU HUM TRAM HRĪH,

original: dbus su 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' zhal cig phyag bzhi pa'o/_/shar du🔽mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/🔽mi bskyod pa sa gnon gyi phyag rgya can no/_/lhor rin chen 'byung ldan/_mchog
analyzed: dbus su 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' zhal cig phyag bzhi pa'o/_/shar du mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/ mi bskyod pa sa gnon gyi phyag rgya can no/_/lhor rin chen 'byung ldan/_mchog
translated: in the center is Mañjuśrī Jñānasattva with one face and four arms.🔽In the east is Akṣobhya with the mudra of taming the earth.🔽In the south is Ratnasaṃbhava with the mudra of supreme generosity.🔽In the west is Amitābha in the mudra of equipoise.

original: sbyin gyi phyag rgya can/_nub du snang ba mtha' yas mnyam bzhag can/_byang🔽du don yod grub pa skyabs sbyin can no/_/de nas gru bzhir yum bzhi'o/_/
analyzed: sbyin gyi phyag rgya can/_nub du snang ba mtha' yas mnyam bzhag can/_byang du don yod grub pa skyabs sbyin can no/_/de nas gru bzhir yum bzhi'o/_/
translated: In the north is Amoghasiddhi in the mudra of granting refuge.🔽Then, in the four corners, are the four mothers.🔽In the four outer corners are the four goddesses beginning with Lāsya.

original: phyi'i gru bzhir bsgeg sogs bzhi po/_sgo bzhir sgo ma bzhi'o/_/de ni rtsha ba'i
analyzed: phyi'i gru bzhir bsgeg sogs bzhi po/_sgo bzhir sgo ma bzhi'o/_/de ni rtsha ba'i
translated: In the four gates are the four gate goddesses.

original: lha bcu bdun no/_/rigs bsdus par bzhengs na/_khyams dang po la/
analyzed: lha bcu bdun no/_/rigs bsdus par bzhengs na/_khyams dang po la/
translated: If you wish to erect the condensed family, on the first gallery🔽there are sixteen fortunate ones.

original: skal bzang bcu drug go/_/'khyams gnyis pa la rigs so so'i dkyil 'khor
analyzed: skal bzang bcu drug go/_/'khyams gnyis pa la rigs so so'i dkyil 'khor
translated: On the second gallery there are sixteen mandalas of the individual families.🔽The sixteen deities are:

original: bcu drug_/lha bcu drug ni/_shar phyogs su 'jam dpal kun tu zhal sku mdog🔽dkar ser/_gdong lnga pa po ti dang ut+pa la bsnams pa/_lho phyogs su thub
analyzed: bcu drug_/lha bcu drug ni/_shar phyogs su 'jam dpal kun tu zhal sku mdog dkar ser/_gdong lnga pa po ti dang ut+pa la bsnams pa/_lho phyogs su thub
translated: In the east, Mañjuśrī Samantaprabhāsa is white-yellow,🔽has five faces, and holds a scripture and an utpala.🔽In the south, Sage Yellow is yellow and makes the earth-touching gesture.

original: pa ser po sa gnon can/_nub phyogs su ye shes sems dpa' gser gtsho ma lta
analyzed: pa ser po sa gnon can/_nub phyogs su ye shes sems dpa' gser gtsho ma lta
translated: In the west, Jñānasattva is the color of molten gold,🔽holds a sword and a scripture, and is seated in vajra posture.

original: bu'i mdangs dang ldan pa phyag na ral gyi dang po ti bsnams pa/_byang phyogs su🔽gdong brgya pa zhal brgya la phyag nyis brgya yod pa ljang khu/_shar lhor rdo rje 'dzin
analyzed: bu'i mdangs dang ldan pa phyag na ral gyi dang po ti bsnams pa/_byang phyogs su gdong brgya pa zhal brgya la phyag nyis brgya yod pa ljang khu/_shar lhor rdo rje 'dzin
translated: In the north, Śākyamuni has a hundred faces,🔽each face has two hundred arms, and he is green.🔽In the southeast, Vajradhara is black and holds a khaṭvāṅga and a skull cup.

original: byed nag po kha tam dang thod pa 'dzin pa/_lho nub tu 'jam dpal gdong drug pa
analyzed: byed nag po kha tam dang thod pa 'dzin pa/_lho nub tu 'jam dpal gdong drug pa
translated: In the southwest, Mañjuśrī Ṣaṇmukha is red and holds a sword and a scripture.

original: mthing kha rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa/_nub byang du ya ma ra tsha mthing kha rdo rje dang thod pa 'dzin pa/_byang shar du go'u ta ma ser po phyags shing thogs pa/_shar🔽stod du tshhangs pa ser po zhal bzhi pa pad+ma thogs pa/_shar smad du drang srong phur
analyzed: mthing kha rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa/_nub byang du ya ma ra tsha mthing kha rdo rje dang thod pa 'dzin pa/_byang shar du go'u ta ma ser po phyags shing thogs pa/_shar stod du tshhangs pa ser po zhal bzhi pa pad+ma thogs pa/_shar smad du drang srong phur
translated: In the northwest is Yamāntaka, blue, holding a vajra and a skull cup. In the northeast is Gautama, yellow, holding a broom.

original: bu ser po bgrang phreng bsnams pa/_lho stod du dur khrod lang kha ljang nag mgo
analyzed: bu ser po bgrang phreng bsnams pa/_lho stod du dur khrod lang kha ljang nag mgo
translated: In the east is Brahmā, yellow, with four faces and holding a lotus. In the southeast is the sage Durā, yellow, holding a rosary.

original: bcu lag pa nyi shu pa/_lho smad du bdud dud kha mda' gzhu thogs pa/_nub🔽stod du lha khyab 'jug dkar po rdo rje rdzi thogs pa/_nub smad du lha'i dbang po🔽brgya sbyin dkar po pi wam 'dzin pa/_byang stod du lha min rgyal po dmar po ral
analyzed: bcu lag pa nyi shu pa/_lho smad du bdud dud kha mda' gzhu thogs pa/_nub stod du lha khyab 'jug dkar po rdo rje rdzi thogs pa/_nub smad du lha'i dbang po brgya sbyin dkar po pi wam 'dzin pa/_byang stod du lha min rgyal po dmar po ral
translated: In the south is the twenty-armed, ten-headed green Kālarātri. In the southwest is the red Māra, holding a bow and arrow.🔽In the west is Viṣṇu, white, holding a vajra plow. In the northwest is Indra, white, holding a lute.

original: gri 'dzin pa/_byang smad du phyag rdor ljang khu rdo rje thogs pa'o/_/yang shar
analyzed: gri 'dzin pa/_byang smad du phyag rdor ljang khu rdo rje thogs pa'o/_/yang shar
translated: In the north is the red king of the demigods, holding a sword. In the northeast is green Vajrapāṇi, holding a vajra.

original: phyogs kyi khyams la sa bcu gnyis kyi lha mo rnams zhal cig pa/_phyag gnyis pa/
analyzed: phyogs kyi khyams la sa bcu gnyis kyi lha mo rnams zhal cig pa/_phyag gnyis pa/
translated: The goddesses of the twelve stages on the surrounding porticoes have one face and two arms.🔽All their right hands hold vajras.

original: g.yas pa thams cad rdo rje thogs pa lhag par mos pa'i lha mo dmar mo/_pad+ma
analyzed: g.yas pa thams cad rdo rje thogs pa lhag par mos pa'i lha mo dmar mo/_pad+ma
translated: The goddess of the especially exalted stage is red and holds a lotus.

original: 'dzin pa/_rab tu dga' ba ser mo nor bu 'dzin pa/_dri ma med pa dkar
analyzed: 'dzin pa/_rab tu dga' ba ser mo nor bu 'dzin pa/_dri ma med pa dkar
translated: The pure stage is white and holds a crystal.🔽The illuminating stage is red and holds the sun.

original: mo chu shel 'dzin pa/_'od byed ma dmar mo nyi ma 'dzin pa/_'od 'phro ma
analyzed: mo chu shel 'dzin pa/_'od byed ma dmar mo nyi ma 'dzin pa/_'od 'phro ma
translated: The radiant stage is green and holds an utpala.

original: ljang khu ut+pa la 'dzin pa/_sbyang dka' ba ser mo ma rag ta bsnams pa/
analyzed: ljang khu ut+pa la 'dzin pa/_sbyang dka' ba ser mo ma rag ta bsnams pa/
translated: The difficult to conquer stage is yellow and holds a skull cup.🔽The manifest stage is yellow and holds a Dharma text.

original: mngon du gyur pa ser mo chos bsnams pa/_ring du song ba sngon mo pad+ma rdo rje
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa ser mo chos bsnams pa/_ring du song ba sngon mo pad+ma rdo rje
translated: The far reaching stage is blue and holds a lotus and vajra.

original: thogs pa/_mi g.yo ba dkar po pad+ma rdo rje bsnams pa/_legs pa'i blo gros ma
analyzed: thogs pa/_mi g.yo ba dkar po pad+ma rdo rje bsnams pa/_legs pa'i blo gros ma
translated: The immovable stage is white and holds a lotus and vajra.🔽The excellent wisdom stage is white and holds a sword and utpala.

original: dkar mo ral gri ud pa la/_chos kyi sprin ser mo spo ti 'dzin pa/_kun
analyzed: dkar mo ral gri ud pa la/_chos kyi sprin ser mo spo ti 'dzin pa/_kun
translated: The cloud of Dharma stage is yellow and holds a Dharma text.🔽The all illuminating stage is white and yellow and holds the body of a tathagata.

original: tu 'od ma dkar ser de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'dzin pa'o/_/lho phyogs su pha
analyzed: tu 'od ma dkar ser de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'dzin pa'o/_/lho phyogs su pha
translated: In the south,

original: rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis ni/_phyag gnyis kyi g.yas pa rin po che 'dzin pa la/
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis ni/_phyag gnyis kyi g.yas pa rin po che 'dzin pa la/
translated: The twelve perfections are as follows:

original: g.yon pa ram gyi phyag mtshhan 'dzin pa ni/_shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma ser mo
analyzed: g.yon pa ram gyi phyag mtshhan 'dzin pa ni/_shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma ser mo
translated: The perfection of wisdom is yellow Pāṇḍaravāsinī, holding a book.

original: spo ti 'dzin pa/_sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dkar dmar 'bras kyi snye ma 'dzin
analyzed: spo ti 'dzin pa/_sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dkar dmar 'bras kyi snye ma 'dzin
translated: The perfection of generosity is red and white, holding a sheaf of rice.🔽The perfection of moral discipline holds a branch of an aśoka tree with flowers.

original: pa/_tshhul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa/_mya ngan med pa'i yal ga me tog dang bcas pa 'dzin pa/_bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ser mo chu skyes dkar po
analyzed: pa/_tshhul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa/_mya ngan med pa'i yal ga me tog dang bcas pa 'dzin pa/_bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ser mo chu skyes dkar po
translated: The perfection of patience is yellow, holding a white lotus.

original: 'dzin pa/_brtshon 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dmar po ud pa la 'dzin pa/🔽bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon mo pad+ma 'dzin pa/_thabs kyi pha rol tu
analyzed: 'dzin pa/_brtshon 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dmar po ud pa la 'dzin pa/ bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon mo pad+ma 'dzin pa/_thabs kyi pha rol tu
translated: The perfection of diligence is red, holding a blue lotus.🔽The perfection of concentration is blue, holding a lotus.🔽The perfection of skillful means is green, holding a vajra.

original: phyin pa ljang khu rdo rje 'dzin pa/_smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon mo ral gri
analyzed: phyin pa ljang khu rdo rje 'dzin pa/_smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon mo ral gri
translated: The perfection of aspiration is blue, holding a sword.

original: 'dzin pa/_stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dmar mo chos gos 'dzin pa/_ye shes🔽kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dkar mo byang chub kyi shing 'dzin pa/_rdo rje las kyi pha rol
analyzed: 'dzin pa/_stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dmar mo chos gos 'dzin pa/_ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dkar mo byang chub kyi shing 'dzin pa/_rdo rje las kyi pha rol
translated: The perfection of strength is red and holds a Dharma robe. The perfection of wisdom is white and holds a tree of awakening.🔽The perfection of action is yellow and holds a wheel.🔽

original: tu phyin pa mthing kha rdo rje thogs pa/_pad+ma las kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dmar mo zla
analyzed: tu phyin pa mthing kha rdo rje thogs pa/_pad+ma las kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dmar mo zla
translated: the perfection of strength, red, holding a Dharma robe; the perfection of wisdom, white, holding a tree of awakening; the perfection of vajra activity, blue, holding a vajra; and the perfection of lotus activity, red, holding a moon.

original: ba 'dzin pa'o/_/nub tu dbang bcu'i lha mo ni/_phyag gnyis kyi g.yas pa🔽rnams kyis pad+ma 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa rnams kyis rang rang gi phyag mtshhan 'dzin🔽mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/

translated: In the west, the ten goddesses of power are as follows:

original: pa ni tshhe la dbang ba ma ni dkar dmar gyi mdog can sangs rgyas tshhe dpag med
analyzed: pa ni tshhe la dbang ba ma ni dkar dmar gyi mdog can sangs rgyas tshhe dpag med
translated: The goddess of power over life is white and red, holding the form of an infinite number of buddhas.🔽The goddess of power over mind is white, holding a five-pronged vajra.🔽The goddess of power over appearance is yellow, holding a victory banner.

original: kyi sku 'dzin pa/_sems la dbang ma ni dkar mo rdo rje rtshe lnga 'dzin pa/_po byad la dbang ma ser mo rgyal mtshhan 'dzin pa/_las la dbang ma ljang khu sna
analyzed: kyi sku 'dzin pa/_sems la dbang ma ni dkar mo rdo rje rtshe lnga 'dzin pa/_po byad la dbang ma ser mo rgyal mtshhan 'dzin pa/_las la dbang ma ljang khu sna
translated: The goddess of power over action is green, holding a sword.🔽The goddess of power over speech is red, holding a lotus.🔽The goddess of power over wealth is yellow, holding a jewel.🔽The goddess of power over birth is white, holding a vase.🔽The goddess of power over devotion is red, holding a lotus.🔽The goddess of power over miracles is blue, holding a wheel.

original: tshhogs rdo rje 'dzin pa/_skye ba la dbang ba mo sku mdog sna tshhogs pa sman 'dzin pa/
analyzed: tshhogs rdo rje 'dzin pa/_skye ba la dbang ba mo sku mdog sna tshhogs pa sman 'dzin pa/
translated: The assembly of goddesses is as follows:🔽Vajra Holder is white and holds a vajra.🔽Vajra Holder of the Tsok is multicolored and holds medicine.🔽Vajra Holder of Birth is multicolored and holds a medicine vase.

original: rdzu 'phrul dbang mo sngon mo nyi zla 'dzin pa/_mos pa la dbang ba mo dkar mo me
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dbang mo sngon mo nyi zla 'dzin pa/_mos pa la dbang ba mo dkar mo me

original: ye shes la dbang ba sngon mo ral gri 'dzin pa/_chos la dbang ma dkar mo bum🔽pa 'dzin pa/_de bzhin nyid ma dkar mo pad+ma 'dzin pa/_sangs rgyas byang

analyzed: chub sems ma ser po 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du gzungs ma bcu gnyis ni/

analyzed: 'dzin pa/_'od zer can dkar dmar khab skud 'dzin pa/_ri khrod ma ljang

analyzed: gnyis dkar po dang dmar po bgrang phreng dang ud pal thogs pa'o/_/gru chad

analyzed: bzhi la mchod pa'i lha mo bzhi dang /_sgo bzhir sgo ma bzhi'o spyan drang zhing mchod

original: phyag na rdo rje thugs kyi dal gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsags
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje thugs kyi dal gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsags

translated: The accumulation of the accumulations and the creation of the maṇḍala of the five elements are the same as before.🔽Here, a four-spoked wheel with a surrounding fence and gates is created from bhrūṃ.

analyzed: dbus su hum las phyag na rdo rje/_rtshibs bzhi la rnam snang la sogs pa rigs bzhi/

analyzed: bsags pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dal bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir bru las

analyzed: 'khor lo rtshibs bcu gnyis pa gru chad la sgo btod pa can byas la/_lha bsgom

analyzed: pa ni/_pad+ma dang zla ba'i steng du/_khro bo me ltar 'bar ba 'thing kha/_rtshibs

translated: On the four left spokes, meditate on Kālarātri, Karma Rākṣasī, Doni, and Mahābhairava.

original: gyi srin mo/_thabs kyi srin mo bzhi bskyed/_dus kyi lcags kyu zhags pa ma la🔽sogs pa bzhi bskyed/_thams cad sku mdog mthing nag rdo rje dang thod pa
analyzed: gyi srin mo/_thabs kyi srin mo bzhi bskyed/_dus kyi lcags kyu zhags pa ma la sogs pa bzhi bskyed/_thams cad sku mdog mthing nag rdo rje dang thod pa
translated: The four rākṣasīs—the rākṣasī of the east, the rākṣasī of the south, the rākṣasī of the west, and the rākṣasī of the north—are generated.🔽The four—the hook of time, the noose of time, the chain of time, and the bell of time—are generated.

original: thogs pa'o/_/spyan drangs la mchod pa bya zlas pa ni/_om badzra pa ni hri ta🔽tish+ta hum zhes ci rigs par zlas la bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni/_me
analyzed: thogs pa'o/_/spyan drangs la mchod pa bya zlas pa ni/_om badzra pa ni hri ta tish+ta hum zhes ci rigs par zlas la bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni/_me
translated: All of them have dark-blue bodies, hold vajras, and hold skull cups.

original: ltar 'bar ba'i'o/_/🔽mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: ltar 'bar ba'i'o/_/ mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: After the praise, the empowerment is conferred.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dal chen po bskyed pa ni/_rdo rje slob dpon gyis chas
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dal chen po bskyed pa ni/_rdo rje slob dpon gyis chas
translated: The Great Maṇḍala of the Vajra Realm🔽The master should don the eight garments, go for refuge,

original: brgyad bzung ste/_skyabs su 'gro ba dang /_rdo rje dril bu byin gyis brlab pa
analyzed: brgyad bzung ste/_skyabs su 'gro ba dang /_rdo rje dril bu byin gyis brlab pa
translated: consecrate the vajra and bell,🔽consecrate the tongue and hand,

original: dang /_me ltar 'bar ba skyed cing lce lag byin gyis brlab pa ni/_khro bo'i cha
analyzed: dang /_me ltar 'bar ba skyed cing lce lag byin gyis brlab pa ni/_khro bo'i cha
translated: don the wrathful attire,

original: snga ma dang /_bsrung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom pa dang /_dal bsrung zhing spyan drang ba
analyzed: snga ma dang /_bsrung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom pa dang /_dal bsrung zhing spyan drang ba
translated: meditate on the protection wheel, and invite the protection wheel.

analyzed: dang /_phyag 'tshhal zhing mchod pa dang /_sdig pa bshag pa dang /_rjes su
translated: confessing misdeeds,🔽rejoicing,

analyzed: yid rang ba dang /_chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang /_mya ngan
translated: requesting to turn the wheel of dharma,🔽requesting not to pass into nirvana,🔽offering one’s body,🔽dedicating,🔽generating bodhicitta,

original: las mi 'da' bar zhu ba dang /_lus dbul ba dang /_bsngo ba bya ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang /_sdom pa bzung ba dang /_gzugs brnyan
analyzed: las mi 'da' bar zhu ba dang /_lus dbul ba dang /_bsngo ba bya ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang /_sdom pa bzung ba dang /_gzugs brnyan

analyzed: gyi lhar bskyed nas snyam pa'i thal mo dang /_rdo rje'i thal mo dang /_rdo rje

original: sdams pa'i thal mo dang /_bsdam pa dral ba dang /_ye shes dbab pa dang / dbab pa nye bar bsdu ba dang /_ngan song dgug cing sdig pa dral ba dang / dal snying khar bsdu ba dang /_mngon par byang chub pa lngas lhar skyed la byin gyis
analyzed: sdams pa'i thal mo dang /_bsdam pa dral ba dang /_ye shes dbab pa dang / dbab pa nye bar bsdu ba dang /_ngan song dgug cing sdig pa dral ba dang / dal snying khar bsdu ba dang /_mngon par byang chub pa lngas lhar skyed la byin gyis
translated: generating the deity through the five manifest awakenings and blessing,🔽meditating with samādhi,

analyzed: brlab pa dang /_ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgom pa dang /_snying khar dbang bskur
translated: empowering the heart,

analyzed: ba dang /_rdo rje brtul zhugs blang ba dang /_rnal 'byor chen po bskyed pa
translated: the taking of the vajra and bell, the great yoga of creation,

analyzed: dang /_rjes su rnal 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams la bzhugs pa dang / byin brlabs dang dbang bskur ba dang /_mchod pa dang bstod pa byas la/

analyzed: bdag nyid thabs kyi 'khor lo rdzogs par byas te/_ye shes kyi sas sbyong stong pa

analyzed: nyid bsgoms pa dang /_rdo rje'i sas sbyong 'byung ba rim rtsheg gzhal yas khang

analyzed: gdan dang bcas par bskyed pa dang /_'chi ba'i srid pa lus ri rab kyi khar

analyzed: bzhag pa dang /_srid pa bar ma dor bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa bsgom

analyzed: pa dang /_skye ba'i rnal 'byor byang chub sems dpa' don grub du bskyed pa'i mi

analyzed: g.yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la slabs nas dang po sbyor ba dang dal rgyal mchog skyed pa

analyzed: ni/_gling dang nye ba'i gling bran dang /_ri dang mtshho las bskor ba'i ri rab

analyzed: kyi steng du gzhal yas khang /_de'i dbus su seng ge'i steng du sna tshhogs pad+ma'i

analyzed: steng du/_bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje'i skyil krungs kyis gnas

analyzed: pa dkar po nyi ma'i rgyab yol can/_zhal bzhi pa/_dkar po dang /_ser po

analyzed: dang /_dmar po dang /_ljang khu'i zhal la sangs rgyas lnga dang /_rin po

analyzed: che'i brgyan sna tshhogs kyis brgyan pa la/_a b+h+ya'i bzhed kyis/_phyag brgyad pa

analyzed: la/_'dir ni phyag gnyis pa chos 'chad kyi phyag rgya can 'khor lo 'dzin pa'o/_/ phyogs bzhir rdo rje sems ma dang /_pad+ma'i sems ma dang /_las kyi sems ma
translated: Here, he has two arms and makes the gesture of teaching the dharma while holding a wheel.🔽In the four directions are the four: Vajrasattva, Padmasattva, Karma-

analyzed: dang bzhi/_rdo rje dang /_rin po che dang /_pad+ma dang /_sna tshhogs rdo rje

original: thogs pa'o/_/shar du glang po che'i steng du mi bskyod pa sngon po rdo rje rtshe lnga pa sa🔽gnon gyi tshhul du 'dzin pa/_'khor rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po rdo rje 'dzin pa/

translated: In the east, on an elephant, is blue Akṣobhya, with five-pronged vajra to his crown,🔽holding a vajra-marked bell to his heart. His retinue is white Vajrasattva, holding a vajra;

analyzed: rdo rje rgyal po ser po lcags kyu thogs pa/_rdo rje chags pa dmar po mda' thogs

analyzed: pa/_legs pa ljang khu rdo rje dang bcas pas thugs khar legs so sbyin pa'o/_/
translated: and green Vajra­bhadra, with a vajra, giving the gesture of praise at his heart.

analyzed: lho phyogs su rta'i steng du rin chen 'byung ldan ser po rdo rje skyil krungs rin po che
translated: In the south, on a horse, is yellow Ratnasaṃbhava, in vajra posture, holding a yellow

original: ser po gung mos bzung ste mchod sbyin gyi tshhul du byed pa'o/_/'khor lhor rdo rje🔽rin po che ser po rin po che thogs pa/_gzi brjid dmar ser nyi ma bsnams pa/
analyzed: ser po gung mos bzung ste mchod sbyin gyi tshhul du byed pa'o/_/'khor lhor rdo rje rin po che ser po rin po che thogs pa/_gzi brjid dmar ser nyi ma bsnams pa/
translated: jewel in his right hand in the gesture of generosity. His retinue is yellow Vajraratna, holding a jewel;🔽orange Vajratejas, holding the sun;

original: dpal 'bar sngon po rgyal mtshhan bsnams pa/_bzhad pa dkar po phreng ba
analyzed: dpal 'bar sngon po rgyal mtshhan bsnams pa/_bzhad pa dkar po phreng ba

analyzed: bsnams pa'o/_/nub du rma bya'i steng du snang ba mtha' yas dmar po mnyam bzhag gi 'thil na/_pad+ma bsnams pa la/_'khor rdo rje chos rab dkar

original: dmar nyi ma bsnams pa/_rnon po mdog sngo ba la ral gri 'dzin pa/_rdo rje rgyu🔽mngon par rtogs pa u tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: dmar nyi ma bsnams pa/_rnon po mdog sngo ba la ral gri 'dzin pa/_rdo rje rgyu mngon par rtogs pa u tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/

analyzed: mdog ser po 'khor lo bsnams pa/_smu ba dmar po rdo rje'i lce bsnams pa'o/_/

analyzed: byang du shang shang gi steng du don yod grub pa ljang khu skyabs sbyin gyi phyag rgya'i mthil na sna tshhogs rdo rje 'dzin pa la/_'khor rdo rje las rab 'ja'i mdog ltar bkra ba la sna tshhogs rdo rje thogs pa/_bsrung ba ser po go khrab thogs pa/
translated: In the north, on a śarabha, is green Amoghasiddhi in the mudra of granting refuge,🔽holding a multicolored vajra. His retinue is Vajrakarma, the color of coral, holding a multicolored vajra;

original: gnod sbyin mthing nag rdo rje mche ba thogs pa/_khu tshhur ser po rdo rje'i khu tshhur
analyzed: gnod sbyin mthing nag rdo rje mche ba thogs pa/_khu tshhur ser po rdo rje'i khu tshhur
translated: Rakṣa, yellow, holding armor; Yakṣa, dark blue, holding a vajra-fang; and Mudgara, yellow, holding a vajra mudgara.

original: bcangs pa'o/_/lhor bsgyeg mo dkar mo rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa/_lho nub
analyzed: bcangs pa'o/_/lhor bsgyeg mo dkar mo rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa/_lho nub
translated: In the south, white Utpala Lady holds a vajra and a bell.

original: tu phreng ba ma ser mo me tog gi phreng ba thogs pa/_nub byang du glu mkhan ma🔽dmar mo pi wam thogs pa/_byang shar du gar ma ljang khu/_rdo rje dang dril bus
analyzed: tu phreng ba ma ser mo me tog gi phreng ba thogs pa/_nub byang du glu mkhan ma dmar mo pi wam thogs pa/_byang shar du gar ma ljang khu/_rdo rje dang dril bus
translated: In the southwest, yellow Garland Lady holds a flower garland.🔽In the northwest, red Songstress Lady holds a veena.🔽In the northeast, green Dancer Lady holds a vajra and a bell and dances.

original: gar bsgyur ba/_khyams kyi shar lhor bdug spos ma dkar mo bdug spos thogs pa/
analyzed: gar bsgyur ba/_khyams kyi shar lhor bdug spos ma dkar mo bdug spos thogs pa/
translated: In the southeast of the courtyard, white Incense Lady holds incense.🔽In the southwest, yellow Flower Lady holds flowers.

original: lho nub tu me tog ma ser mo me tog thogs pa/_nub byang du mar me ma dmar mo
analyzed: lho nub tu me tog ma ser mo me tog thogs pa/_nub byang du mar me ma dmar mo
translated: In the northwest, red Lamp Lady holds a lamp.

original: mar me thogs pa/_byang shar du dri chab ma ljang khu dri'i dung chos thogs pa'o/_/
analyzed: mar me thogs pa/_byang shar du dri chab ma ljang khu dri'i dung chos thogs pa'o/_/
translated: In the northeast, green Scent Lady holds a scent conch.

original: 'khyams la shar du/_byams pa/_mthong ba don yod/_ngan song kun 'dren🔽mya ngan mun 'joms rnams mi bskyod pa lta bu'o/_/lho phyogs su spos kyi glang po/
analyzed: 'khyams la shar du/_byams pa/_mthong ba don yod/_ngan song kun 'dren mya ngan mun 'joms rnams mi bskyod pa lta bu'o/_/lho phyogs su spos kyi glang po/
translated: In the courtyard, in the east, Maitreya, Amoghasiddhi, Sarvanivarana Viskambini, and Kshitigarbha are like Akshobhya.🔽In the south, Gandhahastin, Shuramgama, Akashagarbha, and Lokeshvara are like Ratnasambhava.🔽In the west, Avalokiteshvara, Manjushri, Nivaranavishkambhin, and Maitreya are like Amitabha.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba/_nam mkha' mdzod/_ye shes rtog rnams rin 'byung lta
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba/_nam mkha' mdzod/_ye shes rtog rnams rin 'byung lta
translated: In the north, Vajrapani, Kshitigarbha, Sarvanivarana Viskambini, and Amoghasiddhi are like Amoghasiddhi.

original: bu'o/_/nub tu 'od dpag med/_zla 'od gzhon nu bzang skyong /_dra ba🔽can gyi 'od rnams ni snang ba mtha' yas lta bu'o/_/byang du rdo rje snying po/_blo
analyzed: bu'o/_/nub tu 'od dpag med/_zla 'od gzhon nu bzang skyong /_dra ba can gyi 'od rnams ni snang ba mtha' yas lta bu'o/_/byang du rdo rje snying po/_blo
translated: In the west, Amitābha, Candraprabha, Kumārakānta, Bhadrapāla, and Jālinīprabha are all like Amitābha. In the north, Vajra­garbha,🔽Buddhi­garbha, and Vajrapāṇi are all like Akṣobhya.🔽

original: gros mi bzad pa/_spobs pa brtshegs pa dang /_kun tu bzang po rnams ni/
analyzed: gros mi bzad pa/_spobs pa brtshegs pa dang /_kun tu bzang po rnams ni/
translated: In the west are Amitābha, Candraprabha, Kumārakānta, Bhadrapāla, and Jālinīprabha, all of whom are like Amitābha. In the north are Vajra­garbha, Akṣayamati, Sāgaramati, Pratibhānakūṭa, and Samantabhadra, all of whom are like Amoghasiddhi.

original: don grub ltar ro/_/yang na bskal pa bzang po'i sangs rgyas stong byams pa man
analyzed: don grub ltar ro/_/yang na bskal pa bzang po'i sangs rgyas stong byams pa man
translated: Alternatively, you can visualize the thousand buddhas of the fortunate eon, with Maitreya and Mañjuśrī at the head, and short by four thousand.

original: chod du stong du bzhis ma tshhang ba bsgom par bya'o/_/sgo bzhir lcags kyu ma dang / zhags pa ma dang /_lcags sgrogs ma dang /_'bebs ma rnams dkar mo dang / ser mo dang /_dmar mo/_ljang khur bsgom par bya'o/_/rigs kyi bdag
analyzed: chod du stong du bzhis ma tshhang ba bsgom par bya'o/_/sgo bzhir lcags kyu ma dang / zhags pa ma dang /_lcags sgrogs ma dang /_'bebs ma rnams dkar mo dang / ser mo dang /_dmar mo/_ljang khur bsgom par bya'o/_/rigs kyi bdag
translated: At the four gates are Ankuśī, Pāśī, Sphoṭī, and Ākarṣī, all of whom are white, yellow, red, and green, respectively.

original: pos dbu mtshhan pa ni/_rnam snang la sogs pa lnga la ni rnam snang gis so/_/
analyzed: pos dbu mtshhan pa ni/_rnam snang la sogs pa lnga la ni rnam snang gis so/_/
translated: The heads of the deities of the five families are marked by Vairocana,

original: shar phyogs pa rnams la ni mi bskyod pas so/_/lho phyogs pa rnams la ni rin
analyzed: shar phyogs pa rnams la ni mi bskyod pas so/_/lho phyogs pa rnams la ni rin
translated: the deities of the eastern direction by Akṣobhya, the deities of the southern direction by Ratnasambhava,🔽the deities of the western direction by Amitābha, and the deities of the northern direction by Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'byung gis so/_/nub phyogs pa rnams la ni snang ba mtha' yas kyis so/_/
analyzed: 'byung gis so/_/nub phyogs pa rnams la ni snang ba mtha' yas kyis so/_/
translated: For those in the west, it is Amitābha.🔽For those in the north, it is Amoghasiddhi.

original: byang phyogs pa rnams la ni don grub kyis so/_/der dal rgyal mchog bsgoms🔽nas las rgyal mchog yang bsgoms la/_ye shes pa gzhug_/rgyas gdab/
analyzed: byang phyogs pa rnams la ni don grub kyis so/_/der dal rgyal mchog bsgoms nas las rgyal mchog yang bsgoms la/_ye shes pa gzhug_/rgyas gdab/
translated: Having meditated on the supreme king of the maṇḍala,🔽meditate on the supreme king of the maṇḍala of activity,🔽introduce the gnosis beings, seal,🔽and confer empowerment, as before.

original: dbang bskur ji lta bzhin bsgoms la/_om sarba ta tha ga ta ma ha yo go shwa ri hu~m
analyzed: dbang bskur ji lta bzhin bsgoms la/_om sarba ta tha ga ta ma ha yo go shwa ri hu~m
translated: Om sarva tathāgata mahā yoga śrī hūṃ🔽is the essence. Om vajra yakṣa hūṃ

original: zhes pa ni snying po'o/_/om badzra yak+sha hum/_zhes pa ni las thams cad pa'i
analyzed: zhes pa ni snying po'o/_/om badzra yak+sha hum/_zhes pa ni las thams cad pa'i
translated: is the mantra for all activities.

original: sngags so/_/de nas bstod pa byas la/_dal du bzhugs la dbang bskur ba ni
analyzed: sngags so/_/de nas bstod pa byas la/_dal du bzhugs la dbang bskur ba ni
translated: Then, having praised, the empowerment is conferred upon the maṇḍala.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi cho ga'i khyad par ro/_/
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi cho ga'i khyad par ro/_/
translated: This is the special feature of the Vajradhātu rite.🔽The actual practice of the maṇḍala of the Śrī Paramadya

original: dpal mchog dang po'i dal gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po'i dal gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa
translated: is to gather the accumulations,🔽generate the stages of the elements,

original: dang 'byung ba rim rtsheg bskyed nas/_bru las gzhal yas khang nang gling dgu gru
analyzed: dang 'byung ba rim rtsheg bskyed nas/_bru las gzhal yas khang nang gling dgu gru
translated: and from the bhrūṃ, the celestial mansion with nine chambers🔽is generated in the maṇḍala.

analyzed: bsnams pa'o/_/g.yas su lo ga dbang phyug dmar skya g.yon gyis pad+ma'i sdong bu thugs khar bzung ba g.yas kyis kha 'byed pa lta bu byed pa/_g.yon tu rdo rje

analyzed: gar ser ba rdo rje dril bus gar byed pa/_phyi nang gi sgo brgyad kyi shar sgo gnyis su/_rdo rje gzugs dmar skya me long thogs pa/_lho'i sgo gnyis su rdo rje sgra
translated: In the northwest, light-blue Vajra Great Nāga holds a lute. In the northeast, yellow Vajra Dance performs dance with vajra and bell.🔽In the two gates of the east, light-red Vajra Form holds a mirror.🔽In the two gates of the south, light-yellow Vajra Sound plays a lute.

analyzed: ser skya pi wang bsdung ba/_nub sgo gnyis su rdo rje dri sngo skya dung chos thogs pa/

analyzed: byang sgo gnyis su rdo rje ro ro mchog gi snod thogs pa'o/_/lha de rnams kyang zhi

analyzed: zhing sgyeg pa'i nyams dang ldan pa bri bar bya'o/_/phyi'i lha rnams la shar du dbang

analyzed: phyug chen po/_tshhangs pa/_lha chen po khyab 'jug_/kar ti ka_/brgya sbyin/

translated: In the south, the seven planets—the sun, moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, and Saturn—hold jewels.🔽In the west, the all-pervading, the powerful, the god of wealth, the completely victorious, the very victorious, the yakṣa, and the rākṣasa hold lotuses.

analyzed: bskur ba ni/_dpal mchog dang po'i cho ga'o/_/

analyzed: shakya rigs dbang dmar po mnyam bzhag mdzad pa/_byang du me tog cher rgyas

analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/ ljang gu skyabs sbyin mdzad pa/_zur bzhi sangs rgyas spyan ma la sogs pa yum bzhi/_rtshibs bcu drug la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa sems dpa' bcu
translated: The Realization: The Pearl Garland

analyzed: drug_/gru chad bzhi la sgyeg mo la sogs pa bzhi sgo bzhir sgo ma bzhi'o/_khyams nang ma la byams pa la sogs pa bcu drug_/khyams bar ma la nyon mongs mun sel la sogs pa dpe bral gyi sems dpa' bcu drug sku mdog dkar po dang / sngon po dang /_dmar po dang /_ljang gu dang /_phyag mtshhan rdo rje dang / rin po che dang /_pad+ma dang /_rgya gram 'dzin pa'o/_/'khyams phyi ma la sha
translated: The four corners are the four mothers, such as Buddhalocanā. The sixteen steps are the sixteen male bodhisattvas, such as Vajrasattva. The four arches are the four goddesses, such as Srigālajakrī. The four doors are the four door goddesses.

original: ri'i bu la sogs pa nyan thos bcu drug_/nyan thos kyi cha byad la po ti 'dzin pa
analyzed: ri'i bu la sogs pa nyan thos bcu drug_/nyan thos kyi cha byad la po ti 'dzin pa
translated: The inner courtyard has the sixteen male bodhisattvas, such as Maitreya. The middle courtyard has the sixteen male bodhisattvas, such as Klesatāpan, who are free from worldly examples. They are white, blue, red, and green in color and hold vajras, jewels, lotuses, and swords in their hands. The outer courtyard has the sixteen śrāvakas, such as Śāriputra. They are in the form of śrāvakas and hold books.

original: dang /_nyon mongs 'joms byed la sogs pa rang rgyal bcu gnyis lhung bzed🔽dang bsil byed 'dzin pa'o/_/'tshhams bzhi ru bdug sogs bzhi'o/_/sgo

analyzed: sogs dang /_dur ka ti ci rigs par bzlas la bstod pa byas la dbang bskur

analyzed: gtshug tor dgu'i lha tshhogs kyi dal bsgom pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/

original: tshhogs bsag pa sngon du song nas 'byung ba rim rtsheg bskyed la/_lha'i dal🔽bsgom pa ni bru las gzhal yang khang /_nang 'khor lo rtshibs brgyad/_lha
analyzed: tshhogs bsag pa sngon du song nas 'byung ba rim rtsheg bskyed la/_lha'i dal bsgom pa ni bru las gzhal yang khang /_nang 'khor lo rtshibs brgyad/_lha

analyzed: rnams mu khyud dang bcas pa bskyed nas/_lha bskyed pa ni mu las 'khor lo'i
translated: The meditation on the deity’s maṇḍala is as follows: From bhrūṃ arises the celestial mansion, inside of which is the eight-spoked wheel with the deities and the surrounding rim.

analyzed: dbus su bcom ldan 'das shakya seng ge ser po 'khor lo bsgyur ba'i cha byad chos

analyzed: 'chad byas pa/_shar du rdo rje gtshug tor dkar po sa gnon mdzad pa/_lho
