translated: in the south, blue Ratnoṣṇīṣa makes the mudra of giving gifts;

original: pad+ma'i gtshug tor dmar po ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya can/_byang du sna tshhogs🔽gtshug tor ljang gu skyabs sbyin gyi phyag rgya can/_shar lhor gtshug tor gzi
analyzed: pad+ma'i gtshug tor dmar po ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya can/_byang du sna tshhogs gtshug tor ljang gu skyabs sbyin gyi phyag rgya can/_shar lhor gtshug tor gzi
translated: in the west, red Padmoṣṇīṣa has the mudra of meditative equipoise;🔽in the north, multicolored Viśvoṣṇīṣa makes the mudra of granting refuge;🔽in the southeast, Uṣṇīṣa-Vikaṭa is white with a reddish tinge, holding the sun;🔽in the southwest, Uṣṇīṣa-Āṭṭahāsa is red with a reddish tinge, holding the moon;

original: brjid sku mdog dkar ba la dmar ba'i mdog yod pa/_nyi ma bsnams pa/
analyzed: brjid sku mdog dkar ba la dmar ba'i mdog yod pa/_nyi ma bsnams pa/
translated: in the northwest, Uṣṇīṣa-Sitātapatra is white with a reddish tinge, holding a parasol;🔽and in the northeast, Uṣṇīṣa-Vidyādharī is green with a reddish tinge, holding a sword.

original: lho nub du gtshug tor rgyal mtshhan dmar nag rgyal mtshhan thogs pa/_nub byang
analyzed: lho nub du gtshug tor rgyal mtshhan dmar nag rgyal mtshhan thogs pa/_nub byang
translated: In the southwest, red-black Uṣṇīṣa Dhvaja holds a victory banner. In the northwest,

original: du gtshug tor rnon po sngon po ral gri thogs pa/_byang shar du gtshug tor🔽gdugs dkar dkar po gdugs thogs pa/_sgyeg sogs bzhi dang /_bdug
analyzed: du gtshug tor rnon po sngon po ral gri thogs pa/_byang shar du gtshug tor gdugs dkar dkar po gdugs thogs pa/_sgyeg sogs bzhi dang /_bdug
translated: blue Uṣṇīṣa Tīkṣṇa holds a sword. In the northeast, white Uṣṇīṣa Sitātapatrā

original: sogs bzhi dang /_skal bzangs bcu drug dang /_sgo bzhi ni sngar ltar ro/_/
analyzed: sogs bzhi dang /_skal bzangs bcu drug dang /_sgo bzhi ni sngar ltar ro/_/
translated: holds a parasol. The four beginning with Śṛīgarbha, the four beginning with Dhūpā, the sixteen Bhadrakalpas, and the four gates are as before.

original: ye shes pa gzhug pa dang /_mchod pa dang /_om mu ne mu ne ma ha mu ne ye swa ha/
analyzed: ye shes pa gzhug pa dang /_mchod pa dang /_om mu ne mu ne ma ha mu ne ye swa ha/
translated: Invite the awareness beings, make offerings, and recite Oṃ mune mune mahāmuneye svāhā.

original: zhes ci rigs par bzlas nas stod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni/_gtshug
analyzed: zhes ci rigs par bzlas nas stod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni/_gtshug
translated: After reciting this as much as appropriate, the empowerment conferral is done.

original: tor chen po dgu'i cho ga'o/_/
analyzed: tor chen po dgu'i cho ga'o/_/
translated: This is the ritual of the nine great uṣṇīṣas.

original: don thams cad grub pa'i dal gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsag🔽pa dang 'byung ba rim rtsheg skyed pa sngon du song nas/_'dir bye las rdo rje
analyzed: don thams cad grub pa'i dal gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba rim rtsheg skyed pa sngon du song nas/_'dir bye las rdo rje
translated: The manifest realization of the maṇḍala of all purposes accomplished is as follows:🔽After the preliminary accumulations of merit and the generation of the stages of the elements,🔽here, after the vajra space is generated from bhrūṃ,

original: dbyings kyi pho brang 'dra ba bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni hri las pad+ma/_de la don
analyzed: dbyings kyi pho brang 'dra ba bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni hri las pad+ma/_de la don
translated: the generation of the deities is as follows: The lotus arises from hriḥ.

original: grub 'od dpag med pa'i rang bzhin can dmar po la rigs bzhi'i 'khor lo
analyzed: grub 'od dpag med pa'i rang bzhin can dmar po la rigs bzhi'i 'khor lo
translated: The principal figure is red Vairochana, the nature of the accomplished Buddha Amitabha, surrounded by the four wheel-turning kings.

original: sgyur ba bzhis bskor ba/_shar gyi le rtshe la don grub mi bskyod pa'i rigs la rdo rje🔽sems dpa' la sogs bzhis bskor ba/_lhor don grub rin chen 'byung ldan gyi
analyzed: sgyur ba bzhis bskor ba/_shar gyi le rtshe la don grub mi bskyod pa'i rigs la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs bzhis bskor ba/_lhor don grub rin chen 'byung ldan gyi
translated: In the east, Amoghasiddhi of the Akshobhya family is surrounded by Vajrasattva and the others.🔽In the south, Amoghasiddhi of the Ratnasambhava family is surrounded by Ratnasattva and the others.

original: rigs la/_rin chen sems dpa' bzhis bskor ba/_nub tu don grub snang ba🔽mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/🔽mtha' yas la pad+ma'i sems dpa' la sogs pa bzhis bskor ba/_byang du
analyzed: rigs la/_rin chen sems dpa' bzhis bskor ba/_nub tu don grub snang ba mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/ mtha' yas la pad+ma'i sems dpa' la sogs pa bzhis bskor ba/_byang du
translated: In the west, Amoghasiddhi of the Amitabha family is surrounded by Padmasattva and the others.🔽In the north, Amoghasiddhi of the Amoghasiddhi family is surrounded by Karma-sattva and the others.

original: don yod grub pa la las kyi sems dpa' bzhis bskor ba/_zur bzhi la yum bzhi/
analyzed: don yod grub pa la las kyi sems dpa' bzhis bskor ba/_zur bzhi la yum bzhi/
translated: The four mothers are in the four corners,

original: lha mo bcu gnyis dang bskal bzang bcu drug bskyed pa rdo rje dbyings lta bu'o/_/
analyzed: lha mo bcu gnyis dang bskal bzang bcu drug bskyed pa rdo rje dbyings lta bu'o/_/
translated: and the twelve goddesses and the sixteen of the fortunate eon are generated like in the mandala of Vajradhatu.

original: spyan drang zhing mchod pa dang /_om pad+ma d+ha ma hri zhes pa'i sngags bzlas la
analyzed: spyan drang zhing mchod pa dang /_om pad+ma d+ha ma hri zhes pa'i sngags bzlas la
translated: Invite the deities, make offerings, and recite the mantra om padma dhama hri.

original: bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni don thams cad grub pa'i cho ga'o/_/🔽'gro ba 'dul ba'i dal gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa
analyzed: bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni don thams cad grub pa'i cho ga'o/_/ 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dal gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa
translated: The empowerment conferral after the praise is the ritual of accomplishing all aims.🔽The ritual of the mandala of Subjugation of mara is as follows: The accumulation of merit,🔽the creation of the mandala, and the creation of the deities are the same as for the mandala of the Vajra Element.

original: dang dal bskyed pa rdo rje dbyings ltar la/_lha bskyed pa ni/_'gro ba 'dul ba'i
analyzed: dang dal bskyed pa rdo rje dbyings ltar la/_lha bskyed pa ni/_'gro ba 'dul ba'i
translated: The creation of the deities is as follows: The principal figure is Subjugation of Mara,

original: rnam snang /_rin 'byung gi cha lugs yum bzhi'i rang bzhin 'khor lo bsgyur ba
analyzed: rnam snang /_rin 'byung gi cha lugs yum bzhi'i rang bzhin 'khor lo bsgyur ba
translated: the nature of the four mothers, surrounded by the four chakravartin kings.

original: bzhis bskor ba/_phyogs bzhi'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi la phyogs phyogs kyi🔽sems dpa' bcu drug gis bskor ba dang /_gru bzhir yum bzhi dang /_lha mo bcu
analyzed: bzhis bskor ba/_phyogs bzhi'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi la phyogs phyogs kyi sems dpa' bcu drug gis bskor ba dang /_gru bzhir yum bzhi dang /_lha mo bcu
translated: The four tathagatas of the four directions are surrounded by the sixteen male bodhisattvas of the four directions.🔽The four mothers and the twelve goddesses are in the four corners, and the sixteen fortunate ones are as before.

original: gnyis dang /_skal bzangs bcu drug gong ltar ro/_/spyan drang ba dang /_mchod pa
analyzed: gnyis dang /_skal bzangs bcu drug gong ltar ro/_/spyan drang ba dang /_mchod pa
translated: After inviting them, making offerings,

original: dang /_om rad na b+ha dzi ni tram/_zhes zlas la/_bstod nas/_dbang bskur ba ni
analyzed: dang /_om rad na b+ha dzi ni tram/_zhes zlas la/_bstod nas/_dbang bskur ba ni
translated: and praising them with the mantra “Om ratna bhajra traam,” the empowerment conferral is as follows:

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dal gyi cho ga'o/
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dal gyi cho ga'o/
translated: This is the ritual of the mandala of Subjugation of Mara.

original: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i dal gyi cho ga'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i dal gyi cho ga'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/
translated: The manifest realization of the ritual of the mandala of the conqueror of the three realms is as follows:

original: tshhogs bsag pa dang dal bskyed pa rdo rje dbyings ltar la/_'di ltar bskyed🔽pa ni/_dbus su hum las khro bo khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba sku mdog nam🔽mkha' ltar sngo ba zhal cig phyag gnyis pa/_rdo rje dang dril bu 'phyar ba/
analyzed: tshhogs bsag pa dang dal bskyed pa rdo rje dbyings ltar la/_'di ltar bskyed pa ni/_dbus su hum las khro bo khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba sku mdog nam mkha' ltar sngo ba zhal cig phyag gnyis pa/_rdo rje dang dril bu 'phyar ba/
translated: The accumulation of the accumulations and the creation of the mandala are like the vajra realm, but the creation is as follows:🔽In the center, from hūṃ, is the wrathful conqueror of the three realms, blue like the sky, with one face and two hands, brandishing a vajra and a bell.

original: zhabs gnyis g.yas skum pas dbang phyug chen po kha bub du mnan pa/_g.yon🔽skyang bas u ma de ba'i nu mar mnan pa'i phyogs bzhi na yum bzhi pho chas su
analyzed: zhabs gnyis g.yas skum pas dbang phyug chen po kha bub du mnan pa/_g.yon skyang bas u ma de ba'i nu mar mnan pa'i phyogs bzhi na yum bzhi pho chas su
translated: His two legs are in an alternating stance, with the right leg pressing down on the prone great lord and the left leg pressing on the breast of Umā Devī.

original: bsgyur ba'i 'khor lo bsgyur ba bzhi dang /_gru bzhir yum bzhi dang /_de'i shar
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i 'khor lo bsgyur ba bzhi dang /_gru bzhir yum bzhi dang /_de'i shar
translated: In the four directions are the four mothers transformed into male attire, the four wheel-turning [kings], and in the four corners the four mothers.

original: phyogs su mi bskyod pa'i khro bo hum mdzad la/_rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i khro
analyzed: phyogs su mi bskyod pa'i khro bo hum mdzad la/_rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i khro
translated: In the east is Akṣobhya’s wrathful one, Hūṃkara, surrounded by the four wrathful ones, Vajrasattva, and so on.

original: bo sems dpa' bzhis bskor ba/_lho phyogs su rin chen 'byung ldan hum mdzad kyi
analyzed: bo sems dpa' bzhis bskor ba/_lho phyogs su rin chen 'byung ldan hum mdzad kyi
translated: In the south is Ratnasaṃbhava’s Hūṃkara, surrounded by the four wrathful ones, Ratnasambhava, and so on.

original: khro bo la/_rdo rje rin chen la sogs khro bor gyur pa bzhis skor ba dang /_nub kyi le
analyzed: khro bo la/_rdo rje rin chen la sogs khro bor gyur pa bzhis skor ba dang /_nub kyi le
translated: For the wrathful deities, the four wrathful ones such as Vajra Ratna and so on surround the central deity.🔽For Amitābha in the west, the four wrathful ones such as Padma Sattvavajra surround him.

original: rtshe la 'od dpag med hum mdzad kyi khro bo la/_pad+ma'i sems dpa'i khro bo bzhi dang / de'i byang du don yod grub pa khro bo hum mdzad la las kyi hum mdzad la sogs pa'i khro🔽bo bzhis bskor ba'o/_/mchod pa'i lha mo bcu gnyis dang /_sems dpa' bcu
analyzed: rtshe la 'od dpag med hum mdzad kyi khro bo la/_pad+ma'i sems dpa'i khro bo bzhi dang / de'i byang du don yod grub pa khro bo hum mdzad la las kyi hum mdzad la sogs pa'i khro bo bzhis bskor ba'o/_/mchod pa'i lha mo bcu gnyis dang /_sems dpa' bcu
translated: To the north of him, the four wrathful ones such as Karma Hūṃkāra surround Amoghasiddhi Hūṃkāra.🔽The twelve offering goddesses and the sixteen sattvas are the same as above.

original: drug gong dang mthun/_'di rgyud kyang gi lha dgod pa yin/_'grel pa ltar na lo🔽ga las 'das pa'i lha brgya bcu rtsha lnga la sogs pa'i lha bzhi bcu zhe bzhi ste brgya
analyzed: drug gong dang mthun/_'di rgyud kyang gi lha dgod pa yin/_'grel pa ltar na lo ga las 'das pa'i lha brgya bcu rtsha lnga la sogs pa'i lha bzhi bcu zhe bzhi ste brgya
translated: This is the layout of the deities of the tantra.🔽According to the commentary, there are forty-four deities, such as the one hundred and fifty deities that transcend the ten directions, and so on.

original: nyi shu rtsha dgu yod/_spyan drang mchod pa dbul/_om sarba ta tha ga ta ma ha yo gi
analyzed: nyi shu rtsha dgu yod/_spyan drang mchod pa dbul/_om sarba ta tha ga ta ma ha yo gi
translated: There are one hundred and twenty-nine deities.🔽Invite them, offer the mandala, and recite the following as much as one likes:🔽oṃ sarva tathāgata mahā yoga śrī vajra-paṇi hūṃ

original: shwa ri badzra pa ni hum/_zhes ci rigs par zlas la/_bstod pa byas nas dbang
analyzed: shwa ri badzra pa ni hum/_zhes ci rigs par zlas la/_bstod pa byas nas dbang
translated: Having offered praise, offer the empowerment.

original: bskur ba ni khro bo khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi cho ga bya ba'i rim pa'o/_/
analyzed: bskur ba ni khro bo khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi cho ga bya ba'i rim pa'o/_/
translated: The consecration is the process of performing the ritual of wrathful Vanquisher of the Three Realms.

original: tshhe dpag tu med pa gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/
analyzed: tshhe dpag tu med pa gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/
translated: The realization of the immeasurable cloud of offerings mandala of speech is as follows.

original: tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba rim rtsheg bskyed pa sngar bstan pa bzhin la/
analyzed: tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba rim rtsheg bskyed pa sngar bstan pa bzhin la/
translated: Gather the accumulations and generate the elements in stages as previously explained.

original: 'dir bru las 'khor lo rtshibs bzhi gru chad sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed🔽pa ni/_dbus su hri las tshhe dpag tu med pa sku mdog dmar po phyag gnyis
analyzed: 'dir bru las 'khor lo rtshibs bzhi gru chad sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni/_dbus su hri las tshhe dpag tu med pa sku mdog dmar po phyag gnyis
translated: Here, generate the four-spoked wheel with turrets and gates from the syllable bhrūṃ.

original: mnyam gzhag byas pa'i phyag mthil du tshhe'i bum pa 'dzin pa la/_rtshibs bzhi la🔽rnam snang nub du byas pa'i rigs bzhis bskor ba/_mchod pa'i lha mo bzhi dang sgo
analyzed: mnyam gzhag byas pa'i phyag mthil du tshhe'i bum pa 'dzin pa la/_rtshibs bzhi la rnam snang nub du byas pa'i rigs bzhis bskor ba/_mchod pa'i lha mo bzhi dang sgo
translated: In the center, generate immeasurable cloud of offerings red in color with two hands in the gesture of meditative equipoise, holding a cloud of offerings vase in the palms of the hands, surrounded by the four families with Vairocana in the west.🔽There are four offering goddesses and four gate goddesses, making thirteen.

original: ma bzhi ste bcu gsum mo/_/spyan drang mchod pa byas la/_om pu ne pu ne om pun+ye pun+ye
analyzed: ma bzhi ste bcu gsum mo/_/spyan drang mchod pa byas la/_om pu ne pu ne om pun+ye pun+ye
translated: Invite them, make offerings, and recite: oṃ puṇe puṇe / oṃ puṇye puṇye / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / oṃ puṇyāṃ puṇyāṃ / o

original: ma ha pun+ye a pa ra mi ta a yu pun+ye dz+nya na sam b+ha ro b+ha chu swa ha/_zhes pa'i zlas pa
analyzed: ma ha pun+ye a pa ra mi ta a yu pun+ye dz+nya na sam b+ha ro b+ha chu swa ha/_zhes pa'i zlas pa
translated: mahāpuṇyāparimita āyurpuṇya jñāna sambharo bhavantu svāhā

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The Direct Realization of the Maṇi Pearl Tantra

original: byas la bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni tshhe dpag tu med pa'o/
analyzed: byas la bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni tshhe dpag tu med pa'o/
translated: Having praised, the empowerment is conferred, which is immeasurable.

original: bde ba chen po'i yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/
translated: The direct realization of the maṇḍala of the qualities of great bliss is as follows:

original: tshhogs stshog pa dang 'byung ba rim rtsheg skyed pa sngar ltar la/_'di'i pho brang
analyzed: tshhogs stshog pa dang 'byung ba rim rtsheg skyed pa sngar ltar la/_'di'i pho brang
translated: The accumulation of the assembly and the generation of the stages of the elements are as before.🔽The generation of the palace is as follows:🔽From hūṃ, generate a wheel with four spokes and eight segments, together with doors.

original: bskyed pa ni/_hu~m las 'khor lo rtshibs bzhi 'khyams rim pa brgyad/_sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni dbus su hum las badzra pa ni/_rtshibs
analyzed: bskyed pa ni/_hu~m las 'khor lo rtshibs bzhi 'khyams rim pa brgyad/_sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni dbus su hum las badzra pa ni/_rtshibs
translated: The generation of the deities is as follows: In the center, from hūṃ, is Vajrapāṇi.🔽On the four spokes are the four families.

original: bzhi la rigs bzhi/_gru chad bzhi la lha mo bzhi/_'khyams dang po la sangs
analyzed: bzhi la rigs bzhi/_gru chad bzhi la lha mo bzhi/_'khyams dang po la sangs
translated: On the four corners are the four goddesses.🔽On the first gallery are the seven generations of buddhas.

original: rgyas rabs bdun/_gnyis pa la sems dpa' bcu drug_/gsum pa la bskal
analyzed: rgyas rabs bdun/_gnyis pa la sems dpa' bcu drug_/gsum pa la bskal
translated: On the second are the sixteen bodhisattvas.🔽On the third are the ten wrathful ones.

original: bzang bcu drug_/bzhi pa la nyan thos bcu drug dang rang rgyal bcu gnyis/🔽lnga pa la lha brgyad chung ma dang bcas pa/_drug pa la gza' brgyad rgyu skar dang bcas pa/_bdun pa la rgyal po bzhi/_phyogs skyong dang bcas pa/_brgyad
analyzed: bzang bcu drug_/bzhi pa la nyan thos bcu drug dang rang rgyal bcu gnyis/ lnga pa la lha brgyad chung ma dang bcas pa/_drug pa la gza' brgyad rgyu skar dang bcas pa/_bdun pa la rgyal po bzhi/_phyogs skyong dang bcas pa/_brgyad
translated: On the fourth level, there are sixteen śrāvakas and twelve pratyekabuddhas.🔽On the fifth level, there are eight gods with their consorts; on the sixth level, there are eight planets with the lunar mansions; on the seventh level, there are four kings with the guardians of the directions; on the eighth level, there are the six or four families; and at the four gates, there are the four gatekeepers.

original: pa la rigs drug gam bzhi/_sgo bzhir sgo ba bzhi'o/_/rigs kyi bdag po lngas🔽dbu la mtshhan pa dang /_spyan drangs/_mchod pa byas la/_om badzra tshan d+ha
analyzed: pa la rigs drug gam bzhi/_sgo bzhir sgo ba bzhi'o/_/rigs kyi bdag po lngas dbu la mtshhan pa dang /_spyan drangs/_mchod pa byas la/_om badzra tshan d+ha
translated: The five family lords🔽are marked on the head, invited, and offered worship.🔽Recite the approach mantra, Oṃ vajra-caṇḍa mahāroṣaṇa hūṃ phaṭ,

original: ma ha ro sha na hum phat/_zhes bsnyen pa bskyal la/_bstod pa byas nas dbang
analyzed: ma ha ro sha na hum phat/_zhes bsnyen pa bskyal la/_bstod pa byas nas dbang
translated: and after offering praise, confer the empowerment.

original: bskur ba ni/_bde ba chen po yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'o/_/
analyzed: bskur ba ni/_bde ba chen po yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'o/_/
translated: This is the ritual of the maṇḍala of qualities of great bliss.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa lha sum cu so gnyis 'phags pa yab sras kyi
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa lha sum cu so gnyis 'phags pa yab sras kyi
translated: The meditation on the thirty-two deities of the glorious Guhyasamāja according to the system of the noble father and son

original: lugs kyi mngon par rtogs pa bsgom pa ni/_tshhogs stshog sngon du song nas 'byung
analyzed: lugs kyi mngon par rtogs pa bsgom pa ni/_tshhogs stshog sngon du song nas 'byung
translated: is as follows: After the preliminary gathering of the accumulations,

analyzed: bzlas la bstod pa byas la dbang bskur ba ni/_ye shes zhabs kyi'o/_/

analyzed: tshhogs stshog pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir

analyzed: tshhogs pad+ma dang nyi ma'i steng du 'jigs byed dang dus mtshhan g.yas bskum zhing

analyzed: g.yon brkyang ba/_sku mdog mthing kha/_zhal g.yas dkar ba/_g.yon

analyzed: dmar ba/_phyag drug gis rdo rje 'khor lo/_rin po che/_dril bu pad ma ral

translated: Upon the ten-spoked wheel, upon the seat of the ten great direction protectors lying prone,🔽in the east is Yamāntaka, in the south is Aparājita, in the west is Hayagrīva,🔽in the north is Amṛtakuṇḍali, in the southeast is Acala, in the southwest is Padman-teśvara,

original: byang du bdud rtshi 'khyil pa/_shar lhor mi g.yo ba/_lho nub tu 'dod pa'i rgyal
analyzed: byang du bdud rtshi 'khyil pa/_shar lhor mi g.yo ba/_lho nub tu 'dod pa'i rgyal

analyzed: po/_nub byang du dbyug sngon can/_byang shar du stobs po che/_steng du
translated: In the northwest is Nīladaṇḍa, in the northeast is Mahābala, and above is🔽Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin. Below is Sumbha.

original: gtshug tor 'khor lo bsgyur ba/_'og tu gnod mdzes 'phags skor ltar ro/_/
analyzed: gtshug tor 'khor lo bsgyur ba/_'og tu gnod mdzes 'phags skor ltar ro/_/

analyzed: lha mo bzhi dang 'di brgyad med kyang 'gal ba med sgo ma bzhi ni khro mo'i tshhugs can no/_/
translated: Although there is no contradiction if one does not have the four goddesses and these eight, the four gatekeepers have wrathful forms.🔽The seed syllable at the heart is hūṃ.

analyzed: thugs ka'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/spyan drangs la mchod pa bya ba ni/_/bzlas pa

analyzed: bya ba ni/_om badzra badzra hum ka ra badzra hum phat/_zhes bya ba ni rdo rje hum mdzad

analyzed: kyi snying po'i sngags so/_/las thams cad pa'i sngags ni/_om badzra kun d+ha li hum

analyzed: phat zhes so/_/bstod pa byas la dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje hum mdzad kyi'o/_/

original: 'jam dpal dgra nag lha bcu gsum ma'i mngon par rtogs pa ni tshhogs
analyzed: 'jam dpal dgra nag lha bcu gsum ma'i mngon par rtogs pa ni tshhogs
translated: The clear realization of the thirteen deities of Black Yamāri Mañjuśrī is as follows.

analyzed: bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir bru las

analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/

analyzed: pho brang gling dgu gru chad la sgo btod pa can byas la/_brten pa lha bskyed pa

analyzed: ni/_nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du gshin rje khyab 'jug pho mo bsgyel ba'i steng du/_ma he

analyzed: de'i steng du thig le/_de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje de yongs su gyur pa las

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal dgra nag sku mdog dang rtsha zhal mthing kha g.yas

analyzed: dkar ba/_g.yon dmar ba/_g.yas dang po rdo rje/_gnyis pa na ral gri/

analyzed: gsum pa na gri gug go/_/g.yon dang po na 'khor lo gnyis pa na pad+ma/_gsum

analyzed: can/_glang po che'i ko rlon gsol ba/_thod pa lnga bcu'i phreng ba byas pa/ yum rdo rje ro langs dmar ma zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma g.yas kyis gri gug bzung
translated: He wears an elephant skin and a garland of fifty skulls.

original: nas sku la 'khyud pa/_g.yon gyis thod pa khrag gis bskang ba zhal du stobs pa/
analyzed: nas sku la 'khyud pa/_g.yon gyis thod pa khrag gis bskang ba zhal du stobs pa/
translated: The mother is red Vajra Vetali with one face and two arms. She holds a curved knife with her right hand and embraces his body, and with her left hand she holds a skull cup filled with blood to his mouth.

original: shar du gti mug gshin rje gshed dkar po/_'khor lo dang dril bu bsnams pa
analyzed: shar du gti mug gshin rje gshed dkar po/_'khor lo dang dril bu bsnams pa
translated: In the east is white Delusion Yamāntaka, holding a chakram and a bell.

original: la yum badzra tshar tshi kas nag 'khyud pa'i phyag gis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa🔽lhor ser sna gshin rje gshed ser po rin po che dang dril bu thogs pa/_yum phag
analyzed: la yum badzra tshar tshi kas nag 'khyud pa'i phyag gis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa lhor ser sna gshin rje gshed ser po rin po che dang dril bu thogs pa/_yum phag
translated: He is embraced by the mother Vajra Vetālī, who holds a flaying knife and skull cup with her two hands.🔽In the south is yellow Jealousy Yamāntaka, holding a jewel and a bell.🔽The mother Varahi holds a flaying knife and skull cup.

original: mo gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa/_nub tu 'dod chags gshin rje gshed dmar
analyzed: mo gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa/_nub tu 'dod chags gshin rje gshed dmar
translated: In the west is red Passion Yamāntaka, holding a lotus and a bell.

original: po pad+ma dang dril bu thogs pa la/_yum dbyangs can ma gri gug dang thod pa
analyzed: po pad+ma dang dril bu thogs pa la/_yum dbyangs can ma gri gug dang thod pa
translated: The mother Sarasvatī holds a flaying knife and skull cup.

original: thogs pa/_byang du phrag dog gshin rje gshed ljang khu sna tshhogs rdo rje dang dril bu
analyzed: thogs pa/_byang du phrag dog gshin rje gshed ljang khu sna tshhogs rdo rje dang dril bu
translated: In the north is green Envy Yamāntaka, holding a vajra cross and a bell.

original: thogs pa la yum g+ho ri ma ljang khu gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o/_/gru chad bzhi
analyzed: thogs pa la yum g+ho ri ma ljang khu gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o/_/gru chad bzhi
translated: The mother green Ghorī holds a flaying knife and skull cup.🔽On the four corners are four vases marked with skull cups.

original: la bum pa bzhi'i steng du thod pas mtshhan pa/_sgo bzhi la shar du ya ma ra tsha
analyzed: la bum pa bzhi'i steng du thod pas mtshhan pa/_sgo bzhi la shar du ya ma ra tsha
translated: At the four doors, in the east is Yama Rākṣasa,

original: dkar po g.yas na rdo rje tho ba/_lho ru ya me do tsha ser po dbyug to thogs pa/
analyzed: dkar po g.yas na rdo rje tho ba/_lho ru ya me do tsha ser po dbyug to thogs pa/
translated: In the east, white Yamântaka holds a vajra hammer. In the south, yellow Yamântaka of the charnel ground holds a club.

original: nub tu ya da yo ni dmar po dgra sta thogs pa/_byang du yak+she ya tsha ljang khu ral
analyzed: nub tu ya da yo ni dmar po dgra sta thogs pa/_byang du yak+she ya tsha ljang khu ral
translated: In the west, red Yamântaka of the charnel ground holds an ax. In the north, green Yamântaka of the charnel ground holds a flaying knife and a skull cup.

original: gri thogs pa la g.yon thams cad sdigs mdzub gdengs pa'o/_/de dag thams
analyzed: gri thogs pa la g.yon thams cad sdigs mdzub gdengs pa'o/_/de dag thams
translated: All of them have threatening gestures with their left hands.🔽In the heart of each of them is a hand implement with a hūṃ at the hub.

original: cad kyi thugs khar phyag mtshhan de'i lte ba la hum/_de la hrihsh+tis sam bskor bar
analyzed: cad kyi thugs khar phyag mtshhan de'i lte ba la hum/_de la hrihsh+tis sam bskor bar
translated: Surround the hūṃ with the six syllables.

original: bsams la/_bcu bzhi pa/_spyan drang ba dang mchod pa dang /_bzlas pa dang bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni/_bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed
analyzed: bsams la/_bcu bzhi pa/_spyan drang ba dang mchod pa dang /_bzlas pa dang bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni/_bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed
translated: INVOKING THE WISDOM BEINGS, MAKING OFFERINGS, RECITING MANTRAS, PRAISING, AND EMPOWERMENT

original: dmar po'i mngon par rtogs pa'i cho ga'o/
analyzed: dmar po'i mngon par rtogs pa'i cho ga'o/
translated: This is the ritual of the clear realization of Bhagavat Red Yamântaka.🔽The clear realization of Vajrabhairava is as follows:

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_bsrung ba'i 'khor lo
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_bsrung ba'i 'khor lo
translated: Having completed the protection wheel,

original: dang /_tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngon du song
analyzed: dang /_tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngon du song
translated: the accumulation of the accumulations, and the creation of the mandalas of the five elements,

original: nas/_'dir bye las pho brang gling dgu gnyis bco brgyad sgo rta babs dur khrod
analyzed: nas/_'dir bye las pho brang gling dgu gnyis bco brgyad sgo rta babs dur khrod
translated: Here, generate the palace with the nine-layered platforms and eighteen platforms, the gates, the archways, the charnel grounds,🔽the vajra mountain range, and so on.

original: rdo rje me ri dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du byol🔽song chen po bcu drug bsnol ba'i steng du hum las rdo rje/_bcom ldan 'das b+hai ra
analyzed: rdo rje me ri dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du byol song chen po bcu drug bsnol ba'i steng du hum las rdo rje/_bcom ldan 'das b+hai ra
translated: For the generation of the deity, upon the sun, moon, and lotus, the sixteen great maṇḍalas are stacked one upon the other.🔽Upon that, from hūṃ, there is a vajra cross, upon which Bhagavat Mahābhairava has nine faces, thirty-two arms, and sixteen legs.

original: ba chen po zhal dgu phyag sum cu so gnyis zhabs bcu drug pa mi mgo'i phreng ba
analyzed: ba chen po zhal dgu phyag sum cu so gnyis zhabs bcu drug pa mi mgo'i phreng ba
translated: He wears a garland of human heads and is naked with the genitals drawn in.

original: dang /_gcer bu mtshhan ma gyen du 'greng ba/_zhal dgu ni rtsha zhal ma he
analyzed: dang /_gcer bu mtshhan ma gyen du 'greng ba/_zhal dgu ni rtsha zhal ma he
translated: The nine faces are red, with the face of a buffalo in the back,🔽the three right faces are white, blue, and green,

original: g.yas pa gsum dkar po dang mthing kha ljang khu/_g.yon gyi gsum na dmar po
analyzed: g.yas pa gsum dkar po dang mthing kha ljang khu/_g.yon gyi gsum na dmar po
translated: and the three left faces are red,

original: nag po dud kha'o/_/rwa bar gyi zhal dmar ba steng zhal ser po'o/_/phyag sum
analyzed: nag po dud kha'o/_/rwa bar gyi zhal dmar ba steng zhal ser po'o/_/phyag sum
translated: black, and smoky. The face between the horns is red, and the face above is yellow.

original: cu so gnyis kyi dang po gnyis kyis glang po che'i lpags pa 'dzin pa/_de nas
analyzed: cu so gnyis kyi dang po gnyis kyis glang po che'i lpags pa 'dzin pa/_de nas
translated: Of his thirty-two arms, the first two hold an elephant skin.

original: g.yas kyi bco lnga'i dang po ni gri gug_/gnyis pa na mtshhon rtshe gcig pa/
analyzed: g.yas kyi bco lnga'i dang po ni gri gug_/gnyis pa na mtshhon rtshe gcig pa/
translated: The first of the fifteen on the right is a flaying knife, the second a single-pointed spear,

original: gsum pa na gtun shing /_bzhi pa na chu gri/_lnga pa na cug gzang ces bya rdo
analyzed: gsum pa na gtun shing /_bzhi pa na chu gri/_lnga pa na cug gzang ces bya rdo
translated: the third a club, the fourth a razor, the fifth a cudgel called a “vajra spear,”

original: rje rtshe gcig pa'o/_/drug pa na sta re/_bdun pa na mdung /_brgyad pa na
analyzed: rje rtshe gcig pa'o/_/drug pa na sta re/_bdun pa na mdung /_brgyad pa na
translated: the sixth an axe, the seventh a lance, the eighth an arrow,

original: mda'/_dgu pa na lcags kyu/_bcu pa na dbyug to/_bcu cig pa na kha tam kha/
analyzed: mda'/_dgu pa na lcags kyu/_bcu pa na dbyug to/_bcu cig pa na kha tam kha/
translated: the ninth an iron hook, the tenth a staff, the eleventh a khaṭvāṅga,

original: bcu gnyis pa na 'khor lo/_bcu gsum pa na rdo rje tho ba/_bcu bzhi pa na
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa na 'khor lo/_bcu gsum pa na rdo rje tho ba/_bcu bzhi pa na
translated: the twelfth a chakram, the thirteenth a vajra hammer, the fourteenth a sword,

original: ral gri/_bco lnga pa na rnge chung ngo /_/g.yon gyi bco lnga'i dang po na ka pa la/
analyzed: ral gri/_bco lnga pa na rnge chung ngo /_/g.yon gyi bco lnga'i dang po na ka pa la/
translated: and the fifteenth a small drum. The first of the fifteen on the left is a skull cup,

original: gnyis pa na tshhangs mgo/_gsum pa na phub/_bzhi pa na mi rkang /_lnga pa
analyzed: gnyis pa na tshhangs mgo/_gsum pa na phub/_bzhi pa na mi rkang /_lnga pa
translated: the second a human head, the third a shield, the fourth a human leg, the fifth a noose,

original: na zhags pa/_drug pa na rgyu ma/_bdun pa na dril bu/_brgyad pa na lag pa/
analyzed: na zhags pa/_drug pa na rgyu ma/_bdun pa na dril bu/_brgyad pa na lag pa/
translated: the sixth an intestine, the seventh a bell, the eighth a hand,

original: dgu pa na dur khrod kyi ras/_bcu pa na skyes bu gsal shing la btshugs pa/
analyzed: dgu pa na dur khrod kyi ras/_bcu pa na skyes bu gsal shing la btshugs pa/
translated: the ninth a charnel ground, the tenth a man impaled on a stake,🔽the eleventh a heart, the twelfth a liver, the thirteenth a kidney, the fourteenth a spleen,🔽and the fifteenth a pair of lungs.

original: bcu gcig pa na me thab/_bcu gnyis pa na thod tshhal/_bcu gsum pa na
analyzed: bcu gcig pa na me thab/_bcu gnyis pa na thod tshhal/_bcu gsum pa na
translated: In the eleventh right hand is a fire pit; in the twelfth is a skull cup; in the thirteenth is a

original: sdigs mdzub/_bcu bzhi pa na 'phan rtshe gsum/_bco lnga pa na rlung gis
analyzed: sdigs mdzub/_bcu bzhi pa na 'phan rtshe gsum/_bco lnga pa na rlung gis
translated: sword; in the fourteenth is a trident; and in the fifteenth is a flag.

original: ras so/_/zhabs g.yas brgyad kyis mi dang ma he dang glang dang /_bung bu
analyzed: ras so/_/zhabs g.yas brgyad kyis mi dang ma he dang glang dang /_bung bu
translated: The eight right feet trample a human, buffalo, elephant, camel, dog, sheep,🔽fox, and monkey. The eight left feet trample a vulture, owl, crow, mynah,

original: dang /_rnga mo dang /_khyi dang /_lug dang wa rnams brdzis pa'o/_/g.yon
analyzed: dang /_rnga mo dang /_khyi dang /_lug dang wa rnams brdzis pa'o/_/g.yon
translated: hawk, garuḍa, magpie, and cuckoo.

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba🔽pa brgyad kyis bya rgod dang /_'ug pa dang /_bya rog dang /_ne tshho dang / khra dang /_khyung dang /_ri skegs/_bzhad rnams brdzis pa'o/_/sgo bzhir🔽shar phyogs su gshin rje lcags kyu ma mthing nag_/gri dang thod pa 'dzin cing rma
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba pa brgyad kyis bya rgod dang /_'ug pa dang /_bya rog dang /_ne tshho dang / khra dang /_khyung dang /_ri skegs/_bzhad rnams brdzis pa'o/_/sgo bzhir shar phyogs su gshin rje lcags kyu ma mthing nag_/gri dang thod pa 'dzin cing rma
translated: The Pearl Garland of Realization🔽In the four gates, in the east is black Yamāntaka-Ankuśa, holding a flaying knife and skull cup,🔽riding a bird. In the south is Yamāntaka-Pāśa, holding a flaying knife and skull cup, riding a

original: bya la chibs pa/_lho sgor gshin rje zhags pa ma gri dang thod pa thogs pa sbrul la
analyzed: bya la chibs pa/_lho sgor gshin rje zhags pa ma gri dang thod pa thogs pa sbrul la
translated: snake.

original: chibs pa/_nub du gshin rje lcags sgrog ma gri dang thod pa 'dzin cing mthing
analyzed: chibs pa/_nub du gshin rje lcags sgrog ma gri dang thod pa 'dzin cing mthing
translated: In the west is Yamāri’s consort, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, who holds a flaying knife and skull cup and rides a jackal.🔽In the north is Yamāri’s consort, Vasudāriṇī, who holds a flaying knife and skull cup and rides a long-beaked kāṅkā bird.

original: ril la chibs pa/_byang phyogs su gshin rje 'bebs ma nag mo gri dang thod pa🔽thogs nas kang ka mchu rings la chibs pa'o/_/shar lhor gshin rje dus mtshhan🔽ma nag mo gri dang thod pa/_chibs su bya rog chibs pa'o/_/lho nub tu gshin rje pho
analyzed: ril la chibs pa/_byang phyogs su gshin rje 'bebs ma nag mo gri dang thod pa thogs nas kang ka mchu rings la chibs pa'o/_/shar lhor gshin rje dus mtshhan ma nag mo gri dang thod pa/_chibs su bya rog chibs pa'o/_/lho nub tu gshin rje pho
translated: In the southeast is Yamāri’s consort, Kālarātri, who holds a flaying knife and skull cup and rides a crow.🔽In the southwest is Yamāri’s consort, Ḍombinī, who holds a flaying knife and skull cup and rides a vulture.🔽In the northwest is Yamāri’s consort, Dākinī, who holds a flaying knife and skull cup and rides an owl.🔽In the northeast is Yamāri’s consort, Daṇḍinī, who holds a flaying knife and skull cup and rides a hawk.

original: nya mo nag mo gri dang thod pa bya rgod chibs pa'o/_/nub byang du mche ba can gri dang thod pa 'ug pa la chibs pa'o/_/byang shar du gshin rje be con ma gri dang thod pa🔽gsod byed chen mo khra la chibs pa/_de ltar bsams pa'i thugs khar a las nyi
analyzed: nya mo nag mo gri dang thod pa bya rgod chibs pa'o/_/nub byang du mche ba can gri dang thod pa 'ug pa la chibs pa'o/_/byang shar du gshin rje be con ma gri dang thod pa gsod byed chen mo khra la chibs pa/_de ltar bsams pa'i thugs khar a las nyi
translated: In the center is Ekajaṭī, who holds a flaying knife and skull cup and rides a corpse.🔽In the heart of that figure, which is visualized in this way, is an āḥ syllable, from which arises a sun maṇḍala.

original: ma'i dal gyi steng du bzlas pa'i yi ge bsgoms la/_de las 'od 'phros pas ye shes
analyzed: ma'i dal gyi steng du bzlas pa'i yi ge bsgoms la/_de las 'od 'phros pas ye shes
translated: Upon that is the mantra, which is visualized as radiating light rays that invoke the timeless awareness

original: pa spyan drangs la gnyis su med par bstim la om twa na na hum phat/_bcu pa bzlas pa
analyzed: pa spyan drangs la gnyis su med par bstim la om twa na na hum phat/_bcu pa bzlas pa
translated: Recite the mantra oṃ tāre tuttāre ture svāhā.🔽Then, after the praise, confer empowerment.

original: byas nas bstod pa byas pa la dbang bskur ba ni 'jigs byed kyi cho ga'o/_/
analyzed: byas nas bstod pa byas pa la dbang bskur ba ni 'jigs byed kyi cho ga'o/_/
translated: This is the procedure for Bhairava.

original: bai ro tsha na rak+shi ta'i 'jigs byed yab yum lha bco brgyad kyi mngon par
analyzed: bai ro tsha na rak+shi ta'i 'jigs byed yab yum lha bco brgyad kyi mngon par
translated: Vairocanarakṣita’s eighteen-deity Bhairava with consort

original: rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngar
analyzed: rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngar
translated: The accumulation of accumulations and the creation of the maṇḍala of the five elements are as before.

original: ltar la/_'dir gzhal yas khang bskyed pa ni/_bru las pho brang gru bzhi sgo bzhi🔽'khor lo rtshibs brgyad pa bskyed la/_de ltar bskyed pa ni nyi zla pad+ma sems can
analyzed: ltar la/_'dir gzhal yas khang bskyed pa ni/_bru las pho brang gru bzhi sgo bzhi 'khor lo rtshibs brgyad pa bskyed la/_de ltar bskyed pa ni nyi zla pad+ma sems can
translated: Here, the creation of the celestial mansion is as follows: From bhrūṃ arises a four-sided, four-doored🔽palace with eight charnel grounds.🔽Upon that, from a sun, moon, and lotus, a sentient being, and a hūṃ, is a vajra.

original: gyi steng du hum las rdo rje/_de las 'jigs byed badzra bi ra pa/_dbu dgu phyag
analyzed: gyi steng du hum las rdo rje/_de las 'jigs byed badzra bi ra pa/_dbu dgu phyag
translated: From that, one arises as Bhairava Vajrarupiṇa, with nine heads,🔽thirty-four arms, and sixteen legs.

original: sum cu so bzhi zhabs bcu drug_/sku mdog nag po la rtsha zhal ma he'i zhal nag po/
analyzed: sum cu so bzhi zhabs bcu drug_/sku mdog nag po la rtsha zhal ma he'i zhal nag po/
translated: One’s body is black, with a black buffalo face.

original: steng gi zhal srin po'i zhal dmar po khrag 'dzag pa la/_gsum pa 'jam pa'i rdo
analyzed: steng gi zhal srin po'i zhal dmar po khrag 'dzag pa la/_gsum pa 'jam pa'i rdo
translated: The upper face is a red rakshasa face dripping with blood.

original: rje'i zhal ser po yid tsham khro ba'o/_/ra'i g.yas phyogs kyi zhal gsum dang po
analyzed: rje'i zhal ser po yid tsham khro ba'o/_/ra'i g.yas phyogs kyi zhal gsum dang po
translated: The face of Manjushri Vajra to the right of that is yellow and wrathful.

original: sngon po/_gnyis pa dmar po/_gsum pa ser po'o/_/g.yon gyi zhal gsum
analyzed: sngon po/_gnyis pa dmar po/_gsum pa ser po'o/_/g.yon gyi zhal gsum
translated: The three faces to the right of that are blue, red and yellow.

original: gyi dang po dkar po/_gnyis pa dud kha/_gsum pa ljang khu'o/_/zhal re re🔽la spyan gsum gsum dang ldan pa/_ral pa thams cad 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i
analyzed: gyi dang po dkar po/_gnyis pa dud kha/_gsum pa ljang khu'o/_/zhal re re la spyan gsum gsum dang ldan pa/_ral pa thams cad 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i
translated: The three faces to the left are white, smoke-colored and green.

original: la spyan gsum gsum dang ldan pa/
analyzed: la spyan gsum gsum dang ldan pa/
translated: Each face has three eyes.🔽All the hair is tied up in a topknot.

original: dbu'i steng na thor cog byas pa'o/_/phyag sum cu so bzhi'i dang po ni/_rtog
analyzed: dbu'i steng na thor cog byas pa'o/_/phyag sum cu so bzhi'i dang po ni/_rtog
translated: The first of the thirty-four arms holds a vajra.

original: pa bzhi par rdo rje bshad/_rtog pa lnga pa na bsgrub thabs sbyin sreg nas gri
analyzed: pa bzhi par rdo rje bshad/_rtog pa lnga pa na bsgrub thabs sbyin sreg nas gri
translated: In the fourth chapter it explains the vajra, and in the fifth chapter it explains the ritual dagger from the ritual of accomplishment and fire puja.

original: gug bshad de/_de mi 'gal bla ma pan+di tas bla ma chen po la dris pas de mi
analyzed: gug bshad de/_de mi 'gal bla ma pan+di tas bla ma chen po la dris pas de mi
translated: The great guru asked a pandita about this, and the pandita said, “It is not a contradiction.

original: 'gal te/_slob dpon pad+ma'i thang sku la rdo rje yod pas rdo rje yang yin gsungs
analyzed: 'gal te/_slob dpon pad+ma'i thang sku la rdo rje yod pas rdo rje yang yin gsungs
translated: The master said, This is contradictory because the vajra is present in the silk thangka of Master Padma, so it is also a vajra.

original: te/_rigs pa'i dbang du byas na g.yon gyi dang po na thod pa yod pas/
analyzed: te/_rigs pa'i dbang du byas na g.yon gyi dang po na thod pa yod pas/
translated: He said, From the perspective of logic, since the first left hand holds a skull cup,🔽it is logical that the first right hand holds a flaying knife.

original: g.yas dang po na gri gug bsnams par rigs gsung bas/_g.yas g.yon dang po gnyis kyis gri gug dang thod pa bsnams nas yum la 'khyud pa/_gnyis pa
analyzed: g.yas dang po na gri gug bsnams par rigs gsung bas/_g.yas g.yon dang po gnyis kyis gri gug dang thod pa bsnams nas yum la 'khyud pa/_gnyis pa
translated: The master said, The first two hands hold a flaying knife and skull cup and embrace the mother.

original: glang po che'i lpags pa brgyangs nas 'dzin pa/_g.yas kyi gsum pa na mtshhon
analyzed: glang po che'i lpags pa brgyangs nas 'dzin pa/_g.yas kyi gsum pa na mtshhon
translated: The second right hand holds an elephant skin stretched out, and the third right hand holds a trident,

original: rtshe gcig pa/_bzhi pa na gtun shing /_lnga pa na rdo rje/_drug pa na rdo rje
analyzed: rtshe gcig pa/_bzhi pa na gtun shing /_lnga pa na rdo rje/_drug pa na rdo rje
translated: the fourth a pestle, the fifth a vajra, the sixth a single-pointed vajra,

original: rtshe gcig_/bdun pa na sta re brgyad pa na mdung thung /_dgu pa na mda'/
analyzed: rtshe gcig_/bdun pa na sta re brgyad pa na mdung thung /_dgu pa na mda'/
translated: the seventh an ax, the eighth a spear, the ninth an arrow,

original: bcu pa na lcags kyu/_bcu gcig pa na dbyug tho/_bcu gnyis pa na kha tam kha/
analyzed: bcu pa na lcags kyu/_bcu gcig pa na dbyug tho/_bcu gnyis pa na kha tam kha/
translated: the tenth an iron hook, the eleventh a club, and the twelfth a khaṭvāṅga.🔽 The thirteenth holds a chakram, the fourteenth a vajra, the fifteenth a hammer,

original: bcu gsum pa na 'khor lo/_bcu bzhi pa na rdo rje/_bco lnga pa na tho ba/
analyzed: bcu gsum pa na 'khor lo/_bcu bzhi pa na rdo rje/_bco lnga pa na tho ba/
translated: and the sixteenth a bell.🔽 The master said, This is contradictory because the bell is present in the silk thangka of Master Padma, so it is also a bell.

original: bcu drug pa na ral gri/_bcu bdun pa na cang te'u bsnams pa'o/_/g.yon🔽gyi gsum pa na tshhangs mgo_/bzhi pa na phub/_lnga pa na rkang pa/_drug pa na
analyzed: bcu drug pa na ral gri/_bcu bdun pa na cang te'u bsnams pa'o/_/g.yon gyi gsum pa na tshhangs mgo_/bzhi pa na phub/_lnga pa na rkang pa/_drug pa na
translated: In the sixteenth right hand she holds a sword, and in the seventeenth a small drum.

original: zhags pa/_bdun pa na gzhu/_brgyad pas rgyu ma/_dgu pas dril bu/🔽bcu pas lag pa/_bcu gcig pa dur khrod kyi ras/_bcu gnyis pa gsal
analyzed: zhags pa/_bdun pa na gzhu/_brgyad pas rgyu ma/_dgu pas dril bu/ bcu pas lag pa/_bcu gcig pa dur khrod kyi ras/_bcu gnyis pa gsal
translated: In the third left hand she holds a human head, in the fourth a shield, in the fifth a foot, in the sixth a lasso, in the seventh a bow, in the eighth an intestine, in the ninth a bell,

original: la🔽mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba
analyzed: la mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba
translated: in the tenth a hand, in the eleventh a charnel ground, in the twelfth a lamp,

original: shing la btshugs pa/_bcu gsum pas me thab/_bcu bzhi pas thod tshhal/🔽bco lnga pas sdigs 'dzub/_bcu drug pas 'phan rtshe gsum pa/_bcu bdun
analyzed: shing la btshugs pa/_bcu gsum pas me thab/_bcu bzhi pas thod tshhal/ bco lnga pas sdigs 'dzub/_bcu drug pas 'phan rtshe gsum pa/_bcu bdun
translated: in the thirteenth a hearth, in the fourteenth a skull cup,

original: pas rlung gis 'phyar ba'i ras bsnams pa'o/_/zhabs bcu drug gi g.yas brgyad
analyzed: pas rlung gis 'phyar ba'i ras bsnams pa'o/_/zhabs bcu drug gi g.yas brgyad
translated: in the fifteenth a threatening gesture, in the sixteenth a three-pointed banner, and in the seventeenth a flag fluttering in the wind.

original: bskums pa'i dang pos mi/_gnyis pas ma he/_gsum pas glang /_bzhi
analyzed: bskums pa'i dang pos mi/_gnyis pas ma he/_gsum pas glang /_bzhi
translated: Of the sixteen right legs, the first bent leg stands on a human, the second on a buffalo, the third on an elephant, the fourth

original: pas bung bu/_lnga pas rnga mo/_drug pas khyi/_bdun pas lug_/brgyad
analyzed: pas bung bu/_lnga pas rnga mo/_drug pas khyi/_bdun pas lug_/brgyad
translated: on a bee, the fifth on a camel, the sixth on a dog, the seventh on a sheep, and the eighth on a lion.

original: pas wa gnan pa'o/_/g.yon brgyad brkyang ba'i dang pos bya rgod/_gnyis🔽pas 'ug pa/_gsum pas bya rog_/bzhi pas ne tshho/_lnga pas khra/_drug🔽pas khyung /_bdun pas kam ka_/brgyad pas bzhad mnan pa'o/_/zhabs
analyzed: pas wa gnan pa'o/_/g.yon brgyad brkyang ba'i dang pos bya rgod/_gnyis pas 'ug pa/_gsum pas bya rog_/bzhi pas ne tshho/_lnga pas khra/_drug pas khyung /_bdun pas kam ka_/brgyad pas bzhad mnan pa'o/_/zhabs
translated: The eight right legs are bent: the first tramples a vulture, the second an owl, the third a crow, the fourth a mynah bird, the fifth a hawk, the sixth a garuḍa, the seventh a kank, and the eighth a peacock.

original: g.yas kyi byol song brgyad kyis brgya byin dang tshhangs pa gnan pa/_g.yon gyi
analyzed: g.yas kyi byol song brgyad kyis brgya byin dang tshhangs pa gnan pa/_g.yon gyi
translated: The eight left legs are extended: the first tramples Indra, the second Brahmā, the third Viṣṇu, the fourth Rudra, the fifth Maheśvara, the sixth Īśvara, the seventh Kumāra, and the eighth Bhṛṅgiriṭi.

original: 'dab chags brgyad kyis dbang phyug chen po dang gzhon nu khyab 'jug gnan pa'o//
analyzed: 'dab chags brgyad kyis dbang phyug chen po dang gzhon nu khyab 'jug gnan pa'o//
translated: The eight animals of the right legs trample Indra and Brahmā, and the eight birds of the left legs trample Maheśvara and Kumāra.🔽The mother Vajranairātmyā holds a flaying knife and skull cup and embraces the father.

original: yum rdo rje bdag med mas gri gug dang thod pa thogs pas sku la 'khril ba/_dur🔽khrod kyi chas dang sbrul gyis brgyan pa/_'khor lo rtshibs brgyad la shar du gshin
analyzed: yum rdo rje bdag med mas gri gug dang thod pa thogs pas sku la 'khril ba/_dur khrod kyi chas dang sbrul gyis brgyan pa/_'khor lo rtshibs brgyad la shar du gshin
translated: She is adorned with charnel ground attire and snakes.🔽On the eight spokes of the wheel, black Yamarāja, the king of the Dharma, is in the east, holding a staff and a noose.

original: rje chos kyi rgyal po mdog nag po dbyug tho dang rgyu zhags 'dzin pa/_mgo dgu🔽rkang cig ma yab dang sku mdog phyag mtshhan 'thun pa sku la 'khril ba/_ma he sngon
analyzed: rje chos kyi rgyal po mdog nag po dbyug tho dang rgyu zhags 'dzin pa/_mgo dgu🔽rkang cig ma yab dang sku mdog phyag mtshhan 'thun pa sku la 'khril ba/_ma he sngon
translated: He has nine heads and one leg and is in union with his consort, who is similar to him in color and attributes.🔽Blue buffalo-faced Caṇḍālī is in the south.

original: po la chibs pa'o/_/shar lhor rtel ba nag po/_dbyug tho dang thod pa thogs pa/
analyzed: po la chibs pa'o/_/shar lhor rtel ba nag po/_dbyug tho dang thod pa thogs pa/
translated: In the southeast is black Rāvaṇa, holding a club and a skull cup.

original: khro mo phag mo sku mdog rang dang 'dra ba sku la 'khril ba/_rnga mo nag mo la chibs
analyzed: khro mo phag mo sku mdog rang dang 'dra ba sku la 'khril ba/_rnga mo nag mo la chibs
translated: He is embraced by Krodhīkālī, who is the same as him and rides a black water buffalo.

original: pa'o/_/lhor a ba glang mgo/_dud kha lcags kyu dang zhags pa thogs pa/
analyzed: pa'o/_/lhor a ba glang mgo/_dud kha lcags kyu dang zhags pa thogs pa/
translated: In the south is Avaraṇesin, brown and holding a hook and a lasso.

original: gshin rje kha rgya ma rang 'dra ba sku la 'khril ba dre rta rkang gsum chibs pa/_lho
analyzed: gshin rje kha rgya ma rang 'dra ba sku la 'khril ba dre rta rkang gsum chibs pa/_lho
translated: He is embraced by Yamadamṣṭrī, who is the same as him and rides a three-legged mule.

original: nub du ya wa ti nag po ral gri dang zhags pa thogs pa/_nag mo chen mo shel
analyzed: nub du ya wa ti nag po ral gri dang zhags pa thogs pa/_nag mo chen mo shel
translated: In the southwest is black Yāvada, holding a sword and a lasso.

original: mig ma sku la 'khril ba chu glang sngon po la chibs pa'o/_/nub tu gshin rje mig
analyzed: mig ma sku la 'khril ba chu glang sngon po la chibs pa'o/_/nub tu gshin rje mig
translated: He is embraced by Mahānāgī, who has crystal eyes and rides a blue water elephant.🔽In the west is red Yamacaṇḍa, holding a sword and a skull cup.

original: dmar dmar po ral gri dang thod pa thogs pa la/_lag rgya chen mo sku la 'khril
analyzed: dmar dmar po ral gri dang thod pa thogs pa la/_lag rgya chen mo sku la 'khril
translated: He is embraced by Mahābhiṇḍī, who rides a sheep.

original: ba lug la chibs pa'o/_/nub byang du phya sangs dkar po la nag pa'i mdangs
analyzed: ba lug la chibs pa'o/_/nub byang du phya sangs dkar po la nag pa'i mdangs
translated: In the northwest is white Piśāca, with a black complexion.

original: yod pa tri shul dang zhags pa thogs pa a sham ma sku la 'khril ba bdud sha nag mo
analyzed: yod pa tri shul dang zhags pa thogs pa a sham ma sku la 'khril ba bdud sha nag mo
translated: In the north, Black Demoness, with a green horse’s hoof, holds a skull-topped club and a noose, and embraces Black Demoness.

original: chibs pa'o/_/byang du rmig pa ljang nag thod dbyug dang zhags pa/_nag mo🔽chen mo sku la 'khril ba bra nag rting dkar la chibs pa'o/_/byang shar du ral pa🔽tshhar dgu nag po thod dbyug dang zhags pa dmar po bsnams pa'o/_/ma mo nag
analyzed: chibs pa'o/_/byang du rmig pa ljang nag thod dbyug dang zhags pa/_nag mo chen mo sku la 'khril ba bra nag rting dkar la chibs pa'o/_/byang shar du ral pa tshhar dgu nag po thod dbyug dang zhags pa dmar po bsnams pa'o/_/ma mo nag
translated: In the northeast, Black Hairy One, with nine black dreadlocks, holds a skull-topped club and a red noose.🔽Black Mother, with a black horse’s head, holds a skull-topped club and a noose, and embraces Black Mother.🔽In the southeast, Black Demoness, with a black horse’s head, holds a skull-topped club and a noose, and embraces Black Demoness.🔽In the southwest, Black Demoness, with a black horse’s head, holds a skull-topped club and a noose, and embraces Black Demoness.🔽In the northwest, Black Demoness, with a black horse’s head, holds a skull-topped club and a noose, and embraces Black Demoness.

original: mo sku la 'khril ba/_ma he sngo nag la chibs pa'o/_/gru chad bzhi dang sgo bzhir
analyzed: mo sku la 'khril ba/_ma he sngo nag la chibs pa'o/_/gru chad bzhi dang sgo bzhir
translated: In the northeast, Black Demoness, with a black horse’s head, holds a skull-topped club and a noose, and embraces Black Demoness.🔽In the four corners and four gates are the four goddesses such as Charm, and the four gate goddesses, all with wrathful attire.

original: sgeg sogs bzhi dang sgo ma bzhi khro mo'i cha lugs can no/_/spyan drang ba dang bzlas pa bcu bzhi pa bya ba ni hri tri'o/_/bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni
analyzed: sgeg sogs bzhi dang sgo ma bzhi khro mo'i cha lugs can no/_/spyan drang ba dang bzlas pa bcu bzhi pa bya ba ni hri tri'o/_/bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni
translated: The invocation and the fourteen repetitions are hrīḥ.

original: 'jigs byed \u0f10ra ba'i cho ga'o//
analyzed: 'jigs byed \u0f10ra ba'i cho ga'o//
translated: After the praise, the empowerment conferral is the Bhairava ritual.

original: 'jigs byed zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/
analyzed: 'jigs byed zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/
translated: The clear realization of Bhairava with one face and two hands is as follows.

original: tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngon du song nas/
analyzed: tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngon du song nas/
translated: Having previously accumulated merit and created the mandalas of the five elements,🔽here, create a dark-blue, three-sided, eight-spoked vajra from a bi.

original: 'dir bye las mthing nag gru gsum rtshibs brgyad pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni
analyzed: 'dir bye las mthing nag gru gsum rtshibs brgyad pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni
translated: The creation of the deity is as follows:

original: nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du pam las ro langs ma las ma he/_hum las gri gug de las rdo
analyzed: nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du pam las ro langs ma las ma he/_hum las gri gug de las rdo
translated: Upon a sun, moon, and lotus, from paṃ arises a corpse, from that a buffalo, from hūṃ a flaying knife, and from that a flaying knife marked with hūṃ.

original: rje 'jigs byed zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa sku mdog dug ha la ha la ltar nag pa/
analyzed: rje 'jigs byed zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa sku mdog dug ha la ha la ltar nag pa/
translated: That completely transforms into oneself as Vajrabhairava with one face and two arms, the color of black hala hala poison.🔽The face of a buffalo with bared fangs and horns adorns the shoulders.

original: ma he'i zhal mche ba gtshigs shing gdangs pa rwa'i phrag tu 'jam dpal gzhon
analyzed: ma he'i zhal mche ba gtshigs shing gdangs pa rwa'i phrag tu 'jam dpal gzhon
translated: The face of youthful Mañjuśrī adorns the crown of the head.

original: nu'i zhal gyis brgyan pa/_g.yas kyis gri gug_/g.yon gyis thod pa khrag gis
analyzed: nu'i zhal gyis brgyan pa/_g.yas kyis gri gug_/g.yon gyis thod pa khrag gis
translated: The right hand holds a flaying knife, and the left hand holds a skull cup filled with blood

original: bskang ba bsnams pa/_zhabs gnyis brkyang bskum la dur khrod kyi chas kyis
analyzed: bskang ba bsnams pa/_zhabs gnyis brkyang bskum la dur khrod kyi chas kyis
translated: and a flaying knife. The two legs are extended and contracted, and he is adorned with charnel ground ornaments.🔽In the heart, upon a sun, is the letter hūṃ.

original: brgyan pa'o/_/snying khar nyi ma'i steng du hum yig go/_/'khor bskyed pa ni/
analyzed: brgyan pa'o/_/snying khar nyi ma'i steng du hum yig go/_/'khor bskyed pa ni/
translated: The creation of the retinue is as follows:

original: shar sgor gshin rje ya ba ti dkar po lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o/_/lho'i sgor chos rgyal
analyzed: shar sgor gshin rje ya ba ti dkar po lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o/_/lho'i sgor chos rgyal
translated: At the eastern gate is white Yamarī, holding a hook.🔽At the southern gate is yellow Dharma­rāja, holding a noose.

original: ser po zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub sgor rtel ba dmar po lcags sgrog thogs🔽mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/🔽pa'o/_/byang sgor a ba glang mgo ljang khu dril bu thogs pa'o/_/shar lhor
analyzed: ser po zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub sgor rtel ba dmar po lcags sgrog thogs mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/ pa'o/_/byang sgor a ba glang mgo ljang khu dril bu thogs pa'o/_/shar lhor
translated: At the western gate is red Caṇḍālī, holding an iron chain.🔽At the northern gate is green A-vi-lo-ki-ta, holding a bell.

original: gshin rje rmig pa dkar ser zhing gi dbyug pa thogs pa'o/_/lho nub du phya🔽sangs dmar po rdo rje rtshe gsum thogs pa'o/_/nub byang du mig dmar dmar ljang
analyzed: gshin rje rmig pa dkar ser zhing gi dbyug pa thogs pa'o/_/lho nub du phya sangs dmar po rdo rje rtshe gsum thogs pa'o/_/nub byang du mig dmar dmar ljang
translated: At the southeast is white-yellow Yama-pāda, holding a club.🔽At the southwest is red Yama-mukha, holding a trident.🔽At the northwest is red-green Yama-netra, holding a razor.

original: spu gri thogs pa'o/_/byang shar du ral pa tshhar dgu ljang dkar 'khor lo thogs
analyzed: spu gri thogs pa'o/_/byang shar du ral pa tshhar dgu ljang dkar 'khor lo thogs
translated: At the northeast is white-green Keśa-ri, holding a wheel.

original: pa'o/_/de ltar bskyed nas/_spyan drang ba dang mchod pa bya ba dang hrihsh+ti 'o
analyzed: pa'o/_/de ltar bskyed nas/_spyan drang ba dang mchod pa bya ba dang hrihsh+ti 'o
translated: After generating in that way, one should perform the invocation, offering, and recitation of hṛiḥ śrī.

original: bzlas pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni 'jigs chung gi cho ga'o/_/
analyzed: bzlas pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni 'jigs chung gi cho ga'o/_/
translated: After performing the recitation, the empowerment is conferred. This is the short rite.

original: bcom ldan 'das dgyes pa rdo rje zhal brgyad phyag bcu drug pa'i mngon
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dgyes pa rdo rje zhal brgyad phyag bcu drug pa'i mngon
translated: The Bhagavān is Hevajra with eight faces and sixteen arms.🔽

original: par rtogs pa bsgom pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor
analyzed: par rtogs pa bsgom pa ni/_tshhogs bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor
translated: The meditation on the clear realization of Bhagavat Hevajra with eight faces and sixteen arms is as follows: The accumulation of accumulations and the creation of the mandalas of the five elements are as before.

original: bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir bye las pad+ma 'dab brgyad/_sgo khyud dang pad
analyzed: bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir bye las pad+ma 'dab brgyad/_sgo khyud dang pad
translated: Here, a lotus with eight petals is created from the elements, with a gate, a lotus,🔽a charnel ground, a vajra, and a ring of fire.

original: ra dur khrod rdo rje/_me ri dang bcas pa bskyed la/_de'i steng du nyi zla pad+ma'i
analyzed: ra dur khrod rdo rje/_me ri dang bcas pa bskyed la/_de'i steng du nyi zla pad+ma'i
translated: Upon that, on a sun, moon, and lotus,

original: steng du tshhangs pa dang khyab 'jug_/dbang phyug dang lha'i dbang po ste/
analyzed: steng du tshhangs pa dang khyab 'jug_/dbang phyug dang lha'i dbang po ste/
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Maheshvara, and Indra🔽are created as the four supine demons.

original: bdud bzhi bsgyel ba'i snying khar he ru ka zhal brgyad phyag bcu drug pa sku mdog🔽mthing nag_/rtsha zhal nag po'i g.yas gsum dkar po dang nag po dang nag po'o/_/
analyzed: bdud bzhi bsgyel ba'i snying khar he ru ka zhal brgyad phyag bcu drug pa sku mdog mthing nag_/rtsha zhal nag po'i g.yas gsum dkar po dang nag po dang nag po'o/_/
translated: In their hearts is Heruka with eight faces and sixteen arms.🔽His body is dark blue, and his wrathful face is black. The three right faces are white, black, and black.

original: g.yon gsum dmar po dang nag po nag po'o/_/steng zhal du ba'i mdog can no//
analyzed: g.yon gsum dmar po dang nag po nag po'o/_/steng zhal du ba'i mdog can no//
translated: The three left faces are red, black, and black. The upper face is the color of smoke.

original: phyag bcu drug gi g.yas brgyad na thod pa'i nang na glang po/_rta dang bong bu dang / glang dang /_rnga mo dang /_mi dang sha ra na dang /_seng ge dang /_byi la
analyzed: phyag bcu drug gi g.yas brgyad na thod pa'i nang na glang po/_rta dang bong bu dang / glang dang /_rnga mo dang /_mi dang sha ra na dang /_seng ge dang /_byi la
translated: Of his sixteen hands, the eight right hands hold skulls containing an elephant, horse, donkey, ox, camel, human, śarabha, and cat.🔽The eight left hands hold a skull cup containing earth, water, wind, fire, moon, sun, Yama, and Kubera.

original: rnams 'dzin pa'o/_/g.yon gyi thod pa brgyad na sa dang chu dang rlung dang me dang / zla ba nyi ma gshin rje dang nor sbyin rnams so/_/rus pa'i rgyan drug dang thod pa🔽lnga bcu'i phreng ba byas pa/_yum rdo rje bdag med ma nag mo gcer bu gri gug
analyzed: rnams 'dzin pa'o/_/g.yon gyi thod pa brgyad na sa dang chu dang rlung dang me dang / zla ba nyi ma gshin rje dang nor sbyin rnams so/_/rus pa'i rgyan drug dang thod pa lnga bcu'i phreng ba byas pa/_yum rdo rje bdag med ma nag mo gcer bu gri gug
translated: He has the six bone ornaments and a garland of fifty skulls.

original: dang thod pa 'dzin pas sku la 'khril ba/_yab yum gyi dbu thams cad spyan
analyzed: dang thod pa 'dzin pas sku la 'khril ba/_yab yum gyi dbu thams cad spyan
translated: He is embraced by the mother Vajra Nairātmya, who is black, naked, and holds a flaying knife and skull cup.🔽The heads of the father and mother have three eyes each.

original: gsum gsum dang ldan pa/_mche ba gtshigs shing dbu skra dmar ser gyen du gsum gsum dang ldan pa/
analyzed: gsum gsum dang ldan pa/_mche ba gtshigs shing dbu skra dmar ser gyen du gsum gsum dang ldan pa/
translated: Their hair is orange and stands upward.

original: brdzes pa/_thod pa'i dbu rgyan dang phreng bas brgyan pa'o/_/pad+ma 'dab
analyzed: brdzes pa/_thod pa'i dbu rgyan dang phreng bas brgyan pa'o/_/pad+ma 'dab
translated: They are adorned with head ornaments and garlands of skulls.🔽The mother sits in the posture of left

original: brgyad kyi steng du shar nas go rims bzhin du tshhangs pa'i steng du g+ho ri nag mo gri🔽gug dang nya 'dzin pa'o/_/dbang po'i steng du tsho ri dmar mo da ma ru dang phag🔽'dzin pa'o/_/nye dbang gi steng du ro langs ma ser mo rus sbal dang pad+ma 'dzin
analyzed: brgyad kyi steng du shar nas go rims bzhin du tshhangs pa'i steng du g+ho ri nag mo gri gug dang nya 'dzin pa'o/_/dbang po'i steng du tsho ri dmar mo da ma ru dang phag 'dzin pa'o/_/nye dbang gi steng du ro langs ma ser mo rus sbal dang pad+ma 'dzin
translated: On top of the eight, in the east, in order, on top of Indra is black Ghorī, holding a flaying knife and a fish.🔽On top of Agni is red Ghasmarī, holding a ḍamaru and a pig.🔽On top of Yama is yellow Vikaṭā, holding a tortoise and a lotus.

original: pa'o/_/drag po'i steng du g+has ma ri ljang khu sbrul dang dgang gzar 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: pa'o/_/drag po'i steng du g+has ma ri ljang khu sbrul dang dgang gzar 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: On top of Rudra is green Ghasmarī, holding a snake and a ladle.

original: byang shar nas lus ngan gyi steng du pu ka si sngon mo seng ge dang dgra sta 'dzin pa'o//
analyzed: byang shar nas lus ngan gyi steng du pu ka si sngon mo seng ge dang dgra sta 'dzin pa'o//
translated: In the northeast, on top of Virūḍhaka is blue Pukkasī, holding a lion and an ax.

original: gshin rje'i steng du sha ba ri dkar mo/_dge slong dang bsil byed 'dzin pa'o/_/🔽srin po'i steng du tshan d+ha li nam mkha' ltar sngo ba/_'khor lo dang bshol 'dzin
analyzed: gshin rje'i steng du sha ba ri dkar mo/_dge slong dang bsil byed 'dzin pa'o/_/ srin po'i steng du tshan d+ha li nam mkha' ltar sngo ba/_'khor lo dang bshol 'dzin
translated: On top of Yama is white Śavarī, holding a bhikṣu and a palm-leaf fan.🔽On top of Rākṣasa is blue Caṇḍālī, the color of space, holding a chakram and a sword.

original: pa'o/_/thag bzangs rigs kyi steng du tam b+hi ni khro mo rdo rje dang sdigs mdzub
analyzed: pa'o/_/thag bzangs rigs kyi steng du tam b+hi ni khro mo rdo rje dang sdigs mdzub
translated: On top of Vṛtra is red Ḍombinī, holding a flaying knife and a skull.

original: byas pa/_thams cad skyil krungs phyed pa'i gar gyis bzhugs pa/_rus pa'i
analyzed: byas pa/_thams cad skyil krungs phyed pa'i gar gyis bzhugs pa/_rus pa'i
translated: All of them stand in the ardhaparyaṅka dancing posture, with bone🔽ornaments like Nairātmya. They are crowned with Akṣobhya, the lord of

original: rgyan yang bdag med ma lta bu'o/_/rigs kyi bdag po mi bskyod pas dbu la
analyzed: rgyan yang bdag med ma lta bu'o/_/rigs kyi bdag po mi bskyod pas dbu la
