translated: form. The three faces are black, white, and red, with three eyes each.🔽The three right hands hold a vajra, arrow, and sword, and the three left hands hold a bell, bow, and skull cup.

original: pa g.yon pa gsum gyis dril bu dang /_gzhu dang /_thod pa'o/_/rdo rje lu gu rgyud
analyzed: pa g.yon pa gsum gyis dril bu dang /_gzhu dang /_thod pa'o/_/rdo rje lu gu rgyud
translated: The vajra chain is embraced by a flaying knife and skull cup.

original: ma gri gug dang thod pa thogs pas sku la 'khyud pa/_'khor gyi lha mo bcu drug ni
analyzed: ma gri gug dang thod pa thogs pas sku la 'khyud pa/_'khor gyi lha mo bcu drug ni
translated: The sixteen surrounding goddesses are the same as above.

original: gong dang 'dra'o/_/spyan drangs mchod pa byas nas bzlas pa ni/_om ki ti ki ti hu~m
analyzed: gong dang 'dra'o/_/spyan drangs mchod pa byas nas bzlas pa ni/_om ki ti ki ti hu~m
translated: The recitation after inviting and making offerings is oṃ kīrti kīrti hūṃ.

original: hu~m hu~m phat swa ha zhes bzlas la bstod cing dbang bskur ba ni phyag drug pa'i'o//_//
analyzed: hu~m hu~m phat swa ha zhes bzlas la bstod cing dbang bskur ba ni phyag drug pa'i'o//_//
translated: Recite “hum hum phat svaha” and praise and confer empowerment, which is for the six-armed one.

original: phyag bzhi pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni dal dang lha mo rnams sngar dang 'dra🔽ba las/_gtsho bo zhal cig phyag bzhi pa/_nag po phyag dang po gnyis kyi rdo rje
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni dal dang lha mo rnams sngar dang 'dra ba las/_gtsho bo zhal cig phyag bzhi pa/_nag po phyag dang po gnyis kyi rdo rje
translated: The four-armed one’s manifest enlightenment is the same as before, with the maṇḍala and goddesses.

original: dang thod pa thugs kar 'dzin pa/_'og ma gnyis ni mda' gzhu'o/_/yum
analyzed: dang thod pa thugs kar 'dzin pa/_'og ma gnyis ni mda' gzhu'o/_/yum
translated: The four-armed one has one face and four hands. He is black and holds a vajra and a skull cup at the heart with the first two hands and a bow and arrow with the lower two hands.

original: bdag med ma sku la 'khril ba/_sngags ni om dz+wa la dz+wa la sbyo hu~m hu~m hu~m phat swa ha/
analyzed: bdag med ma sku la 'khril ba/_sngags ni om dz+wa la dz+wa la sbyo hu~m hu~m hu~m phat swa ha/
translated: The mother is embraced by the body of Nairātmya. The mantra is “om jvala jvala svāhā hum hum hum phat svaha.”

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The manifest enlightenment called “The Pearl Garland.”

original: zhes dbang bskur bar bya'o//
analyzed: zhes dbang bskur bar bya'o//
translated: Thus, confer the empowerment.🔽The manifest enlightenment of the two-armed one is the same as before, with the maṇḍala and retinue.

original: phyag gnyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni dal dang 'khor rnams sngar dang cig pa las/_'dir gtsho bo 'pho ba'o/_/ro'i steng du hum las rdo rje/_de
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni dal dang 'khor rnams sngar dang cig pa las/_'dir gtsho bo 'pho ba'o/_/ro'i steng du hum las rdo rje/_de
translated: Here, the transference is to the corpse. On top of the corpse, a vajra arises from hūṃ.

original: las he badzra zhal cig phyag gnyis pa rdo rje dang thod pa 'dzin pas yum bdag med
analyzed: las he badzra zhal cig phyag gnyis pa rdo rje dang thod pa 'dzin pas yum bdag med
translated: Karmahevajra has one face and two hands, holding a vajra and a skull cup, and embraces the mother Nairatma.🔽The retinue of sixteen is as before.

original: ma la 'khyud pa/_'khor bcu drug po sngar ltar la/_sngags om tre log kya khye
analyzed: ma la 'khyud pa/_'khor bcu drug po sngar ltar la/_sngags om tre log kya khye
translated: The mantra is oṃ trilokya khyepa huṃ huṃ huṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: pa hu~m hu~m hu~m phat swa ha/_zhes bzlas la bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni/
analyzed: pa hu~m hu~m hu~m phat swa ha/_zhes bzlas la bstod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni/
translated: After reciting this and doing the praise, the empowerment is conferred.

original: dgyes rdor mtshhon cha can rnams bzhi'i cho ga'o//_//
analyzed: dgyes rdor mtshhon cha can rnams bzhi'i cho ga'o//_//
translated: This is the ritual of the four deities of Hevajra with Weapons.

original: bcom ldan 'das bde mchog 'khor lo lha drug cu rtsha gnyis ma'i mngon
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bde mchog 'khor lo lha drug cu rtsha gnyis ma'i mngon
translated: The manifest realization of the sixty-two deities of the Bhagavat Cakrasaṃvara is as follows:

original: par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dal bskyed pa sngar ltar la/
analyzed: par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dal bskyed pa sngar ltar la/
translated: The accumulation of the assembly and the creation of the five elements’ maṇḍala are as before.

original: 'dir bye las gzhal yas khang 'khor lo rim pa bzhi gru chad la sgo btod pa rta🔽babs dang pad+ma/_dur khrod rdo rje ra bas bskor ba bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni/
analyzed: 'dir bye las gzhal yas khang 'khor lo rim pa bzhi gru chad la sgo btod pa rta babs dang pad+ma/_dur khrod rdo rje ra bas bskor ba bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni/
translated: Here, the celestial mansion is created from the elements, with four stories and four gates,🔽with archways, lotuses, and so on, surrounded by a vajra fence and charnel grounds.

original: pad+ma dang zla ba'i steng du du 'jigs byed dang dus mtshhan gnyis bsnol ba'i steng
analyzed: pad+ma dang zla ba'i steng du du 'jigs byed dang dus mtshhan gnyis bsnol ba'i steng
translated: On a lotus and moon, create Bhairava and Kālarātri standing back to back.

original: du hum las rdo rje/_de las bde mchog 'khor lo sku mdog nag po zhal bzhi ni/
analyzed: du hum las rdo rje/_de las bde mchog 'khor lo sku mdog nag po zhal bzhi ni/
translated: From dūḥ and haṃ arises a vajra, and from that arises Cakrasaṃvara, who is black and has four faces.

original: nag po dang ljang khu dang /_dmar po dang ser po las spyan gsum gsum pa'o/_/🔽phyag bcu gnyis kyi dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pas rdo rje phag
analyzed: nag po dang ljang khu dang /_dmar po dang ser po las spyan gsum gsum pa'o/_/ phyag bcu gnyis kyi dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pas rdo rje phag
translated: His three eyes are black, green, red, and yellow.🔽With his first two hands he holds a vajra and a bell and embraces red Vajravārāhī, who holds a flaying knife and a skull cup.

original: mo dmar mo gri gug dang thod pa bsnams pa la 'khyud pa/_phyag gnyis kyis glang🔽po che'i lpags pa brgyangs nas 'dzin pa/_de nas g.yas bzhis da ma ru dang dgra
analyzed: mo dmar mo gri gug dang thod pa bsnams pa la 'khyud pa/_phyag gnyis kyis glang po che'i lpags pa brgyangs nas 'dzin pa/_de nas g.yas bzhis da ma ru dang dgra
translated: With two hands he stretches out and holds an elephant skin.🔽Then, with his four right hands he holds a ḍamaru, a battle-ax, a flaying knife, and a trident.

original: sta dang gri gug dang rtshe gsum 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa rnams kyis kha tam kha dang thod
analyzed: sta dang gri gug dang rtshe gsum 'dzin pa/_g.yon pa rnams kyis kha tam kha dang thod
translated: With his four left hands he holds a khaṭvāṅga, a skull cup, a lasso, and a human head.

original: pa dang zhags pa dang tshhangs pa'i mgo bsnams pa/_khro zhing 'jigs pa rus
analyzed: pa dang zhags pa dang tshhangs pa'i mgo bsnams pa/_khro zhing 'jigs pa rus
translated: He is wrathful and terrifying, with a garland of heads.

original: brnyan 'gyur/_rgyud
analyzed: brnyan 'gyur/_rgyud
translated: He is adorned with the five symbolic bone ornaments.

original: pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/_phyogs bzhis pad+ma la mkha' 'gro ma dang lam dang dum skyes ma dang gzugs can ma rnams ni nag mo dang ljang khu dang dmar mo dang ser mo la zhal cig pa spyan gsum pa phyag bzhi'i g.yas rnams kyis da ma ru dang /
analyzed: pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/_phyogs bzhis pad+ma la mkha' 'gro ma dang lam dang dum skyes ma dang gzugs can ma rnams ni nag mo dang ljang khu dang dmar mo dang ser mo la zhal cig pa spyan gsum pa phyag bzhi'i g.yas rnams kyis da ma ru dang /
translated: The four goddesses in the four directions—dakini, Lama, Khaṇḍarohā, and Rūpiṇī—are black, green, red, and yellow, with one face and three eyes.

original: gri gug 'dzin pa/_g.yon rnams na kha tam kha dang thod pa bsnams pa/_g.yas
analyzed: gri gug 'dzin pa/_g.yon rnams na kha tam kha dang thod pa bsnams pa/_g.yas
translated: They hold a ḍamaru and flaying knife in their right hands and a khaṭvāṅga and skull cup in their left hands.🔽They stand with their right legs straight and their left legs bent.

original: brkyang zhing g.yon bskum pa'o/_/mtshhams bzhir sha lnga bdud rtshi lnga'i thod pa bzhi/
analyzed: brkyang zhing g.yon bskum pa'o/_/mtshhams bzhir sha lnga bdud rtshi lnga'i thod pa bzhi/
translated: In the four intermediate directions are the four skull cups of the five meats and five nectars.

original: thugs kyi 'khor lo rtshibs brgyad la shar du thod pa'i dum bu dang rab gtum ma🔽dang /_byang du ko rus chen po dang gtum dmig ma/_nub tu keng rus dang 'od
analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lo rtshibs brgyad la shar du thod pa'i dum bu dang rab gtum ma dang /_byang du ko rus chen po dang gtum dmig ma/_nub tu keng rus dang 'od
translated: On the eight spokes of the mind wheel, in the east are Kapālaḍaṃṣṭrī and Caṇḍākṣī;🔽in the north are Mahākaṅkāla and Caṇḍālī; in the west are Kāṅkālī and Mārajit;🔽and in the south are Dānavīrīṇī and Mahānāsā.🔽In the southeast is Caṇḍī and Caṇḍākṣī;🔽in the southwest is Caṇḍikā and Caṇḍā;🔽in the northwest is Caṇḍī and Caṇḍālinī;

original: ldan ma'o/_/lhor mche ba btshigs pa dang sna chen ma/_shar lhor chang gra dang blo
analyzed: ldan ma'o/_/lhor mche ba btshigs pa dang sna chen ma/_shar lhor chang gra dang blo
translated: and in the northeast is Caṇḍā and Caṇḍikā.

original: gros byang shar du rdo rje lus dang shing grib ma nub byang du rdo rje 'od dang lo ka'i
analyzed: gros byang shar du rdo rje lus dang shing grib ma nub byang du rdo rje 'od dang lo ka'i
translated: Vajra Body is in the northeast, and Tree Shade is in the northwest.🔽

original: dbang phyug ma/_lho nub tu 'od dpag med dang mi'u thung ma rnams so/_/de
analyzed: dbang phyug ma/_lho nub tu 'od dpag med dang mi'u thung ma rnams so/_/de
translated: Vajra Body and Tree Shade are in the northeast, Vajra Light and Lokātikrāntā are in the northwest, Amitābha and Dwarf are in the southwest, and Akṣobhya and Sumbha are in the northeast.

original: rnams ni mthing kha'o/_/gsung gi 'khor lo la myu gu can dang sa bsrungs ma ral🔽pa can dang 'jigs byed ma dpa' chen dang rlung shugs ma/_hum mdzad dang chang 'thung ma/_bzang po dang sngo bsangs ma/_rdo rje 'od dang shin tu
analyzed: rnams ni mthing kha'o/_/gsung gi 'khor lo la myu gu can dang sa bsrungs ma ral pa can dang 'jigs byed ma dpa' chen dang rlung shugs ma/_hum mdzad dang chang 'thung ma/_bzang po dang sngo bsangs ma/_rdo rje 'od dang shin tu
translated: All of them are blue.

original: bzang mo/_'jigs byed dang rta rna ma/_mig bzangs dang bya gdong ma🔽rnams ni dmar mo'o/_/sku'i 'khor lo stobs po che dang shugs can ma/_rin🔽chen rdo rje dang dum skyes ma/_rta mgrin dang chang 'tshhong ma/_nam snying dang go
analyzed: bzang mo/_'jigs byed dang rta rna ma/_mig bzangs dang bya gdong ma rnams ni dmar mo'o/_/sku'i 'khor lo stobs po che dang shugs can ma/_rin chen rdo rje dang dum skyes ma/_rta mgrin dang chang 'tshhong ma/_nam snying dang go
translated: On the wheel of awakened speech, Aṅkura and Pṛthivī, Caṇḍa and Bhairavī, Mahāvīra and Vāyuvegā, Hūṃkāra and Surābhakṣī, Bhadrapāla and Śyāmādevī, Vajraprabha and Subhadrā, Bhairava and Hayakarṇī, Sunetra and Khaṇḍarohā, and Caṇḍa and Dombī are in the east,🔽south, west, and north, respectively.🔽All of them are red.

original: cha ma/_he ru ka dang bzang po/_gar gyi dbang phyug dang stobs chen mo/_rnam snang
analyzed: cha ma/_he ru ka dang bzang po/_gar gyi dbang phyug dang stobs chen mo/_rnam snang
translated: On the wheel of awakened body, Mahābala and Caṇḍī, Ratnavajra and Soṇḍi, Hayagrīva and Surābhakṣī, Akāśagarbha and Varāhī, Heruka and Bhadrikā, Nāṭyeśvara and Mahābalā, Vairocana and Caṇḍālī, and Amoghasiddhi and Pukkasi are in the east,🔽south, west, and north, respectively.🔽All of them are white.

original: dang 'khor lo bsgyur ma/_sems dpa' dang brtshon 'grus ma rnams ni dkar po'o/🔽dpa' bo nyi shu rtsha bzhi ni zhal cig phyag bzhi pa la dang po rdo rje dang dril bu rig
analyzed: dang 'khor lo bsgyur ma/_sems dpa' dang brtshon 'grus ma rnams ni dkar po'o/ dpa' bo nyi shu rtsha bzhi ni zhal cig phyag bzhi pa la dang po rdo rje dang dril bu rig
translated: The male and female bodhisattvas are white.

original: ma la 'khyud pa/_tha ma na kha tam kha dang da ma ru bsnams pa/_zhabs g.yas brkyang
analyzed: ma la 'khyud pa/_tha ma na kha tam kha dang da ma ru bsnams pa/_zhabs g.yas brkyang
translated: The twenty-four heroes have one face and four hands. In the first pair, they hold a vajra and a bell and embrace their knowledge consorts. In the lower pair, they hold a khaṭvāṅga and a ḍamaru. They stand with the right leg straight and the left drawn in.

original: ba g.yon skum pa/_dpa' mo nyi shu rtsha bzhi ni zhal cig pa/_phyag gnyis pa 'khyud
analyzed: ba g.yon skum pa/_dpa' mo nyi shu rtsha bzhi ni zhal cig pa/_phyag gnyis pa 'khyud
translated: The twenty-four heroines have one face and two hands.

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba
translated: The Actual Realization: A Pearl Garland

original: pa'i phyag gis thod pa 'dzin cing g.yas pa gdug pa can sdigs pa'i gri gug
analyzed: pa'i phyag gis thod pa 'dzin cing g.yas pa gdug pa can sdigs pa'i gri gug
translated: They hold a skull cup in the embracing hand and a threatening flaying knife in the right hand.

original: gdengs pa/_sgo rnams su khwa gdong ma dkar mo dang 'ug gdong ma ser mo dang / khyi gdong ma dmar mo dang phag gdong ma ljang khu gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa'o//
analyzed: gdengs pa/_sgo rnams su khwa gdong ma dkar mo dang 'ug gdong ma ser mo dang / khyi gdong ma dmar mo dang phag gdong ma ljang khu gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa'o//
translated: At the gates are white crow-faced, yellow owl-faced, red dog-faced, and green pig-faced [goddesses] holding flaying knives and skull cups.

original: 'tshhams su gshin rje brtan ma dkar ser dang /_pho nya ma dmar ser dang / mche ba dmar ljang dang /_'joms ma dkar ljang rnams ni mi'i gdong pa la/
analyzed: 'tshhams su gshin rje brtan ma dkar ser dang /_pho nya ma dmar ser dang / mche ba dmar ljang dang /_'joms ma dkar ljang rnams ni mi'i gdong pa la/
translated: All of them have three eyes and wrathful, terrifying forms.🔽They stand in the midst of a blazing bonfire.

original: brgyad po 'di ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/_/rigs kyi bdag po ni gtsho bo la mi
analyzed: brgyad po 'di ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/_/rigs kyi bdag po ni gtsho bo la mi
translated: The lords of the families are Akṣobhya in the foreheads of all of them.

original: bskyod pa'o/_/'khor rnams la phyogs phyogs kyi rigs bzhi'o/_/thugs khar
analyzed: bskyod pa'o/_/'khor rnams la phyogs phyogs kyi rigs bzhi'o/_/thugs khar
translated: The retinue is the four families in the four directions.

original: ye shes sems dpa' rang 'dra ba'i thugs kar rdo rje hum gis mtshhan pa la/_ye🔽shes pa spyan drang zhing mchod pa dang bzlas pa ni/_om shi badzra he he ru ru kam hum
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' rang 'dra ba'i thugs kar rdo rje hum gis mtshhan pa la/_ye shes pa spyan drang zhing mchod pa dang bzlas pa ni/_om shi badzra he he ru ru kam hum
translated: In the heart of the gnosis being, who is similar to oneself, there is a vajra marked with hūṃ.🔽Invite the gnosis beings, make offerings, and recite the mantra: oṃ śrī vajra heruka he he heruka hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ dakini jālāṃbhasamaya siddhi hūṃ.

original: hum phat da ki ni dza la sam b+ha ram swa ha/_snying po'i sngags so/_/bstod pa byas
analyzed: hum phat da ki ni dza la sam b+ha ram swa ha/_snying po'i sngags so/_/bstod pa byas
translated: This is the essence mantra.

original: nas dbang bskur ba ni drug cu rtsha gnyis ma'o//_//
analyzed: nas dbang bskur ba ni drug cu rtsha gnyis ma'o//_//
translated: After making praises, confer the empowerment, which is the sixty-two-heap empowerment.

original: drug cu rtsha gnyis ma ser mo'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa
analyzed: drug cu rtsha gnyis ma ser mo'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa
translated: The visualization for the sixty-two-heap yellow dakini is as follows:

original: dang 'byung ba lnga bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir  las pho brang sngar ltar bskyed
analyzed: dang 'byung ba lnga bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir  las pho brang sngar ltar bskyed
translated: The generation of the five elements is as before. Here, the palace is generated as before.

original: la/_lha bskyed pa ni 'jigs byed dus mtshhan gyi steng du hum las rdo rje/_de
analyzed: la/_lha bskyed pa ni 'jigs byed dus mtshhan gyi steng du hum las rdo rje/_de
translated: The generation of the deities is that from hūṃ upon Bhairava and Kālarātri, a vajra arises,

original: las bcom ldan 'das bde mchog 'khor lo sku mdog ser po zhal cig phyag
analyzed: las bcom ldan 'das bde mchog 'khor lo sku mdog ser po zhal cig phyag
translated: from which arises the Bhagavat Cakrasaṃvara, yellow, with one face and two hands,

original: gnyis pa dpa' bo nyi shu rtsha lnga po rdo rje dang dril bu thugs khar bsnol ba'o/_/
analyzed: gnyis pa dpa' bo nyi shu rtsha lnga po rdo rje dang dril bu thugs khar bsnol ba'o/_/
translated: with the twenty-five heroes crossed vajra and bell at the heart.

original: dpa' mo sum cu so bdun gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon
analyzed: dpa' mo sum cu so bdun gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon
translated: The thirty-seven heroines hold flaying knives and skulls. The seed syllable in the heart is hūṃ.

original: hum ngo /_/snying po'i sngags ni om hri ha ha hum hu~m phat/_de nas dbang bskur ba
analyzed: hum ngo /_/snying po'i sngags ni om hri ha ha hum hu~m phat/_de nas dbang bskur ba
translated: The essence mantra is oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ni/_drug cu rtsha gnyis ma ser mo'i cho ga'o//_//🔽ra
analyzed: ni/_drug cu rtsha gnyis ma ser mo'i cho ga'o//_// ra
translated: Then the empowerment conferral is the sixty-two-year-old yellow lady.

original: drug cu rtsha gnyis ma sngon po'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_dal bsgom pa ni bru
analyzed: drug cu rtsha gnyis ma sngon po'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_dal bsgom pa ni bru
translated: The actual practice of the sixty-two-year-old blue lady is the meditation on the maṇḍala of the elements generated from bhrūṃ as before.

original: las sngar ltar la/_lha bskyed pa ni 'jigs byed dang dus mtshhan gyi steng du hum las
analyzed: las sngar ltar la/_lha bskyed pa ni 'jigs byed dang dus mtshhan gyi steng du hum las
translated: The generation of the deities is that from hūṃ upon Bhairava and Kālarātri, a vajra arises,🔽from which arises the Bhagavat Cakrasaṃvara, blue, with one face and two hands,🔽with the twenty-five heroes crossed vajra and bell at the heart.

original: rdo rje/_de las bde mchog ljang khu zhal cig phyag gnyis pa rdo rje dang dril bu
analyzed: rdo rje/_de las bde mchog ljang khu zhal cig phyag gnyis pa rdo rje dang dril bu
translated: From that, one generates oneself as green Cakrasaṃvara with one face and two hands holding a vajra and a bell.

original: thogs pa nyer lnga dpa' mo so bdun kha tam kha dang thod pa thogs pa bskyed la bsgom/
analyzed: thogs pa nyer lnga dpa' mo so bdun kha tam kha dang thod pa thogs pa bskyed la bsgom/
translated: Meditate on the twenty-five heroines and the thirty-seven dakinis holding khaṭvāṅgas and skulls.

original: de nas sngags ni sngar ltar ro dbang bskur bar bya'o//_//
analyzed: de nas sngags ni sngar ltar ro dbang bskur bar bya'o//_//
translated: Then the mantra is as before.

original: bde mchog yab ka dkar po'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_dkyil 'khor
analyzed: bde mchog yab ka dkar po'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_dkyil 'khor
translated: The clear realization of white Cakrasaṃvara the Father is as follows:🔽The creation of the maṇḍala is as before.

original: bskyed pa bru las sngar ltar la/_lha bskyed pa ni 'jigs byed dang dus mtshhan gyi
analyzed: bskyed pa bru las sngar ltar la/_lha bskyed pa ni 'jigs byed dang dus mtshhan gyi
translated: The creation of the deities is as follows: Upon Bhairava and Kālarātri,

original: steng du hum las rdo rje de las bde mchog he ru ka rnam pa lnga dang /_dpa' bo nyi shu
analyzed: steng du hum las rdo rje de las bde mchog he ru ka rnam pa lnga dang /_dpa' bo nyi shu
translated: from hūṃ arises a vajra, from which arises white Cakrasaṃvara Heruka with five aspects and the twenty-four heroes🔽and the thirty-seven dakinis.🔽Their color is white, and they hold vajras and bells.

original: rtsha bzhi sku mdog dkar po rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon ni
analyzed: rtsha bzhi sku mdog dkar po rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon ni
translated: The seed syllable in their hearts is hūṃ.🔽The mantra is the seven syllables.

original: hum ngo /_/sngags ni yi ge bdun pa'o/_/de nas dbang bskur bar bya'o//_//
analyzed: hum ngo /_/sngags ni yi ge bdun pa'o/_/de nas dbang bskur bar bya'o//_//

analyzed: bde mchog yum bka' so bdun gyi bdag nyid kyi dal bskyed pa sngar ltar
translated: The creation of the maṇḍala of the thirty-seven deities of the mother Cakrasaṃvara is as before.

analyzed: la/_lha bskyed pa ni bam las gri gug de las dpa' mo so bdun dmar mo zhal
translated: The generation of the deity: From BUM comes a flaying knife, and from that a red hero-lady with🔽🔽

analyzed: cig phyag gnyis ma/_da ma ru dang thod pa thogs pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon
translated: The generation of the deity: From BHAṀ comes a flaying knife, and from that a red heroine with one face and two hands, holding a small drum and a skull.🔽The seed syllable in the heart is BHAṀ.

original: ni bam mo/_/om badzra bai ro tsha ni ye hum hum phat zhes pa ni snying po'o/_/de nas
analyzed: ni bam mo/_/om badzra bai ro tsha ni ye hum hum phat zhes pa ni snying po'o/_/de nas

analyzed: bstod pa byas la dbang bskur ba ni bde mchog yum bka'o//
translated: Then, having made praise, the empowerment is conferred, which is the mother section of Cakrasaṃvara.

analyzed: bde mchog bcu gsum pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sogs pa
translated: The direct realization of the thirteen deities of Cakrasaṃvara:

analyzed: dang 'byung ba lnga'i dal bskyed pa sngon du song nas/_skad cig gis sna tshhogs rdo
translated: Having first gathered the accumulations and generated the five-element maṇḍala,🔽in an instant, in the center of a multicolored vajra cross,

analyzed: rje'i lte bar dur khrod chen po brgyad kyi steng du/_bde mchog bcu gsum ma me

analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba

analyzed: long la bris sku'i gzugs brnyan shar ba ltar wa le/_hri ge gsal bar bsgom

analyzed: pa ni bru las gzhal yas khang pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa gru chad la sgo btod pa can
translated: The celestial palace is generated from the syllable bhrūṃ. It is a celestial palace with a four-doored, eight-petaled lotus.

translated: In the center of that, upon Bhairava and Kālarātri, is glorious🔽Cakrasaṃvara, blue in color, with four faces—the principal face is blue, the right face is green, the left face is red, and the rear face is yellow. He has three eyes in each face and is adorned with a head ornament of five dry skulls and the six bone ornaments.

analyzed: pa na dgra sta/_lnga pa na gri gug_/drug pa na mdung rtshe gsum bsnams pa'o/_/

analyzed: g.yon gyi gsum pa na kha tam kha/_bzhi pa na thod pa lnga pa na zhags pa/_drug pa na

analyzed: tshhangs pa'i mgo'o/_/yum phag mo dmar mo zhal cig pa spyan gsum pa/_phyag gnyis kyis zangs gri dang thod pa 'dzin pa/_shar gyi 'dab ma la mkha' 'gro ma

analyzed: nag mo/_byang du ljang khu/_nub du dmar mo/_lhor ser mo/_mtshhams bzhi la
translated: On the petal in the east is black dakini; in the north, green ḍākinī; in the west, red ḍākinī; in the south, yellow ḍākinī; and in the four intermediate directions,

analyzed: bum pa bzhi'i steng du thod pa/_shar sgor khwa gdong ma/_byang sgor 'ug gdong ma/

analyzed: nub sgor khyi gdong ma/_lho sgor phag gdong ma/_sku mdog nang ma dang 'thun/

analyzed: shar lhor gshin rje brtan ma/_byang shar du 'joms ma nub byang du mche ba mo/
translated: In the southeast is Sthirajayā; in the northeast, Jayā; in the northwest, Dānavīriṇī;

analyzed: lho nub tu pho nya mo/_sku mdog byed gzugs ma/_mkha' 'gro bcu gnyis po de zhal

analyzed: cig pa la spyan gsum pa/_phyag bzhi pa la g.yas gnyis na gri gug dang da ma ru/
translated: The first has three eyes, and the four-armed has a flaying knife and a ḍamaru in the two right hands and a skull cup and khaṭvāṅga in the two left hands.

analyzed: g.yon gnyis na thod pa dang kha tam kha/_g.yon brkyang ba'i stabs kyis ro'i gdan

analyzed: la bzhugs pa'o/_/ye shes pa spyan drang zhing mchod nas/_bzlas pa ni/_om shri
translated: After inviting the awareness beings and making offerings, the recitation is: oṃ śrī🔽vajraheruka heruka huṃ phaṭ🔽takinī jvalasaṃbhara svāhā

analyzed: badzra he he ru ru kam hu hu~m phat/_ta ki ni dz+wa la sam b+ha ra swa ha/_zhes bzlas la

original: brtan 'gyur/_rgyud/
analyzed: brtan 'gyur/_rgyud/
translated: The descent of awareness is the same as before.

original: dbang bskur ba ni bcu gsum ma'o//_//
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni bcu gsum ma'o//_//

analyzed: lhan skyes lha lnga'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa dang 'byung ba

analyzed: rim rtsheg bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir bru las pho brang 'dab brgyad gru chad la sgo btod pa bskyed la der 'jigs byed dang dus mtshhan gyi steng du he ru ka zhal
translated: Here, the palace is created from bhrūṃ as an eight-petaled lotus with a surrounding terrace and🔽gates. A heruka with one face and two arms holding a vajra and a bell at the heart is created on top of Bhairava and Kālarātri.

analyzed: cig phyag gnyis pa/_rdo rje dang dril bu thugs khar 'dzin pa/_yum dmar mo

analyzed: g.yon pa thod pa gtsho bo la 'khyud pa/_g.yas gri gug nam mkha' la 'phyar ba/ phyogs kyi 'dab ma bzhi la rdo rje da ki ma dkar mo las kyi da ki ma ljang khu/_pad+ma

analyzed: da ki ma dmar mo/_rin chen da ki ma ser mo/_g.yas gri gug g.yon thod pa

analyzed: bzung nas ro'i gdan la phyed dkyil gyis bzhugs pa'o/_/spyan drang zhing mchod

analyzed: pa byas nas bzlas pa ni/_om hri ha ha hu hu~m phat zhes bzlas la dbang bskur
translated: After inviting them and making offerings, the recitation is “oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hu hu phaṭ.”

original: ba ni lha lnga pa'o//_//
analyzed: ba ni lha lnga pa'o//_//

analyzed: bde mchog te lo pa'i lha dgu'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sogs

analyzed: pa las sogs pa sngar bstan nas/_'dir bye las pad ma 'dab ma brgyad pa

analyzed: bskyed la/_de'i nang du 'jigs byed dang dus mtshhan gyi steng du bcom ldan
translated: In its center, upon Bhairava and Kālarātri, is the Bhagavān,🔽white in color with four faces—white on the right, red on the left,

analyzed: 'das sku mdog dkar po zhal bzhi'i g.yas dkar po/_g.yon dmar ba steng

analyzed: zhal ser ba/_spyan gsum gsum pa g.yas kyi phyag brgyad rnams kyi sdigs 'dzub

translated: a vajra, a bell, a lasso, a perfume vase, a sword, a spear, and a battle-ax. In his eight left hands he holds a skull cup, a goad, a bow,

analyzed: dang kha tam kha dang mda' dang 'khor lo dang skyab sbyin dang thod pa'o/_/nam

analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/

analyzed: bza' dkar po gsol ba zhi zhing bzhad pa'i zhal/_pad+ma 'dab brgyad la gshin

analyzed: rje bstan ma la swo pa brgyad tshhe'i bum pa thogs pa'o/_/spyan drang zhing mchod la

analyzed: bzlas pa bya ba ni/_snying khar zla ba'i dal la sngags kyi 'khor lo gsal bar

analyzed: dmigs te/_'chi ba la skyob par byed pa'i rigs sngags 'di bzlas te/_om
translated: Recite this knowledge mantra that protects from death:🔽oṃ nīlāmbaro darśanīyo

analyzed: asmri ta pan tsha ba ni/_ma ha armi ta bu mu khe 'dzim bam/_spra pe sha ya spra pe sha

analyzed: ya sarba badzra pad+ma sa ma yo ge ma ya sgo d+he tshi ta pa ti si ta mur te hum hum a a am a
translated: Sarva-vajra-padma-samayoga-maya-godhe-tshitapati-sitamurte hum hum a a aam🔽Svaha.🔽By reciting this, one will be liberated from all deaths.

analyzed: swa ha/_zhes bzlas pas 'chi ba thams cad las thar par byed do/_/de nas
translated: Then,

analyzed: dbang bskur bar bya'o//_//

analyzed: pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa sngon du song nas 'dir bru las gzhal yas khang rtshibs

analyzed: drug bskyed la/_de'i nang du 'jigs byed dang dus mtshhan gyi steng du hum las rdo

analyzed: rje/_de las he ru ka zhal gsum pa sku dang rtsha zhal nag pa/_g.yas ser

analyzed: g.yon ljang khu spyan gsum pa/_phyag drug pa'i dang po gnyis kyis yum la 'khyud

analyzed: cing /_rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa/_bar ma gnyis kyis mi'i lpags pa dang kha tam

analyzed: khro bo'i chas kyis brgyan pa/_yum sku mdog dang zhal phyag mtshhan rang 'dra ba la

analyzed: khyad par du bar ma gnyis kyis mda' gzhu 'dzin pa'o/_/bcom ldan 'das

analyzed: dang snyoms zhugs byas pas mchog dang dga' bas myong bar bsam mo/_/rtshibs

analyzed: las snang byed ma ljang khu/_hri las rdo rje drag mo/_du ba'i mdog_/om las rdo rje

analyzed: ma ru dang dril bu sgra sgrog cing 'dzin pa/_tha ma gnyis kyis kha tam kha dang thod pa 'dzin pa/_khro mo'i cha lugs kyis bzhugs pa'o/_/ye shes pa spyan drang zhing mchod nas yi ge bdun pa bzlas te dbang bskur ba ni yi ge bdun pa'i cho ga gnyis
translated: The last two hold a khaṭvāṅga and a skull cup.🔽They stand in the wrathful aspect.

analyzed: med rdo rjes mdzad pa lha brgyad ma'i mngon par rtogs pa'o//_//
translated: The invitation of the awareness beings, the offerings, the recitation of the seven syllables, and the conferral of empowerment are according to the two-part Vajraḍāka’s composition, the Realization of the Eight Deities.

original: rdo rje gur rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor lnga'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_bru
analyzed: rdo rje gur rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor lnga'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_bru
translated: The realization of the five mandalas of the five families of the Vajrapañjara is as follows:

analyzed: las gzhal yas khang bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir rdo rje mkha' 'gro ni/_sku

analyzed: 'dzin pa/_sdu gu dung phor 'dzin pa sog pa ku mu ta 'dzin pa/_bre pad ma

analyzed: 'dzin pa/_phul rin chen 'dzin pa/_gro zhun me tog 'dzin pa/_byi zhun

analyzed: khrums smad sbrul zhags 'dzin pa/_nam gru pad ma 'dzin pa/_tha skar rdo rje

analyzed: phyogs skyong bcu dang rgyal po bzhi'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las

analyzed: pad+ma 'dab ma bzhi 'khor lo rtshibs bcu sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed

translated: The generation of the deity is the generation of the blue-black Vajrapāṇi in the center, with a vajra threatening mudra and a bell held aloft,🔽adorned with the four types of snakes.🔽On the four petals of the lotus, generate Dhṛtarāṣṭra in the east, white and holding a lute; Virūḍhaka in the south, blue and holding a sword;

analyzed: spyan mi bzang dmar po mchod rten thogs pa/_rnam sras ser po rgyal mtshhan

analyzed: thogs pa'o/_/rtshibs bcu la brgya byin ser po rdo rje rtshe gsum thogs pa/_me

analyzed: lha dmar po me thab thogs pa'o/_/gshin rje nag po dbyug to thogs pa srin po

analyzed: mthing kha ral gri thogs pa/_chu lha dkar po zhags pa thogs pa/_rlung lha dud
translated: Varuṇa is white and holds a noose.🔽Pavana is smoke-colored and holds a banner.

analyzed: kha ba dan thogs pa/_gnod sbyin ljang khu dbyug to thog pa/_dbang ldan

analyzed: dkar po tri shul thogs pa/_tshhangs pa dkar dmar nyi zla thogs pa/_sa bdag

original: ser po bum pa thogs pa'o/_/lha mo bzhi dang sgo ba bzhi yang bskyed la/_sngags ci
analyzed: ser po bum pa thogs pa'o/_/lha mo bzhi dang sgo ba bzhi yang bskyed la/_sngags ci

analyzed: rigs par bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni rgyal chen phyogs skyong gi cho ga'o/_/

original: klu chen po brgyad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_bru las pho
analyzed: klu chen po brgyad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_bru las pho
translated: The manifest realization of the maṇḍala of the eight great nāgas is as follows:

analyzed: brang 'dab brgyad sgo 'khyams dang bcas pa bskyed la/_hum las badzra pa ni/

analyzed: phu las klu chen po brgyad/_phyogs mtshhon du thal mo sbyar ba bskyed la/_sgo
translated: The eight great nāgas are generated in the four directions and four corners with palms joined.🔽The four families are also generated in the four doors.🔽The essence mantras of these syllables are:

analyzed: bzhir rigs bzhi yang bskyed de/_yi ge 'di rnams kyi snying po/_ga_badzra pa ni drug drug pa

analyzed: dang bcu gsum pa dang /_gzungs rings bzlas la/_dbang bskur bar bya
translated: The empowerment is conferred.

analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/

translated: is the ritual of the eight nāgas.

analyzed: gdan bzhi nam mkha' rnal 'byor gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs
translated: The direct revelation of the yoga of the sky of the Four Seats

analyzed: sog pa dang /_'byung ba lha'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngon du song nas/ 'dir bru las re dmig dgu pa la pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa dang /_'dab ma
translated: is the creation of the maṇḍala of the elements in space.🔽Here, having created the nine-part grid with the eight-petaled lotus and the sixteen-petaled lotus,

analyzed: bcu drug pa dang khyams sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_der lha bskyed pa ni/
translated: and the courtyard with the door, generate the deities there.

analyzed: dbus su seng ge'i steng du nam mkha' rnal 'byor mdog nag po zhal g.yas
translated: In the center, on a lion throne, is ākāśa-yoga, black, with the right face🔽white, the left red, and the upper face black.

original: g.yon dkar ba dang dmar ba'i/_phyag drug gi dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dril
analyzed: g.yon dkar ba dang dmar ba'i/_phyag drug gi dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dril
translated: The first two of his six hands hold a vajra and a bell.

original: bu bzung nas yum ye shes mkha' 'gro ma sku mdog zhal phyag yab dang 'dra ba la
analyzed: bu bzung nas yum ye shes mkha' 'gro ma sku mdog zhal phyag yab dang 'dra ba la

analyzed: 'khyud pa/_g.yas kyi bar mas yum gyi nu ma nyed cing 'og mas mda' 'dzin
translated: The middle right hand strokes her breast, and the lower one holds an arrow.

original: pa'o/_/phyag g.yon pa gnyis kyis pad sdong dang gzhu 'dzin pa'o/_/dbu skra
analyzed: pa'o/_/phyag g.yon pa gnyis kyis pad sdong dang gzhu 'dzin pa'o/_/dbu skra
translated: The two left hands hold a lotus stalk and a bow.

original: kham pa gyen du 'bar ba/_rus pa'i rgyan drug stag gi sham thabs gsol ba'o/_/
analyzed: kham pa gyen du 'bar ba/_rus pa'i rgyan drug stag gi sham thabs gsol ba'o/_/
translated: His tawny hair swirls upward, and he is adorned with the six bone ornaments and a tiger-skin skirt.

original: shar gyi re dmig la glang po che'i steng du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dkar mo/_byang du🔽rma bya'i steng du 'jigs byed ma ser mo/_nub tu sbrul gyi steng du ro langs ma
analyzed: shar gyi re dmig la glang po che'i steng du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dkar mo/_byang du rma bya'i steng du 'jigs byed ma ser mo/_nub tu sbrul gyi steng du ro langs ma
translated: In the eastern square, white Vajra dakini is on an elephant.🔽In the north, yellow Bhairava dakini is on a peacock.🔽In the west, red Zombie dakini is on a snake.🔽In the south, blue Fierce dakini is on a bird.

original: dmar mo/_lhor bya'i steng du gtum mo sngon mo/_gtsho mo dang lnga ni/_kha tram
analyzed: dmar mo/_lhor bya'i steng du gtum mo sngon mo/_gtsho mo dang lnga ni/_kha tram
translated: These five are wrathful and naked with loosened hair.

original: kha dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o/_/shar lhor nam mkha' lding gi steng du stag gi gdong🔽can/_dkar ba dang nag po'i mdog can lcags kyu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/
analyzed: kha dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o/_/shar lhor nam mkha' lding gi steng du stag gi gdong can/_dkar ba dang nag po'i mdog can lcags kyu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/
translated: They hold mouths and skulls.🔽In the southeast, on a garuḍa, is tiger-faced white-and-black Gaurī, holding a goad and a noose.

original: byang shar du seng ge'i steng du seng gdong ma dkar ser kha tram kha dang zhags pa🔽'dzin pa/_nub byang du lce spyang gi steng du khyi gdong ma dmar ser 'ug pa'i
analyzed: byang shar du seng ge'i steng du seng gdong ma dkar ser kha tram kha dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_nub byang du lce spyang gi steng du khyi gdong ma dmar ser 'ug pa'i
translated: In the northeast, on a lion, is lion-faced yellow-white Caṇḍālī, holding a khaṭvāṅga and a noose.🔽In the northwest, on a jackal, is jackal-faced red-green Ḍombinī, holding a club and a noose.

original: gdong can dbyug pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_lho nub tu ma he'i steng du lce spyang🔽ma dmar nag dgra sta dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad kyi shar du
analyzed: gdong can dbyug pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_lho nub tu ma he'i steng du lce spyang ma dmar nag dgra sta dang zhags pa 'dzin pa/_pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad kyi shar du
translated: In the southwest, on a buffalo, is jackal-faced dark-red Ṛkṣa, holding an axe and a noose.🔽On the eight lotus petals, in the east is Tongue-Holder, white, holding a tongue in her mouth.

original: lce 'dzin ma dkar mo lce khar bcug pa/_byang du thal mo sbyar ma ser mo spyi bor
analyzed: lce 'dzin ma dkar mo lce khar bcug pa/_byang du thal mo sbyar ma ser mo spyi bor
translated: In the north is Clenched-Fists, yellow, with her hands in añjali at her crown.

original: thal mo sbyar ba/_nub tu 'jigs byed ma ljang khu khrag gi phor pa gsol ba/
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba/_nub tu 'jigs byed ma ljang khu khrag gi phor pa gsol ba/
translated: In the west is Caṇḍālī, green, holding a skull cup of blood.

original: lhor kam 'dzin ma nag mo gtun shing 'dzin pa/_byang shar sgeg mo bsgeg pa/
analyzed: lhor kam 'dzin ma nag mo gtun shing 'dzin pa/_byang shar sgeg mo bsgeg pa/
translated: In the northeast is the flirtatious Flirtatious One.🔽In the northwest is the dancing Dancer.

original: nub byang du gar ma gar byed pa/_lho nub tu glu ma kha'i thad kar sdigs mdzub
analyzed: nub byang du gar ma gar byed pa/_lho nub tu glu ma kha'i thad kar sdigs mdzub
translated: In the southwest, the Songstress waves her threatening gesture toward her mouth.🔽In the southeast is the Lute Player.

original: g.yob pa/_shar lhor pi wam ma/_pad 'dab bcu drug la shar lhor me tog ma
analyzed: g.yob pa/_shar lhor pi wam ma/_pad 'dab bcu drug la shar lhor me tog ma
translated: On the sixteen petals, in the southeast is white Flower Lady;

original: dkar mo/_lho nub tu bdug pa ma ser mo/_nub byang du mar me ma dmar mo/🔽byang shar du dri chab ma ljang khu shar gyi 'dab ma gsum la/_pu ka si dang g+hasma ri
analyzed: dkar mo/_lho nub tu bdug pa ma ser mo/_nub byang du mar me ma dmar mo/ byang shar du dri chab ma ljang khu shar gyi 'dab ma gsum la/_pu ka si dang g+hasma ri
translated: in the southwest is yellow Incense Lady; in the northwest is red Lamp Lady;🔽and in the northeast is green Scent Lady.🔽On the three petals in the east are the three fierce ladies Pukkasī, Ghasmarī, and Caṇḍālī, holding skull cups.

original: gtum mo gsum bdud rtshi'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du 'jigs byed ma dang / 'khra mo dang sha za ma gsum sha lngas bskang ba'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/nub tu drag🔽shul ma dang 'bar ma dang /_mi sdug ma gsum gtor ma'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: gtum mo gsum bdud rtshi'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du 'jigs byed ma dang / 'khra mo dang sha za ma gsum sha lngas bskang ba'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/nub tu drag shul ma dang 'bar ma dang /_mi sdug ma gsum gtor ma'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: In the north are Caṇḍikā, Ḍombinī, and Piśācī, holding a skull cup filled with the five elixirs.🔽In the west are Caṇḍālī, Jvalinī, and Bībhatsa, holding a skull cup filled with gtor ma.

original: lho ru thod pa ma dang /_rdo rje ma dang bum pa ma rnams gtung ba'i snod 'dzin
analyzed: lho ru thod pa ma dang /_rdo rje ma dang bum pa ma rnams gtung ba'i snod 'dzin
translated: In the south are Kapālinī, Vajrī, and Kalaśī, holding a skull cup filled with a beverage.

original: pa'o/_/shar sgor khyab 'jug nag po/_byang du tshhangs pa ser po/_nub tu🔽dbang phyug dkar po/_lhor gdong drug dmar po/_dbang ldan du dbang po
analyzed: pa'o/_/shar sgor khyab 'jug nag po/_byang du tshhangs pa ser po/_nub tu dbang phyug dkar po/_lhor gdong drug dmar po/_dbang ldan du dbang po
translated: At the eastern gate is black Viṣṇu, at the northern gate yellow Brahmā, at the western gate white Maheśvara, and at the southern gate red Skanda.

original: ser po/_nub byang du chu lha dkar po/_lho nub tu gshin rje nag po shar lhor🔽lus ngan ser po/_shar gyi snam bu la thod pa'i 'jigs byed dang /_kha tram kha'i🔽srin po tshhogs kyi dbang phyug dang dril bu'i rna ba can rnams dkar po/_byang du
analyzed: ser po/_nub byang du chu lha dkar po/_lho nub tu gshin rje nag po shar lhor lus ngan ser po/_shar gyi snam bu la thod pa'i 'jigs byed dang /_kha tram kha'i srin po tshhogs kyi dbang phyug dang dril bu'i rna ba can rnams dkar po/_byang du
translated: At the northeast corner is yellow Indra, at the northwest corner white Varuṇa, at the southwest corner black Yama, and at the southeast corner yellow Kubera.🔽On the eastern band are white Bhairava of the Skull, Khaṭvāṅga Rākṣa, and Ghaṇṭākarṇa.

original: gtum po'i dbang phyug_/myun pa'i lha/_rigs kyi dbang phyug_/'jigs su🔽rung ba rnams ser po/_nub tu drag po'i 'dod pas sa ri dbang phyug_/ta ru🔽'du byed/_rnga sgra 'jigs byed rnams dmar po/_lhor gtum po dbang phyug_/
analyzed: gtum po'i dbang phyug_/myun pa'i lha/_rigs kyi dbang phyug_/'jigs su rung ba rnams ser po/_nub tu drag po'i 'dod pas sa ri dbang phyug_/ta ru 'du byed/_rnga sgra 'jigs byed rnams dmar po/_lhor gtum po dbang phyug_/
translated: On the northern band are yellow Caṇḍīśvara, Vāyu, Kubera, and Bhīṣaṇa.🔽On the western band are red Rudra, Śarīra, Taruṇa, and Bheruṇḍa Bhairava.

original: tha ra g+ha dro dbang phyug mche ba btshigs pa/_gzhu 'dzin rnams nag po/_khyab
analyzed: tha ra g+ha dro dbang phyug mche ba btshigs pa/_gzhu 'dzin rnams nag po/_khyab
translated: On the southern band are black Caṇḍīśvara, Tarakṣa, Daṃṣṭri, and Dhanurdhara.

original: 'jug la sogs pa nyi shu rtsha bzhi po 'di dag ni/_zhal cig pa/_spyan gsum pa/
analyzed: 'jug la sogs pa nyi shu rtsha bzhi po 'di dag ni/_zhal cig pa/_spyan gsum pa/
translated: These twenty-four, beginning with Acala, have one face, three eyes,🔽and are wrathful.

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The name of the text is The Pearl Rosary of Realization.🔽The two right hands hold a vajra and khaṭvāṅga, and the two left hands

original: phyag bzhi'i g.yas gnyis kyis rdo rje dang kha tram kha 'dzin pa/_g.yon gnyis kyis🔽dril bu dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o/_/rang 'od kyi rig ma la 'khyud pa/_mi
analyzed: phyag bzhi'i g.yas gnyis kyis rdo rje dang kha tram kha 'dzin pa/_g.yon gnyis kyis dril bu dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o/_/rang 'od kyi rig ma la 'khyud pa/_mi
translated: hold a bell and skull cup.🔽They embrace the awareness partner who is their own radiance,

original: bskyod pa la sogs pa rigs kyi bdag po rnams kyis mtshhan pa'o/_/snying kha'i sa
analyzed: bskyod pa la sogs pa rigs kyi bdag po rnams kyis mtshhan pa'o/_/snying kha'i sa
translated: and are marked by Akṣobhya and so forth, the lords of the families.🔽The seed syllable in the heart is hūṃ.

original: bon ni hum ngo /_/spyan drangs mchod la/_sngags ni/_om hum ha swa ha/_zhes🔽bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni gdan bzhi nam mkha'i rnal 'byor yab bka'o/_/
analyzed: bon ni hum ngo /_/spyan drangs mchod la/_sngags ni/_om hum ha swa ha/_zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni gdan bzhi nam mkha'i rnal 'byor yab bka'o/_/
translated: The mantra to recite in the invocation and offering is oṃ hūṃ ha svahā.🔽The empowerment is conferred.

original: gdan bzhi ye shes mkha' 'gro'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa
analyzed: gdan bzhi ye shes mkha' 'gro'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa
translated: The realization of the Gnosis Ḍākinī of the Four Seats is as follows:

original: dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir rgyu las pad ma
analyzed: dang 'byung ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa sngar ltar la/_'dir rgyu las pad ma
translated: The creation of the maṇḍala of the five elements and the accumulation of the accumulations are as before.🔽Here, the cause is a lotus.

original: 'dab ma brgyad pa/_gru chad la sgo btod pa can du bskyed la/_nyi zla pad+ma
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad pa/_gru chad la sgo btod pa can du bskyed la/_nyi zla pad+ma
translated: It has eight petals and four corners with gates.

original: dang seng ge'i steng du/_ye shes mkha' 'gro ma sngon mo zhal gsum g.yas dkar
analyzed: dang seng ge'i steng du/_ye shes mkha' 'gro ma sngon mo zhal gsum g.yas dkar
translated: On top of the sun, moon, lotus, and lion is blue dakini of Timeless Awareness with three faces—the right one white,

original: ba/_g.yon dmar ba/_spyan gsum gsum pa/_phyag drug gi g.yas gsum
analyzed: ba/_g.yon dmar ba/_spyan gsum gsum pa/_phyag drug gi g.yas gsum
translated: the left one red—and three eyes each.

original: na kha tram kha dang /_dgra sta dang /_rdo rje/_g.yon gsum na dril bu dang zhags pa dang khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa bsnams pa'o/_/shar du rdo rje mkha'🔽'gro dkar mo/_byang du 'jigs byed mkha' 'gro ser mo/_nub tu ro langs
analyzed: na kha tram kha dang /_dgra sta dang /_rdo rje/_g.yon gsum na dril bu dang zhags pa dang khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa bsnams pa'o/_/shar du rdo rje mkha' 'gro dkar mo/_byang du 'jigs byed mkha' 'gro ser mo/_nub tu ro langs
translated: Of her six arms, the three right hands hold a flaying knife, battle-ax, and vajra, and the three left hands hold a skull cup filled with blood, a bell, and a lasso.

original: ma dmar mo/_lhor gtum mo sngon mo seng ge'i gdan la kha tam kha dang thod pa🔽bsnams pa'o/_/byang shar du seng ge gdong ma dkar mdangs ser ba'i lus
analyzed: ma dmar mo/_lhor gtum mo sngon mo seng ge'i gdan la kha tam kha dang thod pa bsnams pa'o/_/byang shar du seng ge gdong ma dkar mdangs ser ba'i lus
translated: In the east is white Vajra dakini; in the north is yellow Dreadful dakini; in the west is red Zombie dakini; and in the south is blue Fierce One, blue in color, holding a flaying knife and a skull cup on a lion throne.

original: phyed ma glang po la bzhugs pa/_nub byang du 'ug gdong ma dmar ser klu'i
analyzed: phyed ma glang po la bzhugs pa/_nub byang du 'ug gdong ma dmar ser klu'i
translated: In the northeast is white Lion Face, half of her body yellow, standing on an elephant; in the northwest is orange Owl Face, standing on a snake; in the southwest is red Dog Face, standing on a human; and in the northeast is green Pig Face, standing on a water buffalo.

original: gdan la bzhugs pa/_lho nub tu lce spyang gdong dmar nag ma he la bzhugs pa/🔽shar lhor stag gdong ma dkar sngo rin po che'i gdan la bzhugs pa/_rdo rje🔽zhags pa dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/shar sgor rgyal ba'i dbang phyug ma dkar mo
analyzed: gdan la bzhugs pa/_lho nub tu lce spyang gdong dmar nag ma he la bzhugs pa/ shar lhor stag gdong ma dkar sngo rin po che'i gdan la bzhugs pa/_rdo rje zhags pa dang pad+ma 'dzin pa'o/_/shar sgor rgyal ba'i dbang phyug ma dkar mo
translated: They are seated on thrones. In the southwest, red-faced jackal-faced red Hayakarṇī sits on a buffalo.🔽In the southeast, white-blue tiger-faced sits on a jewel throne, holding a vajra and a noose.🔽At the eastern gate, white Jayāvatī sits on a horse, holding a skull and a flaying knife.

original: phyag khar bcug pa/_byang du thal mo sbyar ba/_nub tu 'jigs byed dmar mo
analyzed: phyag khar bcug pa/_byang du thal mo sbyar ba/_nub tu 'jigs byed dmar mo
translated: In the north, she has her palms together. In the west, red Bhairavī

original: khrag 'thung ba/_lhor kam 'dzin nag mo sdigs mdzub gsang gnas su btshugs pa
analyzed: khrag 'thung ba/_lhor kam 'dzin nag mo sdigs mdzub gsang gnas su btshugs pa
translated: drinks blood. In the south, black Kaṃdhārī points a threatening gesture at her genitals.

original: lha mo bcu gsum po thod pa dang rus pa'i brgyan byas pa/_rigs lngas so sor
analyzed: lha mo bcu gsum po thod pa dang rus pa'i brgyan byas pa/_rigs lngas so sor
translated: The thirteen goddesses are adorned with skulls and bone ornaments. They are marked with the five families

original: dbu la mtshhan pa/_thugs kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/sngags ni/_om hri swa ha
analyzed: dbu la mtshhan pa/_thugs kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/sngags ni/_om hri swa ha
translated: on their heads. The seed syllable in their hearts is hūṃ. The mantra is oṃ hri svāhā.

original: zhes pa'o/_/de nas dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje gdan bzhi'i yum bka'o/
analyzed: zhes pa'o/_/de nas dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje gdan bzhi'i yum bka'o/
translated: Next, the empowerment is the consort of the four vajra seats.

original: sangs rgyas thod pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa sngon du
analyzed: sangs rgyas thod pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa sngon du
translated: The realization of Buddhakapāla is the accumulation of merit🔽.

original: song nas 'dir rgyu las gzhal yas khang /_rtshibs brgyad pa gsum la sgo btod
analyzed: song nas 'dir rgyu las gzhal yas khang /_rtshibs brgyad pa gsum la sgo btod
translated: It has three stories with eight sides and four gates.

original: pa/_lha bskyed pa ni mi ro'i steng du sangs rgyas thod pa/_zhal cig phyag bzhi
analyzed: pa/_lha bskyed pa ni mi ro'i steng du sangs rgyas thod pa/_zhal cig phyag bzhi
translated: The generation of the deities: Upon a human corpse is Buddhakapala, with one face and four arms.

original: pa/_sku mdog mthing kha/_zhabs gnyis skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis
analyzed: pa/_sku mdog mthing kha/_zhabs gnyis skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis
translated: His body is blue in color, and he stands in the half-dance posture with his two legs crossed.

original: bzhugs pa/_phyag g.yas gnyis na gri gug dang da ma ru/_g.yon na thod pa
analyzed: bzhugs pa/_phyag g.yas gnyis na gri gug dang da ma ru/_g.yon na thod pa
translated: In his two right hands he holds a flaying knife and a ḍamaru, and in his two left hands he holds a skull cup and a khaṭvāṅga.🔽He wears a tiger-skin skirt, an elephant-skin shawl, and the six bone ornaments.

original: dang kha tam kha 'dzin pa/_stag gi sham thabs dang glang po che'i stod g.yogs dang rus pa'i rgyan drug gsol ba/_mnga' bdag gi btshun mo ni sna tshhogs rdo rje ma
analyzed: dang kha tam kha 'dzin pa/_stag gi sham thabs dang glang po che'i stod g.yogs dang rus pa'i rgyan drug gsol ba/_mnga' bdag gi btshun mo ni sna tshhogs rdo rje ma
translated: The lord’s consort is Viśvaḍombinī.

original: dmar mo zhal cig phyag gnyis ma yab kyi mgrin pa la chags pa'i phyag g.yon pas
analyzed: dmar mo zhal cig phyag gnyis ma yab kyi mgrin pa la chags pa'i phyag g.yon pas
translated: She is red, with one face and two arms, and she embraces the lord’s neck.

original: khrag gi rgyun 'dzin pa'i thod pa stob pa/_g.yas gri gug gdengs pa'o/_/rtshibs kyi
analyzed: khrag gi rgyun 'dzin pa'i thod pa stob pa/_g.yas gri gug gdengs pa'o/_/rtshibs kyi
translated: With her left hand she offers him a skull cup filled with a stream of blood, and with her right hand she holds a flaying knife.🔽In the east of the courtyard is Kāṇha, with a garland of skulls.

original: shar nas nag po la legs pa'i phreng ba can ma/_byang du thod pa can ma/_nub
analyzed: shar nas nag po la legs pa'i phreng ba can ma/_byang du thod pa can ma/_nub
translated: In the north is Kapālin, and in the west is Caṇḍālī.

original: tu 'jigs can ma/_lhor gzhan gyis mi thub ma'o/_/mtshhams bzhir 'dod
analyzed: tu 'jigs can ma/_lhor gzhan gyis mi thub ma'o/_/mtshhams bzhir 'dod
translated: In the south is Aparajita.🔽In the four intermediate directions are the four skull cups filled with the sense offerings.

original: yon gyis bskang ba'i thod pa bzhi'o/_/pad+ma 'dab ma dmar po la shar nas dge
analyzed: yon gyis bskang ba'i thod pa bzhi'o/_/pad+ma 'dab ma dmar po la shar nas dge
translated: On the red lotus petals are the eight goddesses:

original: ba'i ske regs ma/_byang du gzugs can ma/_nub tu rnam par rgyal ma/
analyzed: ba'i ske regs ma/_byang du gzugs can ma/_nub tu rnam par rgyal ma/
translated: in the east is Kshitigati; in the north is Rupika; in the west is Vijaya;

original: lhor 'dod byed ma/_byang shar nag mo/_nub byang sdod ma/_lho nub tu
analyzed: lhor 'dod byed ma/_byang shar nag mo/_nub byang sdod ma/_lho nub tu
translated: in the south is Kamadava; in the northeast is Krishna; in the northwest is Vasini;🔽in the southwest is Harikari; and in the northeast is Mahasara.

original: 'phrog ma/_shar lhor rgya mtshho chen mo/_rtshibs dkar mo brgyad pa la/_shar du
analyzed: 'phrog ma/_shar lhor rgya mtshho chen mo/_rtshibs dkar mo brgyad pa la/_shar du
translated: The eight white goddesses are:

original: sgrol ma/_byang du lo ga ma/_nub tu legs mthong ma/_lhor mi thub ma/
analyzed: sgrol ma/_byang du lo ga ma/_nub tu legs mthong ma/_lhor mi thub ma/
translated: in the east is Tara; in the north is Lokama; in the west is Sudarshana; in the south is Aparajita;🔽in the northeast is Shveta; in the northwest is Yasodhari; in the southwest is Kalaratri;🔽and in the northeast is Chhaya.

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/🔽byang shar du dge ba mo/_nub byang du grags can ma/_lho nub tu dus mtshhan ma/
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/ byang shar du dge ba mo/_nub byang du grags can ma/_lho nub tu dus mtshhan ma/
translated: The eight goddesses at the gates are:🔽in the east is Sundari; in the north is Bhudevi; in the west is Varnini;🔽and in the south is Ghasmari.🔽The eight goddesses of the intermediate directions are:

original: shar lhor grib gnon ma/_shar sgor mdzes ma/_byang sgor sa'i lha mo/_nub
analyzed: shar lhor grib gnon ma/_shar sgor mdzes ma/_byang sgor sa'i lha mo/_nub
translated: in the southeast is Pushkiri; in the southwest is Mahapatala; in the northwest is Mahabala;🔽and in the northeast is Mahamanini.

original: sgor skal bzangs ma/_lho'i sgor yid 'ong ma/_'di rnams thams cad phyag mtshhan
analyzed: sgor skal bzangs ma/_lho'i sgor yid 'ong ma/_'di rnams thams cad phyag mtshhan
translated: at the western gate is Manohara, and at the northern gate is Subhadra. All of them have the hand implements of flaying knives and skulls.

original: gri gug dang thod pa/_sku mdog nag mo/_rigs lnga so sos dbu la mtshhan pa'o/_/
analyzed: gri gug dang thod pa/_sku mdog nag mo/_rigs lnga so sos dbu la mtshhan pa'o/_/
translated: Their bodies are black, and each is marked on the head by one of the five families.

original: thugs ka'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/snying po'i sngags ni om bud d+ha ka pa li ni a ni a
analyzed: thugs ka'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/snying po'i sngags ni om bud d+ha ka pa li ni a ni a
translated: The seed syllable at the heart is hūṃ. The essence mantra is oṃ buddha kapālinī anīte hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: tih:hi hi hum phat/_zhes bzlas nas dbang bskur ba ni sangs rgyas thod pa'o/
analyzed: tih:hi hi hum phat/_zhes bzlas nas dbang bskur ba ni sangs rgyas thod pa'o/
translated: The empowerment conferral by reciting this is the Buddha Kapāla.

original: sangs rgyas thod pa lha dgu'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa sngon
analyzed: sangs rgyas thod pa lha dgu'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa sngon
translated: The visualization for the nine deities of Buddha Kapāla is as follows:

original: du song nas/_'dir rgyu las pad+ma 'dab brgyad sgo dang bcas pa bskyed pa'i nang🔽du gtsho bo yab yum sngar gsung pa lta bu la/_'khor brgyad ni shar nas rim pa
analyzed: du song nas/_'dir rgyu las pad+ma 'dab brgyad sgo dang bcas pa bskyed pa'i nang du gtsho bo yab yum sngar gsung pa lta bu la/_'khor brgyad ni shar nas rim pa
translated: After first gathering the accumulations, here the causal eight-petaled lotus with a door is generated.🔽Inside of that, the principal couple is as previously described.

original: bzhin du sna tshhogs bde ma dang /_'dod ma dang sa 'og gnas ma dang /_legs
analyzed: bzhin du sna tshhogs bde ma dang /_'dod ma dang sa 'og gnas ma dang /_legs
translated: The eight retinue deities are in the eight directions, beginning with the multicolored one in the east.

original: bzang ma rnams ni sku mdog sngon mo/_rus pa'i rgyan dang stag gi sham thabs can
analyzed: bzang ma rnams ni sku mdog sngon mo/_rus pa'i rgyan dang stag gi sham thabs can
translated: The good goddesses are blue, with bone ornaments and tiger-skin skirts.

original: la/_phyag bzhi'i g.yas gnyis na da ma ru dang thod pa/_g.yon gnyis na dril bu
analyzed: la/_phyag bzhi'i g.yas gnyis na da ma ru dang thod pa/_g.yon gnyis na dril bu
translated: In their four hands, the right hands hold a ḍamaru and skull cup, and the left hands hold a bell🔽and khaṭvāṅga.

original: dang kha tram kha/_zur bzhir chang 'tshhong ma dang g.yung mo dang /_phyag bzhi ma
analyzed: dang kha tram kha/_zur bzhir chang 'tshhong ma dang g.yung mo dang /_phyag bzhi ma
translated: In the four corners are the beer goddesses and the yoginīs, with four hands,

original: dang /_nam mkha' gnas pa dang de rnams ni ser mo na bza' ser mo dang stag gi sham thabs gsol ba/_phyag g.yas gnyis kyis gri gug dang da ma ru/🔽g.yon gnyis kyis kha tram kha dang pad+ma bzung ba'o/_/rus pa'i rgyan drug dang mi
analyzed: dang /_nam mkha' gnas pa dang de rnams ni ser mo na bza' ser mo dang stag gi sham thabs gsol ba/_phyag g.yas gnyis kyis gri gug dang da ma ru/ g.yon gnyis kyis kha tram kha dang pad+ma bzung ba'o/_/rus pa'i rgyan drug dang mi
translated: yellow, wearing yellow skirts and tiger-skin skirts, holding a flaying knife and ḍamaru in the two right hands,🔽and a khaṭvāṅga and lotus in the two left hands.🔽They are adorned with the six bone ornaments and a garland of fifty human heads.

original: mgo lnga bcu'i phreng bas brgyan pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon hum ngo /_/sngags ni/
analyzed: mgo lnga bcu'i phreng bas brgyan pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon hum ngo /_/sngags ni/
translated: The seed syllable in their hearts is hūṃ.🔽The mantra is oṃ bhūtakoṇapāṇi āhi hī hūṃ phaṭ.

original: om b+hud d+ha ka pa li ni a hi hi hum phat zhes ci rigs par bzlas la dbang
analyzed: om b+hud d+ha ka pa li ni a hi hi hum phat zhes ci rigs par bzlas la dbang
translated: Recite that as much as appropriate.

original: bskur ba ni lha dgu ma'o/_/
analyzed: bskur ba ni lha dgu ma'o/_/
translated: The empowerment is conferred by the nine goddesses.

original: rdo rje sgrol ma lha bcu gcig gi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa
analyzed: rdo rje sgrol ma lha bcu gcig gi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs sog pa
translated: The eleven-deity Maṇḍala of Vajrottama Tārā

original: sngon du song nas 'dir  las pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/
analyzed: sngon du song nas 'dir  las pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/
translated: Having first gathered the accumulations, here one generates the eight-petaled lotus with a door.

original: lha bskyed pa ni/_dbus su rdo rje sgrol ma sku mdog gser btsho ma lta bu/_zhal
analyzed: lha bskyed pa ni/_dbus su rdo rje sgrol ma sku mdog gser btsho ma lta bu/_zhal
translated: The generation of the deities is as follows: In the center, Vajrottama Tārā is the color of molten gold.

original: bzhi ni ser ba dang /_dkar ba dang /_sngo ba dang /_dmar ba'i zhal la/
analyzed: bzhi ni ser ba dang /_dkar ba dang /_sngo ba dang /_dmar ba'i zhal la/
translated: Her four faces are yellow, white, blue, and red.

original: phyag brgyad na rdo rje dang /_zhags pa dang /_mda' dang /_mdung 'dzin
analyzed: phyag brgyad na rdo rje dang /_zhags pa dang /_mda' dang /_mdung 'dzin
translated: Her eight hands hold a vajra, a lasso, an arrow, and a spear.

original: pa'o/_/ud pal dang /_gzhu dang /_lcags kyu dang /_sdigs mdzub po/
analyzed: pa'o/_/ud pal dang /_gzhu dang /_lcags kyu dang /_sdigs mdzub po/
translated: She holds a blue lotus, a bow, a hook, and a threatening gesture.

original: shar du me tog sgrol ma dkar mo me tog 'dzin pa/_lhor spos kyi sgrol ma ser mo
analyzed: shar du me tog sgrol ma dkar mo me tog 'dzin pa/_lhor spos kyi sgrol ma ser mo
translated: In the east, white Flower Tārā holds a flower. In the south, yellow Incense Tārā

original: spos 'dzin pa/_nub tu mar me'i sgrol ma dmar mo mar me 'dzin pa'o/_/byang
analyzed: spos 'dzin pa/_nub tu mar me'i sgrol ma dmar mo mar me 'dzin pa'o/_/byang
translated: holds incense. In the west, red Lamp Tārā holds a lamp. In the north,

original: du dri mchog sgrol ma ljang khu dri'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/gru bzhi la ni rnam par snang
analyzed: du dri mchog sgrol ma ljang khu dri'i snod 'dzin pa'o/_/gru bzhi la ni rnam par snang
translated: green Supreme Fragrance Tārā holds a perfume container.🔽In the four corners, Vairocana is in the northeast, Ratnasambhava is in the southeast,

original: mdzad la sogs pa'i rdo rje dang /_'khor lo dang /_pad+ma dang /_ral gri'o/_/
analyzed: mdzad la sogs pa'i rdo rje dang /_'khor lo dang /_pad+ma dang /_ral gri'o/_/
translated: The vajra of activity and so forth are the vajra, wheel, lotus, and sword.🔽

original: sgo bzhi la ni sgo ma bzhi'o/_/grwa bzhi la ni yum bzhi'i bum pa bzhi'o/_/steng du
analyzed: sgo bzhi la ni sgo ma bzhi'o/_/grwa bzhi la ni yum bzhi'i bum pa bzhi'o/_/steng du

analyzed: gis ral gri dang gri gug dang rtshe gsum pa/_g.yon gyis phub dang thod pa dang kha

analyzed: pad+ma dang me long bgrang phreng 'dzin pa'o/_/mtshhams rnams su sgrol ma dang gos

original: dang thod pa dang tshhangs pa'i mgo 'dzin pa'o/_/shar smad du nam mkha'i snying po
analyzed: dang thod pa dang tshhangs pa'i mgo 'dzin pa'o/_/shar smad du nam mkha'i snying po

translated: In the upper part of the south is Vajrapāṇi, who is green with six arms. He holds implements like Samantabhadra.🔽In the lower part of the south is Kṣitigarbha, who is like Ratnasambhava.🔽In the upper part of the west is Vajradharma, who is like Samantabhadra.

analyzed: chos kun tu bzang po lta bu/_nub smad sgrib pa rnam sel rnam snang lta bu'o/_/

original: byang stod du ye shes rdo rje kun bzang lta bu'o/_/byang smad du spyan ras gzigs🔽snang ba mtha' yas dang mtshhungs pa'o/_/zur bzhir reg rdo rje ma dang dri rdo rje ma
analyzed: byang stod du ye shes rdo rje kun bzang lta bu'o/_/byang smad du spyan ras gzigs snang ba mtha' yas dang mtshhungs pa'o/_/zur bzhir reg rdo rje ma dang dri rdo rje ma
translated: In the northern part is Jnanavajra, similar to Samantabhadra. In the lower northern part is Avalokiteshvara, similar to Amitabha.

original: dang ro rdo rje ma dang /_gzugs rdo rje ma rnams ni yum bzhi dang mtshhungs pa'o/_/
analyzed: dang ro rdo rje ma dang /_gzugs rdo rje ma rnams ni yum bzhi dang mtshhungs pa'o/_/
translated: In the four corners are Sparshavajrini, Gandhavajrini, Rasavajrini, and Rupvajrini, similar to the four mothers.

original: shar sgor khro bo rab rtog_/lhor skugs byed/_nub rengs byed byang nga rgyal
analyzed: shar sgor khro bo rab rtog_/lhor skugs byed/_nub rengs byed byang nga rgyal
translated: In the eastern gate is the wrathful Subuddhi, in the south is the wrathful Kshudbhuj, in the west is the wrathful Renu, and in the north is the wrathful Manah. These four are similar to the four families.

analyzed: can/_bzhi ni rigs bzhi dang mtshhungs pa'o/_/thugs 'khor gyi dal lha so bzhi'o/_/gsung gi dal rnam pa brgyad la shar du tshar tshi ka_/dmar po zhal cig pa spyan gsum pa g.yas gri gug dang tri shu la/_g.yon gyis thod pa dang kha
translated: In the mandala of the mind wheel there are four deities.

original: tram kha 'dzin pa/_zhabs brkyang skum du bzhugs pa/_'khor lha mo brgyad ni
analyzed: tram kha 'dzin pa/_zhabs brkyang skum du bzhugs pa/_'khor lha mo brgyad ni
translated: In the eight parts of the mandala of the speech wheel, in the east is Tshar Tshig, red, with one face and three eyes, holding a flaying knife and a trident in the right hands and a skull cup and khaṭvāṅga in the left hands, standing with the right leg straight and the left drawn in. The eight goddesses of the retinue are:

original: 'jigs byed ma dang drag mo dang /_mche ba nag mo dang /_me 'bar ma dang / rlung shugs ma dang /_rab gtum ma dang /_drag dmig ma dang /_spos mo
analyzed: 'jigs byed ma dang drag mo dang /_mche ba nag mo dang /_me 'bar ma dang / rlung shugs ma dang /_rab gtum ma dang /_drag dmig ma dang /_spos mo

analyzed: brgyad ni sku mdog phyag mtshhan gtsho mo dang 'thun no/_/shar lhor khyab 'jug ma

analyzed: mtshhan ma dang /_khro bo ma dang /_lce nag ma dang /_mcher btshigs ma dang / nag mo dang 'jigs ma dang /_gzugs can ma rnams so/_/lho nub tu gzhon
translated: In the southwest is the youthful🔽red goddess, holding a mirror and an iron hook.

translated: In the west is red Vaśya, holding a vajra and an arrow,🔽and a bell and a bow.🔽Her retinue is composed of Vajraprabhā,🔽Vṛkī,🔽Kanakā,

analyzed: dang gzhu 'dzin pa la 'khor rdo rje 'od dang lugs can ma dang gser ldan ma dang las dbang ma dang /_sna tshhogs ma dang chu shing ma dang a ha la dang /_mig
translated: Karmavajrī,🔽Viśvarūpī,🔽Kāmadhenu,🔽Ahalyā, and🔽Ajakā.

analyzed: 'bras ma rnams so/_/nub byang 'tshhams su tshhangs pa ma ser mo pad+ma dang dbyug pa

analyzed: dang sbrul 'dzin pa la/_'khor go ri dang kam ka ma dang stan ma dang /_myur ma
translated: Her retinue consists of Gori, Kamkamala, Asani,🔽and Javana.

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The Pearl Rosary: A Manual of Realization

translated: and the tawny and black Bhagini.🔽In the northeast, on a lion, on a lotus, is white Sampushtl,🔽who holds a lotus, a rosary, a vajra, a flower, and a jewel in her two right hands.

analyzed: 'dzin pa la 'khor pad+mo dang zla ba'i ri mo dang ri 'ong 'dzin ma dang ngang ma'i

analyzed: mdog dang /_dga' ma dang pad dbang dang spyan rings dang /_dri med ma'o//
translated: Pukkasī, Caṇḍālī, Ḍombinī, Ḍākinī, Lāmā, Khaṇḍarohā, Rūpiṇī, and Vīrā.

original: lha mo brgyad po thams cad zhal rang rang gi gtsho mo la gzigs pa/_sku mdog
analyzed: lha mo brgyad po thams cad zhal rang rang gi gtsho mo la gzigs pa/_sku mdog
translated: All eight goddesses look at their respective male consorts.🔽Their body colors and hand implements are the same as the male consorts.

original: phyag mtshhan gtsho mo dang 'dra ba/_spyan gsum pa 'gying ba'i tshhul gyis bzhengs🔽nas bzhugs pa ni gsung gi dal lo/_/de nas sku'i dal bcu gnyis ni/_gtsho
analyzed: phyag mtshhan gtsho mo dang 'dra ba/_spyan gsum pa 'gying ba'i tshhul gyis bzhengs nas bzhugs pa ni gsung gi dal lo/_/de nas sku'i dal bcu gnyis ni/_gtsho
translated: They have three eyes and stand in a swaying posture.🔽This is the maṇḍala of enlightened speech.

original: bo la zhag sum cus gtsho byas pa'i lha sum brgya bdun cu rtsha gnyis la dal bcu
analyzed: bo la zhag sum cus gtsho byas pa'i lha sum brgya bdun cu rtsha gnyis la dal bcu
translated: Next, the twelve maṇḍalas of the body are taught to the 372 deities who are the thirty-two channel chakras.🔽The first month is the general month of the waxing moon.

original: gnyis ston te/_zla ba dang po'i spyid zla ra ba'i lha shar stod du pad+ma dmar po
analyzed: gnyis ston te/_zla ba dang po'i spyid zla ra ba'i lha shar stod du pad+ma dmar po
translated: The deity of the first day of the waxing moon is in the upper east.

original: bzhi brgyad cu drug gi steng du dbus der spyid zla ra ba'i lha srin po nag po ral gri
analyzed: bzhi brgyad cu drug gi steng du dbus der spyid zla ra ba'i lha srin po nag po ral gri
translated: On top of the four, eight, and sixty petals, in the center, the deity of the first day of the waxing moon is black Rākṣasa.

original: dang gri gug dang phub dang thod pa thogs pa la nya stong gnyis kyi lha ni/_gtsho
analyzed: dang gri gug dang phub dang thod pa thogs pa la nya stong gnyis kyi lha ni/_gtsho
translated: He holds a sword, flaying knife, shield, and skull cup.

original: bo'i g.yas g.yon la gzhan ni pad+ma nyi shu rtsha brgyad la'o/_/dal bcu gnyis kyi
analyzed: bo'i g.yas g.yon la gzhan ni pad+ma nyi shu rtsha brgyad la'o/_/dal bcu gnyis kyi
translated: The other petals around the lotus are for the twenty-eight lunar mansions.🔽

original: 'khor sku mdog phyag mtshhan thams cad gtsho bo dang 'thun pa'o/_/shar smad du🔽spyid zla 'bring po'i lha khyab 'jug nag po 'khor lo dang pad+ma dang dbyug tho dang dung 'dzin pa la zhag gis lha sum cus bskor ba'o/_/shar lhor spyid zla tha
