translated: The retinue of the twelve gods of the year are the same color and have the same implements as the principal.🔽In the northeast is the god of the middle spring month, black Viṣṇu, holding a chakram, lotus, club, and conch, surrounded by thirty gods of the day.

original: chungs kyi lha rlung lha nag po shing dang me tog dang rin po che dang ud pal 'dzin🔽pa la 'khor sum cus bskor ba'o/_/lho stod du gshin rje dmar po ral gri dang dbyug pa dang lcags sgrog dang zhags pa thogs pa la rang 'dra ba sum cus skor ba
analyzed: chungs kyi lha rlung lha nag po shing dang me tog dang rin po che dang ud pal 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus bskor ba'o/_/lho stod du gshin rje dmar po ral gri dang dbyug pa dang lcags sgrog dang zhags pa thogs pa la rang 'dra ba sum cus skor ba
translated: In the southeast is the god of the last spring month, black Vāyu, holding a tree, flower, jewel, and utpala, surrounded by thirty gods.🔽In the southwest is the god of the first summer month, red Yama, holding a sword, club, iron chain, and noose, surrounded by thirty similar ones.

original: ni dbyar zla ra ba'i lha'o/_/lho smad du dbyar zla 'bring po'i lha me lha dmar po
analyzed: ni dbyar zla ra ba'i lha'o/_/lho smad du dbyar zla 'bring po'i lha me lha dmar po
translated: In the northwest is the god of the middle summer month, red Agni, holding a stick and chaff, surrounded by thirty gods of the day.

original: shag ti dang dbyug to dang pad+ma dang spyi blugs 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus skor🔽ba'o/_/lho nub tu dbyar zla tha chungs kyi lha gdong drug dmar po shag ti dang mdung dang rin po che dang me long 'dzin pa zhag gi lha sum cus bskor ba'o/_/
analyzed: shag ti dang dbyug to dang pad+ma dang spyi blugs 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus skor ba'o/_/lho nub tu dbyar zla tha chungs kyi lha gdong drug dmar po shag ti dang mdung dang rin po che dang me long 'dzin pa zhag gi lha sum cus bskor ba'o/_/
translated: He holds a club, a mace, a lotus, and a water vessel and is surrounded by thirty attendants.🔽In the southwest is the god of the last summer month, Shashin, red in color, holding a club, a spear, a jewel, and a mirror, and surrounded by thirty attendants.

original: nub stod du ston zla ra ba'i lha lus ngan ser po nor bu dang dbyug to dang ne le🔽dang pad+ma 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus skor ba'o/_/nub smad du ston zla🔽'bring po'i lha dbang po ser po rdo rje dang me'i mda' dril bu dang gzhu'o/_/de
analyzed: nub stod du ston zla ra ba'i lha lus ngan ser po nor bu dang dbyug to dang ne le dang pad+ma 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus skor ba'o/_/nub smad du ston zla 'bring po'i lha dbang po ser po rdo rje dang me'i mda' dril bu dang gzhu'o/_/de
translated: In the northwest is the god of the first autumn month, Pishacha, yellow in color, holding a jewel, a club, a mongoose, and a lotus, and surrounded by thirty attendants.🔽In the southwest is the god of the middle autumn month, Indra, yellow in color, holding a vajra, a fire arrow, a bell, and a bow, and surrounded by thirty attendants.

original: 'khor sum cus bskor ba'o/_/nub byang du ston zla tha chungs kyi lha tshhangs pa ser🔽po khab dang bgrang phreng dang pad+ma dang rdzas snod 'dzin pa'o/_/'khor sum cus
analyzed: 'khor sum cus bskor ba'o/_/nub byang du ston zla tha chungs kyi lha tshhangs pa ser🔽po khab dang bgrang phreng dang pad+ma dang rdzas snod 'dzin pa'o/_/'khor sum cus
translated: In the northwest is the god of the last autumn month, Brahma, yellow in color, holding a needle, a rosary, a lotus, and a vessel.🔽He is surrounded by thirty attendants.

original: bskor ba'o/_/byang stod du dgun zla ra ba'i lha drag po dkar po rtshe gsum dang mda' dang sbrul dang gzhu 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus bskor ba'o/_/byang smad🔽du dgun zla 'bring po'i lha rgya mtshho'i lha dkar po/_zhags pa dang rin po che dang chu shel dang nor bu 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus bskor ba'o/_/byang shar du
analyzed: bskor ba'o/_/byang stod du dgun zla ra ba'i lha drag po dkar po rtshe gsum dang mda' dang sbrul dang gzhu 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus bskor ba'o/_/byang smad du dgun zla 'bring po'i lha rgya mtshho'i lha dkar po/_zhags pa dang rin po che dang chu shel dang nor bu 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus bskor ba'o/_/byang shar du
translated: In the northeast, the deity of the first winter month is white Raudraksha, holding a spear, arrow, snake, and bow, surrounded by a retinue of thirty.🔽In the northwest, the deity of the second winter month is white Sāgaradeva, holding a lasso, jewel, water crystal, and gem, surrounded by a retinue of thirty.

original: dgun zla tha chungs kyi lha tshhogs kyi bdag po dkar po dgra sta dang rdo rje dang zhags pa dang rin chen 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus skor ba'o/_/shar stod du
analyzed: dgun zla tha chungs kyi lha tshhogs kyi bdag po dkar po dgra sta dang rdo rje dang zhags pa dang rin chen 'dzin pa la 'khor sum cus skor ba'o/_/shar stod du
translated: In the northeast, the deity of the third winter month is white Gaṇapati, holding an ax, vajra, lasso, and jewel, surrounded by a retinue of thirty.

original: dpyid zla ra ba'i lha khyab 'jug nag po 'khor lo dang /_dbyug to dang / pad ma dang /_dung 'dzin pa la/_rang dang 'dra ba'i 'khor sum cus skor ba
analyzed: dpyid zla ra ba'i lha khyab 'jug nag po 'khor lo dang /_dbyug to dang / pad ma dang /_dung 'dzin pa la/_rang dang 'dra ba'i 'khor sum cus skor ba
translated: In the southeast, the deity of the first spring month is black Viṣṇu, holding a chakram, club, lotus, and conch, surrounded by a retinue of thirty similar to himself.

original: ni thams cad gcig go/_/shar sgor khro bo dbyug pa sngon po don yod grub pa lta
analyzed: ni thams cad gcig go/_/shar sgor khro bo dbyug pa sngon po don yod grub pa lta
translated: In the east gate is the wrathful blue Danda, Amoghasiddhi.

original: bu'o/_/lhor 'dod pa'i rgyal po rin 'byung lta bu'o/_/nub tu stobs po che
analyzed: bu'o/_/lhor 'dod pa'i rgyal po rin 'byung lta bu'o/_/nub tu stobs po che
translated: In the west is Mahābala, Vairocana.

original: rnam par snang mdzad lta bu'o/_/byang du mi g.yo ba snang ba mtha' yas lta bu'o/_/
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad lta bu'o/_/byang du mi g.yo ba snang ba mtha' yas lta bu'o/_/
translated: In the north is Acala, Amitābha.🔽Above is Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin, Vajrapāṇi.

original: steng du gtshug tor 'khor lo sgyur ba phyag na rdo rje lta bu'o/_/'og tu khro bo gnod
analyzed: steng du gtshug tor 'khor lo sgyur ba phyag na rdo rje lta bu'o/_/'og tu khro bo gnod
translated: Below is Krodha Hūṃkāra, Mañjuśrī.

original: mdzes kun tu bzang po lta bu'o/_/de ltar lha bskyed nas spyan drangs mchod pa
analyzed: mdzes kun tu bzang po lta bu'o/_/de ltar lha bskyed nas spyan drangs mchod pa
translated: Having generated the deities in that way, having invited them, having made offerings,

original: byas thugs khar sa bon hum bkod de/_a+o~m shri ka la tshag kra ye hum swa ha/_zhes
analyzed: byas thugs khar sa bon hum bkod de/_a+o~m shri ka la tshag kra ye hum swa ha/_zhes
translated: having placed the seed syllable hūṃ in the heart, and having recited oṃ śrī heruka hūṃ svāhā,

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba
translated: the self-visualization is the “Pearl Rosary.”

original: bzlas nas bstod de dbang bskur ba ni dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'o/
analyzed: bzlas nas bstod de dbang bskur ba ni dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'o/
translated: Having recited, having praised, and having conferred empowerment is the glorious Kālacakra.

original: 'jam pa'i rdo rje bzhi bcu rtsha gnyis kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs
analyzed: 'jam pa'i rdo rje bzhi bcu rtsha gnyis kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_tshhogs
translated: The self-visualization of thirty-four Mañjuvajras is as follows:

original: bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dal gyi steng du rgyu las gzhal yas khang nang re dmig
analyzed: bsag pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dal gyi steng du rgyu las gzhal yas khang nang re dmig
translated: On the maṇḍala of the five elements, which is the basis of gathering the accumulations, visualize the celestial mansion arising from the cause.

original: dgu la pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pas skor ba 'khyams sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la nyi zla
analyzed: dgu la pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pas skor ba 'khyams sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la nyi zla
translated: The nine-part body mandala is generated as an eight-petaled lotus with a surrounding walkway and gates.

original: pad ma'i steng du 'jam pa'i rdo rje sku mdog ser po rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo
analyzed: pad ma'i steng du 'jam pa'i rdo rje sku mdog ser po rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo
translated: On the sun and moon seats, yellow Mañjuvajra, the essence of Vairocana,

original: mdzes shing yid du 'ong ba zhal g.yas sngo/_g.yon dkar ba/_phyag drug
analyzed: mdzes shing yid du 'ong ba zhal g.yas sngo/_g.yon dkar ba/_phyag drug
translated: is beautiful and attractive, with a blue right face, a white left face, and six arms.

original: g.yas kyis ral gri dang mchog sbyin dang mda'/_g.yon gyis po ti dang ud
analyzed: g.yas kyis ral gri dang mchog sbyin dang mda'/_g.yon gyis po ti dang ud
translated: The right hands hold a sword, a boon-granting gesture, and an arrow; the left hands hold a scripture, a blue lotus, and a bow.

original: pal dang gzhu bsnams pas chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma rang lta bu la 'khyud
analyzed: pal dang gzhu bsnams pas chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma rang lta bu la 'khyud
translated: He embraces Dharmadhatviśvarī, who is similar to him.

original: pa/_shar du mi bskyod pa 'thing kha dkar ba dang dmar ba'i zhal/_phyag
analyzed: pa/_shar du mi bskyod pa 'thing kha dkar ba dang dmar ba'i zhal/_phyag
translated: In the east, blue Akṣobhya has white and red faces.

original: drug gis rdo rje dang lcags kyu dang mda' dang gzhu dril bu dang nu ma 'dzin pa'o/🔽lhor rin 'byung ser po sngo ba dang dkar ba'i zhal/_phyag dang po gnyis rin
analyzed: drug gis rdo rje dang lcags kyu dang mda' dang gzhu dril bu dang nu ma 'dzin pa'o/ lhor rin 'byung ser po sngo ba dang dkar ba'i zhal/_phyag dang po gnyis rin
translated: His six hands hold a vajra, a goad, an arrow, a bow, a bell, and a breast.🔽In the south, yellow Ratnasaṃbhava has blue and white faces.

original: chen dang mchog sbyin mdzad pa/_'og ma thams cad mi bskyod 7pa lta bu'o/_/
analyzed: chen dang mchog sbyin mdzad pa/_'og ma thams cad mi bskyod 7pa lta bu'o/_/
translated: His first two hands hold a jewel and make the boon-granting gesture; all the other hands are like Akṣobhya’s.

original: nub tu 'od dpag med dmar po zhal g.yas dkar g.yon sngo ba'o/_/phyag dang po gnyis pad+ma kha 'byed pa 'og ma bzhi 'dre'o/_/byang don yod grub pa ljang khu
analyzed: nub tu 'od dpag med dmar po zhal g.yas dkar g.yon sngo ba'o/_/phyag dang po gnyis pad+ma kha 'byed pa 'og ma bzhi 'dre'o/_/byang don yod grub pa ljang khu
translated: In the north is green Amoghasiddhi🔽with a red face and a white face.

original: zhal dmar ba dang dkar ba'o/_/phyag dang po gnyis rgya gram dang ral gri 'dzin🔽pa/_'og ma bzhi 'dra/_zur bzhir sangs rgyas spyan dang ma ma ki dang gos
analyzed: zhal dmar ba dang dkar ba'o/_/phyag dang po gnyis rgya gram dang ral gri 'dzin pa/_'og ma bzhi 'dra/_zur bzhir sangs rgyas spyan dang ma ma ki dang gos
translated: His first two hands hold a crossed vajra and a sword.🔽The lower four are similar.

original: dkar mo dang sgrol ma bzhi rigs bzhi dang sku mdog dang zhal dang phyag mtshhan🔽'thun pa'o/_/pad+ma brgyad la sems ma rdo rje ma dang /_rin chen rdo rje ma dang / chos kyi rdo rje ma dang /_las kyi rdo rje ma dang /_tshun d+ha ma dang /_rin chen
analyzed: dkar mo dang sgrol ma bzhi rigs bzhi dang sku mdog dang zhal dang phyag mtshhan 'thun pa'o/_/pad+ma brgyad la sems ma rdo rje ma dang /_rin chen rdo rje ma dang / chos kyi rdo rje ma dang /_las kyi rdo rje ma dang /_tshun d+ha ma dang /_rin chen
translated: The four goddesses at the four corners are Buddhalocanā, Māmakī, Māmakī, and Tārā, who are similar to the four families in color, faces, and hand implements.

original: skar mda' ma dang /_khro gnyer ma dang /_rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma rnams sku mdog
analyzed: skar mda' ma dang /_khro gnyer ma dang /_rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma rnams sku mdog
translated: On the eight lotus petals are the four female bodhisattvas—Vajraratna, Vajradharma, and Vajrakarma—and the four female wrathful ones—Caṇḍālī, Rūpiṇī, Vetālī, and Ghasmarī—with the same colors, faces, and hand implements as the four families.

original: phyag mtshhan rigs bzhi dang 'thun pa las khyad par phyag g.yon gyi 'og ma sdigs
analyzed: phyag mtshhan rigs bzhi dang 'thun pa las khyad par phyag g.yon gyi 'og ma sdigs

analyzed: snams pa'o/_/gru chad bzhi la bdug sogs bzhi'o/_/sgo bzhir sgo ma bzhi'o/_/

original: thugs kha'i sa bon hri'o/_/om ha ya spru ba swa ha zhes zlas la dbang bskur ba ni rta
analyzed: thugs kha'i sa bon hri'o/_/om ha ya spru ba swa ha zhes zlas la dbang bskur ba ni rta
translated: The seed syllable in the heart is hri. Recite the mantra om hayagriva svabhava-svaha.

original: mgrin pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug gi yin no/_/🔽yi ge brgya pa'i lha rdo rje sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_'khor lo
analyzed: mgrin pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug gi yin no/_/ yi ge brgya pa'i lha rdo rje sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_'khor lo
translated: The empowerment is that of Hayagriva Padma-narteshvara.🔽The deity of the hundred-syllable mantra is Vajrasattva.🔽The visualization is of a wheel with eight spokes and four doors on the corners.

original: rtshibs brgyad gru chad la sgo btod pa can du bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni bcom
analyzed: rtshibs brgyad gru chad la sgo btod pa can du bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni bcom
translated: The generation of the deities is as follows.

original: ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po phyag g.yas rdo rje thugs khar/
analyzed: ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po phyag g.yas rdo rje thugs khar/
translated: The Bhagavān is glorious white Vajrasattva, with a vajra in his right hand at his heart,

analyzed: g.yon dril bu dkur rten pa/_zhabs g.yas brkyang ba bskyed la/_rtshibs
translated: and a bell in his left hand at his hip. He is standing with his right leg straight.

original: brgyad la rigs bzhi dang yum bzhi dang /_bdug sogs bzhi dang /_sgo ba
analyzed: brgyad la rigs bzhi dang yum bzhi dang /_bdug sogs bzhi dang /_sgo ba
translated: Generate the four families and four mothers in the eight directions, the four such as Dhūpā, and the four🔽gatekeepers.

analyzed: bzhi bskyed la/_thugs kha'i sa bon ni hum la yi ge brgya pas bskor la zlas pa
translated: The seed syllable at the heart is hūṃ surrounded by the hundred syllables.🔽Recite the mantra.

original: byas nas dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i yi ge brgya pa'i'o/_/
analyzed: byas nas dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i yi ge brgya pa'i'o/_/
translated: The empowerment conferral is that of Vajrasattva’s hundred syllables.

original: shes rab 'khor lo a ra pa tsha na'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_bye las pad+ma
analyzed: shes rab 'khor lo a ra pa tsha na'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_bye las pad+ma
translated: The actual practice of the wisdom wheel of Arapacana is as follows:🔽From bhrūṃ, generate a four-petaled lotus,

analyzed: 'dab bzhi pa'i bskyed la/_der a las 'jam dpal a pa ra tsha sku mdog dkar po phyag gis ral gri dang po ti 'dzin pa/_shar du ra las dra ba can

analyzed: dkar mo/_lhor pa las rdzogs pa'i zla ba ma dkar po/_nub tu tsha las rdzogs
translated: In the east, from ra, is white Jālinīpāṇi; in the south, from pa, is white Pūrṇacandrā; in the west, from tsa, is red Pūrṇabhadrā; and in the north, from ta, is green Pūrṇākṣarā.

original: pa'i sgra can ma dkar mo/_byang du na las nye ba'i sgra can ma dkar mo/_sku
analyzed: pa'i sgra can ma dkar mo/_byang du na las nye ba'i sgra can ma dkar mo/_sku
translated: In the north, white Upacālanā arises from na.🔽They all have the same body color and hand implements as the principal figures.

analyzed: mdog phyag mtshhan gtsho bo lta bu'o/_/om a ra pa tsha na ye swa ha zhes bzlas la

original: dbang bskur ba ni a ra pa tsha'o/_/
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni a ra pa tsha'o/_/
translated: The empowerment is conferred by Arapacana.

original: gzungs dral lnga'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las lte ba re mig dgu pa
analyzed: gzungs dral lnga'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las lte ba re mig dgu pa
translated: The actual practice of the five sisters’ dhāraṇī is as follows: From the cause, a nine-part grid arises from e.

original: gru chad la sgo btod par bskyed la/_dbus su so so 'brang ma ser mo zhal bzhi
analyzed: gru chad la sgo btod par bskyed la/_dbus su so so 'brang ma ser mo zhal bzhi
translated: In the corners, the doors are opened. In the center is yellow Mahāmantrānusāriṇī with four faces.

original: dkar ba dang dmar ba dang sngo ba'i mdog can/_phyag bcu na 'khor lo dang / mchod sbyin dang lcags kyu dang /_mda' dang ral gri 'dzin pa/_g.yon du rdo
analyzed: dkar ba dang dmar ba dang sngo ba'i mdog can/_phyag bcu na 'khor lo dang / mchod sbyin dang lcags kyu dang /_mda' dang ral gri 'dzin pa/_g.yon du rdo
translated: They are white, red, and blue. Of her ten hands, she holds a wheel, a gift, a goad, an arrow, and a sword.

analyzed: rje dang sdigs mdzub dang /_zhags pa dang /_gzhu dang /_dgra sta 'dzin pa/
translated: In the left hands she holds a vajra, a threatening forefinger, a noose, a bow, and an axe.

analyzed: shar du stong chen mo dkar mo zhal bzhi sngon po dang ser po dang ljang khu'o/_/
translated: In the east is white Mahāmaṇḍala with four faces that are blue, yellow, and green.

original: phyag bcu na 'khor lo dang mchog sbyin dang lcags kyu dang mda' dang ral gri'o/_/
analyzed: phyag bcu na 'khor lo dang mchog sbyin dang lcags kyu dang mda' dang ral gri'o/_/
translated: In her ten hands she holds a wheel, a boon-granting gesture, a hook, an arrow, and a sword.🔽In her left hands she holds a vajra, a threatening gesture, a lasso, a bow, and a battle-ax.

original: g.yon rdo rje sdigs 'dzub/_zhags pa gzhu dgra sta rnams so/_/lhor gsang
analyzed: g.yon rdo rje sdigs 'dzub/_zhags pa gzhu dgra sta rnams so/_/lhor gsang
translated: In the south is Guhyasamāja,

analyzed: sngags rjes su 'dzin ma nag mo dkar ba dang dmar ba dang ser ba'i zhal lo/_/ mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: who is black, with white, red, and yellow faces.🔽The Twelve-Armed Guhyasamāja

original: phyag bcu gnyis ni dang po gnyis chos 'chad 'og ma gnyis mnyam bzhag_/de
analyzed: phyag bcu gnyis ni dang po gnyis chos 'chad 'og ma gnyis mnyam bzhag_/de
translated: The first two of her twelve hands are in the dharmacakra mudra, the next two are in the gesture of equipoise,

original: 'og brgyad kyis rdo rje dang mda' dang /_mchog byin dang mi 'jigs pa'i phyag
analyzed: 'og brgyad kyis rdo rje dang mda' dang /_mchog byin dang mi 'jigs pa'i phyag
translated: and the next eight hold a vajra and arrow, a boon-granting gesture, a gesture of fearlessness,🔽a lasso, a bow, a lotus, and a vase.

original: rgya dang /_zhags pa dang gzhu dang /_pad+ma dang bum pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub tu
analyzed: rgya dang /_zhags pa dang gzhu dang /_pad+ma dang bum pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub tu
translated: In the west is Sitātapatrā,

original: bsil ba'i tshhal dmar mo dkar ba dang nag pa dang ser ba'i zhal lo/_/phyag
analyzed: bsil ba'i tshhal dmar mo dkar ba dang nag pa dang ser ba'i zhal lo/_/phyag
translated: who is red, with white, black, and yellow faces.

original: brgyad kyis pad+ma dang mda' dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang zhags pa dang gzhu dang rgyal mtshhan dang po ti dang /_byang du rma bya chen po ljang khu nag po dang dkar ba
analyzed: brgyad kyis pad+ma dang mda' dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang zhags pa dang gzhu dang rgyal mtshhan dang po ti dang /_byang du rma bya chen po ljang khu nag po dang dkar ba
translated: In the north, green Mahāmayūrī has black, white,

analyzed: dang ser ba'i zhal/_phyag na rma bya dang mda' dang mchog sbyin dang /_ral gri dang / lhung bzed dang /_gzhu dang bum pa dang /_sna tshhogs rdo rje 'dzin pa'o/_/zur
translated: and yellow faces. She holds a peacock, an arrow, a boon-granting hand, a sword, a begging bowl, a bow, a vase, and a crossed vajra.

original: bzhir rgyal po chen po bzhi/_gru chad la bdug sogs bzhi/_sgo ba bzhi'o/_/lha mo🔽lnga'i sa bon ni dre bye hum rdzu mam ngo /_/om ma ni d+ha ri badzi ni ma ha pra ti swa ri hu~m hu~m
analyzed: bzhir rgyal po chen po bzhi/_gru chad la bdug sogs bzhi/_sgo ba bzhi'o/_/lha mo lnga'i sa bon ni dre bye hum rdzu mam ngo /_/om ma ni d+ha ri badzi ni ma ha pra ti swa ri hu~m hu~m
translated: In the four corners are the four great kings, in the intermediate directions are the four goddesses beginning with Dhūmā, and in the gates are the four gate goddesses.🔽The seed syllables of the five goddesses are dre, je, hum, dzum, and mam.🔽Recite the following mantra for the empowerment conferral:

original: phat swa ha/_zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni gral lnga'o/_/
analyzed: phat swa ha/_zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni gral lnga'o/_/
translated: oṃ maṇi-dhāri vajrī mahā-prati-sāra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po mi g.yo mgon gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_sbru las 'khor
translated: The realization of the wrathful king Acala is as follows: From the hūṃ in one’s heart……

analyzed: lo rtshibs bcu pa bskyed la/_nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du bgegs kyi rgyal po dgyel ba'i
translated: Generate the ten wrathful ones in the ten directions, and on top of the sun, moon, and lotus, the king of obstructors is lying face down.

analyzed: steng du hum las ral gri/_de las mi g.yo ba sku mdog mthing nag zhal cig phyag
translated: From hūṃ, there is a sword, and from that, blue-black Acala has one face and two hands.

analyzed: gnyis g.yas kyis shel gyi ral gri 'debs pa'i tshhul/_g.yon pas sdigs 'dzub

analyzed: la rdo rje'i zhags pa dkris pa/_zhabs gnyis bskyang skum du bzhugs pa/

analyzed: rtshibs bcu la rang dang 'dra ba'i khro bo bcu gnas pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon ni

analyzed: hum ngo /_/om badzra tshan d+ha ma ha ro sha na hum phat/_zhes bzlas nas dbang bskur
translated: Recite oṃ vajra-caṇḍa-mahāroṣaṇa hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ba ni mi g.yo ba'o/_/
analyzed: ba ni mi g.yo ba'o/_/
translated: The empowerment conferral is that of Acala.

original: phyag na rdo rje dza ba ri pa 'khor lo chen po'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje dza ba ri pa 'khor lo chen po'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/
translated: The great-wheel Mahāvajrabhairava of Jābir

original: tshhogs bsag pa dang sdig pa bshags pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dal bskyed pa sngon du
analyzed: tshhogs bsag pa dang sdig pa bshags pa dang 'byung ba lnga'i dal bskyed pa sngon du
translated: is the accumulation of the accumulations, the confession of misdeeds, and the generation of the five elements.

original: song nas/_'dir rgyu las gzhal yas khang 'khor lo rtshibs bzhi gru chad la sgo🔽btod pa can du bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du dbus su tshhangs🔽pa dang brgya byin/_shar dri za/_lho gshin rje/_nub chu bdag_/byang gnod
analyzed: song nas/_'dir rgyu las gzhal yas khang 'khor lo rtshibs bzhi gru chad la sgo btod pa can du bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du dbus su tshhangs pa dang brgya byin/_shar dri za/_lho gshin rje/_nub chu bdag_/byang gnod
translated: and a platform.🔽As for generating the deities, on top of the sun, moon, and lotus in the center, generate a blue hūṃ, which becomes a skull and vajra, and from that,

original: sbyin/_de'i steng du hum las thod pa dang rdo rje dang /_de las sangs rgyas gos
analyzed: sbyin/_de'i steng du hum las thod pa dang rdo rje dang /_de las sangs rgyas gos
translated: Blue-Clad Buddha, with three faces—white right face, red left face,

analyzed: sngon po can/_zhal gsum phyag drug pa zhal g.yas dkar ba/_g.yon dmar ma/
translated: and blue central face—and six arms. He has three eyes in each face and is terrifying.

original: spyan gsum 'jigs su rung ba/_phyag drug gi dang po gnyis na rdo rje dang sdigs🔽mdzub 'phyar ba/_bar ma gnyis yum la 'khyud pa/_tha ma gnyis sbrul sked pa
analyzed: spyan gsum 'jigs su rung ba/_phyag drug gi dang po gnyis na rdo rje dang sdigs mdzub 'phyar ba/_bar ma gnyis yum la 'khyud pa/_tha ma gnyis sbrul sked pa
translated: In his two principal hands he holds a vajra and makes a threatening gesture with a raised forefinger.🔽The two middle hands embrace the mother, and the two lower hands hold a snake by the middle and eat it.

analyzed: nas bzung nas za ba/_zhabs g.yas skum pa/_g.yon rkyang 7_ba/_yum lha mo
translated: His right leg is bent and his left leg is straight.

analyzed: mdzes ldan ma zhal gcig phyag gnyis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa sku la 'khril
translated: The mother, beautiful goddess, has one face and two hands, holding a flaying knife and skull cup, and embraces the father.

original: ba'o/_/shar du khro bo bdud las rgyal dkar po zhal cig phyag bzhi dang po gnyis
analyzed: ba'o/_/shar du khro bo bdud las rgyal dkar po zhal cig phyag bzhi dang po gnyis
translated: In the east is white Krodhavajra Mārajit, with one face and four arms.

analyzed: rdo rje dang kha tram kha 'phyar ba/_'og ma gnyis sdigs 'dzub bsnol ba yum la 'khyud pa/_yum 'od zer can dkar mo lhor rdo rje gzi brjid ser po zhal gcig
translated: His first two hands hold a vajra and a khaṭvāṅga staff, and the lower two hands are in a threatening gesture, embracing the mother.🔽In the south is yellow Vajra Tejorāśi, with one face and four arms.

original: phyag bzhi pa dang po gnyis rdo rje dang dbyug pa 'dzin pa/_'og ma sdigs 'dzub🔽bsnol bas yum mdangs can ma ser mo la 'khyud pa'o/_/nub tu rngam pa sgra🔽sgrogs dmar po zhal cig phyag bzhi pa dang pos rdo rje dang sbrul zhags 'dzin pa🔽'og ma gnyis kyis yum sgra can ma dmar mo la 'khyud pa/_byang du bdud rtshi
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa dang po gnyis rdo rje dang dbyug pa 'dzin pa/_'og ma sdigs 'dzub bsnol bas yum mdangs can ma ser mo la 'khyud pa'o/_/nub tu rngam pa sgra sgrogs dmar po zhal cig phyag bzhi pa dang pos rdo rje dang sbrul zhags 'dzin pa 'og ma gnyis kyis yum sgra can ma dmar mo la 'khyud pa/_byang du bdud rtshi
translated: His first two hands hold a vajra and a club, and the lower two hands are in a threatening gesture, embracing the mother, yellow Mārajit.🔽In the west is red Krodhavajra Ugra, with one face and four arms.🔽His first two hands hold a vajra and a snake noose, and the lower two hands are in a threatening gesture, embracing the mother, red Śabdavajrā.🔽In the north is green Krodhavajra Māravibhīṣaṇa, with one face and four arms.

original: 'khyil pa ljang khu zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa dang po gnyis rdo rje dang be con 'dzin pa/
analyzed: 'khyil pa ljang khu zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa dang po gnyis rdo rje dang be con 'dzin pa/
translated: His first two hands hold a vajra and a club, and the lower two hands are in a threatening gesture, embracing the mother, green Mārajit.

original: tha ma gnyis sdigs 'dzub kyis yum rlung 'byin ma la 'khyud pa/_yum bzhi'i
analyzed: tha ma gnyis sdigs 'dzub kyis yum rlung 'byin ma la 'khyud pa/_yum bzhi'i
translated: The last two hands hold a threatening forefinger and embrace the mother Vāyuvegā.🔽The four mothers have the same implements as the four goddesses.

original: phyag mtshhan gtsho mo dang 'dra/_sgo bzhir sgo ma bzhi bskyed par bya'o/_/thugs🔽mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: phyag mtshhan gtsho mo dang 'dra/_sgo bzhir sgo ma bzhi bskyed par bya'o/_/thugs mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: One should generate the four gate goddesses at the four gates.🔽The Heart of Wisdom: A String of Pearls🔽The seed syllable at the mouth is hūṃ. Invite the awareness beings, make offerings, and recite:

original: kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/ye shes pa spyan drangs mchod la/_om ni lam b+ha ra d+ha ra
analyzed: kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/ye shes pa spyan drangs mchod la/_om ni lam b+ha ra d+ha ra
translated: oṃ nīlāmbhojayā namaḥ🔽vajrapāṇi hṛdayāya mahākrodhasatva hūṃ phaṭ

original: badzra pa ni hri d+ha ya ma ha kro ta sa ta hum phat/_zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni
analyzed: badzra pa ni hri d+ha ya ma ha kro ta sa ta hum phat/_zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni

original: 'khor lo chen po'i cho ga'o/_/
analyzed: 'khor lo chen po'i cho ga'o/_/
translated: This is the ritual of the great wheel.🔽The Actual Practice of the Amṛta Drop🔽Generate a four-petaled lotus with a gate and create the deities.

original: bdud rtshi thigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_pad+ma 'dab bzhi sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni nyi zla pad+ma dang tshhangs pa brgya byin gyi steng
analyzed: bdud rtshi thigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_pad+ma 'dab bzhi sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni nyi zla pad+ma dang tshhangs pa brgya byin gyi steng
translated: On top of the sun, moon, lotus, Brahmā, and Śakra,🔽from hūṃ, imagine a five-pronged vajra.

original: du hum las rdo rje rtshe lnga pa bsams la/_de yongs su gyur pa las sangs rgyas gos
analyzed: du hum las rdo rje rtshe lnga pa bsams la/_de yongs su gyur pa las sangs rgyas gos
translated: That completely transforms into Buddha Vairocana.

original: sngon po can/_zhal gsum phyag drug pa g.yas dkar g.yon dmar ba/_phyag
analyzed: sngon po can/_zhal gsum phyag drug pa g.yas dkar g.yon dmar ba/_phyag
translated: He is blue, with three faces and six arms. His right face is white, the left is red, and the middle face is blue.

original: drug gi dang po rdo rje dang sdigs 'dzub/_bar ma thal mo sdebs pa/_tha ma
analyzed: drug gi dang po rdo rje dang sdigs 'dzub/_bar ma thal mo sdebs pa/_tha ma
translated: His six hands hold a vajra and a threatening forefinger in the first pair of hands,🔽the middle pair are joined in prayer, and the last pair hold a poisonous snake which they eat.

original: gnyis sbrul gdug pa bzung nas zhal du za ba/_zhabs g.yas 7skyang g.yon skum
analyzed: gnyis sbrul gdug pa bzung nas zhal du za ba/_zhabs g.yas 7skyang g.yon skum
translated: His right and left legs are bent,

original: nas gdug pa can gnan pa/_sbrul dang stag gis brgyan pa/_phyogs bzhi
analyzed: nas gdug pa can gnan pa/_sbrul dang stag gis brgyan pa/_phyogs bzhi
translated: pressing down on evil beings. He is adorned with snakes and tigers.🔽In the four directions, generate the four vajras that symbolize the five awarenesses.

original: nas ye shes lnga mtshhon pa'i rdo rje bzhi bskyed la/_thugs kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/
analyzed: nas ye shes lnga mtshhon pa'i rdo rje bzhi bskyed la/_thugs kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/
translated: The seed syllable in his heart is hūṃ.

analyzed: om badzra pa ni ni lam b+ha ra d+ha ra hri ta ya ma ha tro ka ta sad ta hum phat swa ha/_zhes
translated: Recite: oṃ vajrapāṇi nīlāmbara­dhara hṛdaya trāṭ mahātroṭa saṭa hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni/_bdud rtshi thigs pa'o/
analyzed: bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni/_bdud rtshi thigs pa'o/
translated: The empowerment conferral is the “drop of ambrosia.”

original: mdor bsdus pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_pad+ma 'dab ma bzhi sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du hum las rdo rje/_de las gos sngon po can
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_pad+ma 'dab ma bzhi sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du hum las rdo rje/_de las gos sngon po can
translated: The concise manifest enlightenment is as follows: Generate the four-petaled lotus with a door and on top of the sun, moon, and lotus, hūṃ becomes a vajra, which becomes blue-clad Vajrapāṇi.

original: zhal cig phyag gnyis pa rdo rje dang sdigs 'dzub byas pa/_sku mdog 'thing nag
analyzed: zhal cig phyag gnyis pa rdo rje dang sdigs 'dzub byas pa/_sku mdog 'thing nag
translated: He has one face and two hands, holding a vajra and making a threatening gesture.

original: can me dpung 'bar ba'i klu rigs brgyad kyis sku la brgyan pa/_pad+ma brgyad la hum
analyzed: can me dpung 'bar ba'i klu rigs brgyad kyis sku la brgyan pa/_pad+ma brgyad la hum
translated: He is dark blue in color, and the eight nāga clans, blazing with fire, adorn his body.🔽There are eight hūṃs on eight lotuses, and a vajra and hūṃ are placed in his heart.

original: brgyad yod pa/_thugs khar rdo rje dang hum bkod pa/_om ni lam b+ha ra d+ha ra badzra pa ni
analyzed: brgyad yod pa/_thugs khar rdo rje dang hum bkod pa/_om ni lam b+ha ra d+ha ra badzra pa ni
translated: Recite oṃ nīlāmbaroṣṭa vajrapāṇi🔽mahā-krodha-sattva hūṃ.

original: ma ha kro ta sa twa hum/_zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni mdor bsdus pa'i'o/_/🔽mchod rten sngon po'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las pad+ma 'dab ma🔽bzhi pa'i steng du mchod rten lnga dang bcas pa bskyed la/_der hum las rdo rje/
analyzed: ma ha kro ta sa twa hum/_zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni mdor bsdus pa'i'o/_/ mchod rten sngon po'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las pad+ma 'dab ma bzhi pa'i steng du mchod rten lnga dang bcas pa bskyed la/_der hum las rdo rje/
translated: The empowerment conferral is the concise version.🔽The visualization for the blue stūpa is as follows: From the cause, on a lotus with four petals, generate the five stūpas.🔽From hūṃ, there is a vajra,

original: de las dpal phyag na rdo rje mdog sngon po zhabs g.yas skum g.yon brkyang ba'i
analyzed: de las dpal phyag na rdo rje mdog sngon po zhabs g.yas skum g.yon brkyang ba'i
translated: and from that, glorious Vajrapāṇi arises. He is blue, with his right leg bent and left leg straight.

original: mchan khung na lha'i dbang po brgya byin mdog dkar po glang po che'i steng na rdo rje
analyzed: mchan khung na lha'i dbang po brgya byin mdog dkar po glang po che'i steng na rdo rje
translated: In his armpit is white Indra, lord of the gods, riding an elephant and holding a vajra and banner.

original: thogs pa'i steng na bcom ldan 'das phyag g.yas kyis rdo rje nam mkha' la 'phyar
analyzed: thogs pa'i steng na bcom ldan 'das phyag g.yas kyis rdo rje nam mkha' la 'phyar
translated: On top of the obstacle-removing deity, the bhagavān holds a vajra in his right hand🔽raised in the sky and in his left hand, in the crook of his elbow, is the sun god

original: ba/_g.yon gyis mchan khung na lha'i bu nyi ma sku mdog dmar po rta bdun gyis
analyzed: ba/_g.yon gyis mchan khung na lha'i bu nyi ma sku mdog dmar po rta bdun gyis
translated: , red in color, drawn by seven horses.

original: drangs pa'i shing rta'i steng na rdo rje pad+ma'i snams pa'i steng na rje btshun gyi phyag
analyzed: drangs pa'i shing rta'i steng na rdo rje pad+ma'i snams pa'i steng na rje btshun gyi phyag
translated: On top of the chariot, which is held by a vajra and lotus, the bhagavān🔽holds a vajra in his right hand and a bell and threatening forefinger in his left hand.

original: g.yon pa dril bu dang sdigs 'dzub mdzad pa rteg pa nyi zla pad+ma'i gdan la
analyzed: g.yon pa dril bu dang sdigs 'dzub mdzad pa rteg pa nyi zla pad+ma'i gdan la
translated: He sits on a seat of sun, moon, and lotus.

original: bzhugs pa'o/_/shar du rnam par snang mdzad byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya can/🔽lho rin chen 'byung ldan mchog sbyin/_nub snang ba mtha' yas mnyam bzhag_/
analyzed: bzhugs pa'o/_/shar du rnam par snang mdzad byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya can/ lho rin chen 'byung ldan mchog sbyin/_nub snang ba mtha' yas mnyam bzhag_/
translated: In the east is Vairocana with the mudra of supreme enlightenment.🔽In the south is Ratnasaṃbhava with the mudra of supreme giving, in the west is Amitābha in the mudra of equipoise,🔽and in the north is Amoghasiddhi with the mudra of granting refuge.

original: byang don yod grub pa skyabs sbyin/_thugs kha'i sa bon ni mchod rten dang hum ngo //
analyzed: byang don yod grub pa skyabs sbyin/_thugs kha'i sa bon ni mchod rten dang hum ngo //
translated: The seed syllable in the heart is a stūpa with hūṃ.🔽The mantra is the long dhāraṇī.

original: sngags ni gzungs rings so/_/rjes la dbang bskur bar bya'o/_/
analyzed: sngags ni gzungs rings so/_/rjes la dbang bskur bar bya'o/_/
translated: After that, the empowerment is conferred.🔽The clear realization of Caṇḍa­vajra­garjita­garjita­nāḍa­ka

original: rdo rje gtum po khyung gsham can gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las
analyzed: rdo rje gtum po khyung gsham can gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las
translated: is as follows.

analyzed: 'khor lo rtshibs bzhi gru chad la sgo btod pa can bskyed la/_a las zla ba'i steng

analyzed: du dbang phyug chen po dang u ma d+he ba'i steng du hum las rdo rje gtum po sku mdog
translated: of that, from aḥ, is a great hūṃ.

analyzed: nag po zhal cig phyag gnyis pa rdo rje 'phyar zhing sdigs 'dzub gdengs pa/
translated: From that, light rays radiate and return, transforming it into a black Caṇḍa, with one face and two hands, holding a flaying knife and skull cup.🔽He has three eyes and bared fangs.🔽He has a crown of dry skulls and a necklace of fresh heads.🔽He is adorned with a tiger-skin skirt and the four serpent lords.🔽He stands with his left leg bent, pressing on an elephant skin, and his right leg straight, pressing on a human skin.🔽He has a crown of dry skulls and a necklace of fresh heads.

analyzed: sdigs 'dzub steng na khyung rnam par 'phro ba/_thod pa skam po'i dbu rgyan dang brlon pa'i do shal byas pa stag gi sham thabs dang sbrul rigs bzhis sku la brgyan
translated: He is adorned with a tiger-skin skirt and the four serpent lords.🔽He stands with his left leg bent, pressing on an elephant skin, and his right leg straight, pressing on a human skin.🔽He has a crown of dry skulls and a necklace of fresh heads.🔽He is adorned with a tiger-skin skirt and the four serpent lords.🔽He stands with his left leg bent, pressing on an elephant skin, and his right leg straight, pressing on a human skin.🔽He has a crown of dry skulls and a necklace of fresh heads.🔽He is adorned with a tiger-skin skirt and the four serpent lords.🔽He stands with his left leg bent, pressing on an elephant skin, and his right leg straight, pressing on a human skin.🔽He has a crown of dry skulls and a necklace of fresh heads.🔽He is adorned with a tiger-skin skirt and the four serpent lords.

analyzed: pa/_shar du rnam rgyal dkar po rdo rje dang sdigs 'dzub byas pa/_lhor
translated: He stands with his left leg bent, pressing on an elephant skin, and his right leg straight, pressing on a human skin.

analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/ gshin rje ser po thod dbyug dang sdigs 'dzub byas pa/_nub tu rta mgrin
translated: He has a crown of dry skulls and a necklace of fresh heads.🔽He is adorned with a tiger-skin skirt and the four serpent lords.🔽He stands with his left leg bent, pressing on an elephant skin, and his right leg straight, pressing on a human skin.🔽He has a crown of dry skulls and a necklace of fresh heads.🔽He is adorned with a tiger-skin skirt and the four serpent lords.

analyzed: dmar po khyab shing dang sdigs 'dzub byas pa/_byang du bdud rtshi 'khyil pa ljang khu
translated: He stands with his left leg bent, pressing on an elephant skin, and his right leg straight, pressing on a human skin.🔽He has a crown of dry skulls and a necklace of fresh heads.🔽He is adorned with a tiger-

analyzed: dbyug to dang sdigs 'dzub byas pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon ni hum ngo /_/om badzra
translated: He holds a club and makes a threatening gesture. The seed syllable at his heart is hūṃ.

original: tshan d+ha ma ha ro sha na hum phat zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje gtum po'o/_/
analyzed: tshan d+ha ma ha ro sha na hum phat zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje gtum po'o/_/
translated: Recite oṃ vajra-caṇḍa-mahāroṣaṇa hūṃ phaṭ. The empowerment conferral is that of Caṇḍa-vajra.

analyzed: rdo rje khyung gi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las 'khor lo rtshibs brgyad
translated: The manifest realization of Vajra-Garuḍa is as follows: From the cause, an eight-spoked wheel with a rim

original: sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_der nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du khrom las rdo rje/_de
analyzed: sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_der nyi zla pad+ma'i steng du khrom las rdo rje/_de
translated: and doors arises. Upon that, from hūṃ, is a vajra,

analyzed: las 'dab chags kyi rgyal po khyung sems can rnam pa drug las grub ste/_ru 'bri/

analyzed: mig sbal pa/_'tshhul pa lug_/lag pa mi bshog pa bya/_rkang pa gcan zan

analyzed: gyi sder mo/_sbrul za zhing sku mdog nag po'o/_/rtshibs brgyad la rdo rje'i khyung

analyzed: dang dbyug to dang /_rin chen dang /_tho ba dang /_pad+ma dang ral gri dang / rgya gram dang /_gri gug dang /_khyung nag cing 'jigs pa bskyed par bya'o/_/
translated: a club, a jewel, a hammer, a lotus, a sword, a chakram, a flaying knife, and a terrifying black garuḍa.🔽Om karuna nān svāhā.🔽Om nāga marana ya ram ram jvala śiśi tulu tulu.

original: om ka ru na nan sbad lus btul/_na ga ma ra na ya ram ram dz+wa la shi shi tul tul/🔽'phung sbad swa ha zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni khyung gi'o/
analyzed: om ka ru na nan sbad lus btul/_na ga ma ra na ya ram ram dz+wa la shi shi tul tul/ 'phung sbad swa ha zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni khyung gi'o/
translated: Om pūṃ svāhā.

analyzed: jo bo spyan ras gzigs yab yum gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las
translated: The realization of Lord Avalokiteśvara and consort is as follows:

original: phyogs la pad ma zur la 'khor lo'i rtshibs te 'dab ma brgyad pa bskyed la/_nyi
analyzed: phyogs la pad ma zur la 'khor lo'i rtshibs te 'dab ma brgyad pa bskyed la/_nyi

analyzed: zla pad+ma'i steng du hri la jo bo spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug sku mdog shin tu dmar
translated: on top of the sun, moon, and lotus, is a hrih, from which comes Lord Avalokiteśvara, deep red in color,

analyzed: ba/_zhal cig pa spyan gsum pa 'dzum pa'i gseb na cung zad khro ba/_dbu skra ya
translated: with one face, three eyes, and a slight frown in the midst of a smile,🔽with hair in a topknot and hanging down.

analyzed: la thor tshhugs dang mar la sil ma yod pa/_zhabs g.yas cung zad skyang zhing

analyzed: g.yon skum pa/_phyag gnyis g.yas mu tig gi phreng ba 'dren pa/_g.yon ud pal
translated: His left leg is bent. His two hands are extended to the right, holding a string of pearls, and to the left, holding a blue lotus.

original: 'dzin pa yum la 'khyud pa/_yum gsang ba ye shes mkha' 'gro ma dmar mo phyag
analyzed: 'dzin pa yum la 'khyud pa/_yum gsang ba ye shes mkha' 'gro ma dmar mo phyag
translated: He embraces the mother, Secret Wisdom dakini, who is red and

analyzed: g.yas gser gyi da ma ru skrol ba/_g.yon thod khrag gtsho la stob pa sku la 'khril
translated: holds a golden ḍamaru in her right hand and a blood-filled skull cup in her left hand. She embraces him with her body.

original: ba'o/_/shar du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dkar mo/_lhor rin chen mkha' 'gro ma
analyzed: ba'o/_/shar du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dkar mo/_lhor rin chen mkha' 'gro ma
translated: In the east is white Vajra dakini; in the south is yellow Jewel dakini;

analyzed: ser mo/_nub pad+ma'i mkha' 'gro ma dmar mo/_byang du las kyi mkha' 'gro ma ljang
translated: in the west is red Lotus dakini; and in the north is green Action dakini.

original: khu'o/_/gri gug dang thod pa thogs nas zhabs phyed dkyil mdzad pa/_shar lhor🔽rdo rje rigs kyi ging dkar po rdo rje dang thod pa thogs pa/_lho nub rin chen
analyzed: khu'o/_/gri gug dang thod pa thogs nas zhabs phyed dkyil mdzad pa/_shar lhor rdo rje rigs kyi ging dkar po rdo rje dang thod pa thogs pa/_lho nub rin chen
translated: They hold flaying knives and skull cups and stand with their left legs drawn in.

analyzed: rigs kyi ging ser po rin po che thogs pa nub byang pad+ma rigs kyi ging dmar po
translated: In the southeast is white Vajra family ging holding a vajra and a skull cup; in the southwest is yellow Jewel family ging holding a jewel; in the northwest is red Lotus family ging holding a lotus; and in the northeast is green Action family ging holding a sword.

original: pad+ma thogs pa/_byang shar du las kyi ging ljang khu rgya gram thogs pa'o/_/g.yon
analyzed: pad+ma thogs pa/_byang shar du las kyi ging ljang khu rgya gram thogs pa'o/_/g.yon
translated: He holds a blue lotus in his left hand.🔽The seed syllable in his heart is hrīḥ.

original: ud pal thogs pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon ni hri'o/_/om ma ni pad me hum ru ma
analyzed: ud pal thogs pa'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon ni hri'o/_/om ma ni pad me hum ru ma
translated: Recite oṃ maṇi padme hūṃ ru lu

original: g+ha ye ha ri ni sa ra tsha hri ya swa ha zhes bzlas la dbang bskur bar bya'o/_/🔽'phags pa seng ge sgra sgrogs kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las pad+ma
analyzed: g+ha ye ha ri ni sa ra tsha hri ya swa ha zhes bzlas la dbang bskur bar bya'o/_/ 'phags pa seng ge sgra sgrogs kyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las pad+ma
translated: ghaye hari ni sa ra tsa hri ya svāhā.🔽The manifest realization of Ārya Siṃhanāda is as follows: From the cause, a four-petaled lotus,

original: 'dab ma bzhi pa bskyed la/_dbus su hri las seng ge'i steng du 'phags pa seng
analyzed: 'dab ma bzhi pa bskyed la/_dbus su hri las seng ge'i steng du 'phags pa seng
translated: in the center, white Ārya Siṃhanāda arises from hrīḥ upon a lion.

original: ge sgra sku mdog dkar po zhal cig phyag gnyis pa/_nang pa'i rtags su spyan🔽gsum pa/_phyag g.yon na pad+ma dkar po'i dkyil na ral gri 'bar ba dang pad+ma
analyzed: ge sgra sku mdog dkar po zhal cig phyag gnyis pa/_nang pa'i rtags su spyan gsum pa/_phyag g.yon na pad+ma dkar po'i dkyil na ral gri 'bar ba dang pad+ma
translated: He has one face and two arms, with the inner sign of three eyes.🔽In his left hand is a blazing sword in the center of a white lotus and a white skull cup filled with flowers upon a white lotus.

original: dkar po'i steng na thod pa dkar po me tog gis bkang ba'o/_/phyag g.yas na tri
analyzed: dkar po'i steng na thod pa dkar po me tog gis bkang ba'o/_/phyag g.yas na tri
translated: In his right hand is a trident.

original: shu la rtshe gsum sbrul gyis brgyan pa'i kha nas 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gsum
analyzed: shu la rtshe gsum sbrul gyis brgyan pa'i kha nas 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gsum
translated: the three poisons of desire, hatred, and ignorance are vomited.

original: skyug pa'o/_/pad+ma bzhi la snang ba mtha' yas kyi gnas su rnam par snang mdzad
analyzed: skyug pa'o/_/pad+ma bzhi la snang ba mtha' yas kyi gnas su rnam par snang mdzad
translated: At the four lotuses, in the place of Amitābha, the four families of Vairocana🔽are created. The seed syllable in the heart is hrīḥ.

original: byas pa'i rigs bzhi'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon ni hri'o/_/om a sing ha na d+ha hum
analyzed: byas pa'i rigs bzhi'o/_/thugs kha'i sa bon ni hri'o/_/om a sing ha na d+ha hum
translated: Recite oṃ a siṃhanāda hūṃ phaṭ.

original: phat zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni seng ge sgra'i cho ga'o/_/
analyzed: phat zhes bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni seng ge sgra'i cho ga'o/_/
translated: The empowerment conferral is the Lion’s Roar ritual.

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/🔽don yod zhags pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las 'khor lo rtshibs
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba/ don yod zhags pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las 'khor lo rtshibs
translated: The name of this text is the Pearl Rosary of Realization.🔽The Amoghapāśa Realization🔽is generated from the cause, a four-spoked wheel,

original: bzhi pa can cig tu bskyed la/_lha bsgom pa ni dbus su jo bo khar sa pa ni sku
analyzed: bzhi pa can cig tu bskyed la/_lha bsgom pa ni dbus su jo bo khar sa pa ni sku
translated: and the meditation on the deity is as follows: In the center is Lord Khasarpāṇa,

original: mdog dkar po zhal cig phyag gnyis g.yas skyabs sbyin/_g.yon pa pad+ma thogs
analyzed: mdog dkar po zhal cig phyag gnyis g.yas skyabs sbyin/_g.yon pa pad+ma thogs
translated: white in color, with one face and two arms, the right one giving refuge and the left one holding a lotus.

original: pa/_shar du don yod zhags pa dmar po zhal cig phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas
analyzed: pa/_shar du don yod zhags pa dmar po zhal cig phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas
translated: In the east is Amoghapāśa, red, with one face and four arms. The right hands🔽hold a hook and a noose; the left hands hold a lotus and a citron.

original: zhags pa dang rdo rje/_g.yon lcags kyu dang bgrang phreng bsnams pa'o/_/lhor
analyzed: zhags pa dang rdo rje/_g.yon lcags kyu dang bgrang phreng bsnams pa'o/_/lhor
translated: He holds a lasso and a vajra in his right hands and a hook and a rosary in his left hands.

original: khro gnyer can sngo skya phyag bzhi g.yas na dbyug tho dang /_pad+ma/_g.yon bum pa🔽dang phreng ba thogs pa'o/_/nub rta mgrin dmar po be con sdigs 'dzub g.yon
analyzed: khro gnyer can sngo skya phyag bzhi g.yas na dbyug tho dang /_pad+ma/_g.yon bum pa dang phreng ba thogs pa'o/_/nub rta mgrin dmar po be con sdigs 'dzub g.yon
translated: In the south is Sumbha, blue-green, with four hands, holding a club and a lotus in his right hands and a vase and a rosary in his left hands.🔽In the west is Hayagriva, red, holding a club and a threatening forefinger in his left hand and a chakram and a lotus in his right hand.

original: 'khor lo pad+ma thogs pa'o/_/byang du e ka dza ti mthing nag phyag brgyad g.yas na🔽ral gri zhags pa pad+ma mda'o/_/g.yon 'khor lo dbyug to rtshe gsum gzhu thogs
analyzed: 'khor lo pad+ma thogs pa'o/_/byang du e ka dza ti mthing nag phyag brgyad g.yas na ral gri zhags pa pad+ma mda'o/_/g.yon 'khor lo dbyug to rtshe gsum gzhu thogs
translated: In the north is Ekajati, blue-black, with eight hands, holding a sword, a lasso, a lotus, and an arrow in her right hands and a chakram, a club, a battle-ax, and a bow in her left hands.🔽Recite the following mantra to invoke them:🔽Oṃ namo ratnatrayāya | namaḥ śrī vajraherukāya |🔽 Translation: He holds a lasso and a vajra in his right hands and a hook and a rosary in his left hands.

original: ma dmar mo zhal cig phyag bzhi ma dang po gnyis mchog sbyin dang spyi blugs/🔽gnyis pa gnyis phreng ba dang dbyug gu'o/_/byang du sgrol ma ser mo zhal cig
analyzed: ma dmar mo zhal cig phyag bzhi ma dang po gnyis mchog sbyin dang spyi blugs/ gnyis pa gnyis phreng ba dang dbyug gu'o/_/byang du sgrol ma ser mo zhal cig
translated: In the west is red Tārā with one face and four arms. The first pair are giving the boon-granting and alms-bowl gestures.🔽The second pair hold a rosary and a club.🔽In the north is yellow Tārā with one face and two arms, giving refuge and holding a yellow lotus.

translated: On the eight petals, beginning in the east, are red Tārā with one face and four arms, holding a vajra and threatening gesture, a sword and lasso;🔽black Tārā with one face and four arms, holding a chakram, lasso, sword, and threatening gesture;🔽yellow Tārā with one face and four arms, holding an aśoka tree, lotus, jewel, and vase;🔽green Tārā with one face and four arms, holding a sword, arrow, and threatening gesture;

translated: red Tārā with one face and four arms, holding a lotus, arrow, and threatening gesture;🔽white Tārā with one face and four arms, holding a wheel, arrow, and threatening gesture;🔽and blue Tārā with one face and four arms, holding a sword, arrow, and threatening gesture.

translated: Black Parṇaśabarī has one face and two arms and holds a goad and a noose.🔽Yellow has one face and eight arms.🔽In the first two hands she holds a khaṭvāṅga and a jewel; in the second two, a goad and a noose; in the third two, a vajra and a club; and in the fourth two, a sword and a vase.

original: bzhi ma ral gri dang 'khor lo mda' gzhu bsnams pa'o/_/nag mo zhal gsum
analyzed: bzhi ma ral gri dang 'khor lo mda' gzhu bsnams pa'o/_/nag mo zhal gsum
translated: Red has one face and four arms and holds a sword, a chakram, and a bow and arrow.

analyzed: g.yas dkar g.yon dmar ba/_phyag drug gis ral gri dang lcags kyu dang dbyug
translated: Black has three faces—white right, red left—and six arms. She holds a sword, a goad, a club,

analyzed: gu dang thod pa dang /_zhags pa dang /_mgo bo thogs pa'o/_/gru chad bzhi
translated: a skull, a noose, and a head.

analyzed: la sgrol ma dkar mo zhal cig phyag drug ma phreng ba dang mchog sbyin dang dbyug gu
translated: On the four corners are white Tārās, each with one face and six arms. They hold a rosary, a boon-granting gesture, and a khaṭvāṅga staff in the first three right hands;

translated: the third a lotus and a skull cup at her throat,🔽and the fourth a lotus and a skull cup at her heart.🔽The first has a lotus and a skull cup at her crown,🔽the second a lotus and a skull cup at her forehead,🔽the third a lotus and a skull cup at her throat,🔽and the fourth a lotus and a skull cup at her heart.🔽The first has a lotus and a skull cup at her crown,🔽the second a lotus and a skull cup at her forehead,🔽the third a lotus and a skull cup at her throat,🔽and the fourth a lotus and a skull cup at her heart.🔽The first has a lotus and a skull cup at her crown,🔽the second a lotus and a skull cup at her forehead,🔽the third a lotus and a skull cup at her throat,

analyzed: khar zla ba bsnams pa'o/_/dkar mo zhal gcig phyag bzhi ma lcags kyu dang a du
translated: and the fourth a lotus and a skull cup at her heart.🔽The first has a lotus and a skull cup at her crown,

analyzed: ru/_gnyis mchog sbyin mdzad pa'o/_/sgo bzhir ni/_dmar mo zhal cig phyag gnyis thugs khar mar me 'dzin pa'o/_/dmar ser zhal gcig phyag gnyis
translated: the second a lotus and a skull cup at her forehead,🔽the third a lotus and a skull cup at her throat,🔽and the fourth a lotus and a skull cup at her heart.🔽The first has a lotus and a skull cup at her crown,🔽the second a lotus and a skull cup at her forehead,🔽the third a lotus and a skull cup at her throat,

translated: and the fourth a lotus and a skull cup at her heart.🔽The first has a lotus and a skull cup at her crown,🔽the second a lotus and a skull cup at her forehead,🔽the third a lotus and a skull cup at her throat,🔽and the fourth a lotus and a skull cup at her heart.🔽The first has a lotus and a skull cup at her crown,🔽the second a lotus and a skull cup at her forehead,🔽the third a lotus and a skull cup at her throat,

translated: and the fourth a lotus and a skull cup at her heart.🔽The first has a lotus and a skull cup at her crown,🔽the second a lotus and a skull cup at her forehead,🔽the third a lotus and a skull cup at her throat,🔽and the fourth a lotus and a skull cup at her heart.🔽The first has a lotus and a skull cup at her crown,🔽the second a lotus and a skull cup at her forehead,

original: sku gdung bstan pa dam pa rigs brgya'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_las pho brang pad ma 'dab brgyad 'khor lo rtshibs bcu drug khyams sum rtsheg sgo
analyzed: sku gdung bstan pa dam pa rigs brgya'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_las pho brang pad ma 'dab brgyad 'khor lo rtshibs bcu drug khyams sum rtsheg sgo
translated: The visualization for the relics, the sacred teachings, is as follows: Generate the palace with eight lotus petals, a center with sixteen spokes, a courtyard with three sections, and gates.

original: dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni/_dbus su rnam par snang mdzad🔽kyis gtsho byas pa'i rigs lnga yum bzhi dang bcas pa/_rtshibs bcu drug la rdo rje
analyzed: dang bcas pa bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni/_dbus su rnam par snang mdzad kyis gtsho byas pa'i rigs lnga yum bzhi dang bcas pa/_rtshibs bcu drug la rdo rje
translated: For the visualization of the deities, in the center is Vairocana🔽with the four mothers of the five families. On the sixteen spokes are the sixteen male bodhisattvas, such as Vajrasattva,

original: sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sems dpa' bcu drug dang /_gru chad la sgeg🔽sogs bzhi dang /_khyams nang ma la skal bzangs bcu drug dang /_bar pa la dpe
analyzed: sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sems dpa' bcu drug dang /_gru chad la sgeg sogs bzhi dang /_khyams nang ma la skal bzangs bcu drug dang /_bar pa la dpe
translated: and on the four corners are the four goddesses such as Lāsya.🔽In the inner courtyard are the sixteen fortunate men, in the middle courtyard the sixteen men free of examples, and the four goddesses such as Dhūpā.

analyzed: bral bcu drug dang bdug sogs bzhi dang /_phyi ma la nyan thos bcu drug dang mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba
translated: In the outer courtyard are the sixteen śrāvakas,🔽and on the four gates are the four gate goddesses.

original: rang rgyal bcu gnyis dang /_sgo la sgo ma bzhi dang /_rta babs kyi mchod rten la
analyzed: rang rgyal bcu gnyis dang /_sgo la sgo ma bzhi dang /_rta babs kyi mchod rten la
translated: In the stūpa of the gateway is

analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi bskyed pa'o/_/spyan drangs mchod pa byas nas/_om hu~m tram hri a/
translated: The four great kings are generated.🔽After inviting and making offerings, recite the essence mantra of the five families: oṃ huṃ traṃ hrīḥ a.

original: zhes rigs lnga spyi'i snying po bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni sku gdung 'bar ba'o/_/
analyzed: zhes rigs lnga spyi'i snying po bzlas la dbang bskur ba ni sku gdung 'bar ba'o/_/
translated: The empowerment conferral is the blazing of the relics.🔽The actual practice of Bhagavatī Akṣaravajra

original: bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod ka ka ni'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod ka ka ni'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las
translated: is as follows:🔽From the cause, generate an eight-petaled lotus with a door in the archway.

original: pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa gru chad la sgo btod pa bskyed la/_der lha bskyed pa ni rgyu🔽las rdo rje/_de las sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa/_pad+ma 'dab brgyad la bkra shis kyi lha
analyzed: pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa gru chad la sgo btod pa bskyed la/_der lha bskyed pa ni rgyu las rdo rje/_de las sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa/_pad+ma 'dab brgyad la bkra shis kyi lha
translated: The generation of the deities there is as follows:🔽From the cause, there is a vajra; from that, Bhagavatī Akṣaravajra; on the eight petals of the lotus, the eight goddesses of good fortune; and the four door goddesses.

original: mo brgyad/_sgo ma bzhi rnams bskyed la spyan drangs mchod pa bya/_ka ka ni ci rigs
analyzed: mo brgyad/_sgo ma bzhi rnams bskyed la spyan drangs mchod pa bya/_ka ka ni ci rigs
translated: After inviting and making offerings, recite the Akṣaravajra mantra as appropriate,

analyzed: par bzlas la/_stod pa byas nas dbang bskur ba ni mi bskyod pa'o/_/
translated: and the empowerment conferral is Akṣobhya.

original: gtsho mo chen mo'i brgyud gzungs kyi rjes su 'brangs pa'i mngon par rtogs
analyzed: gtsho mo chen mo'i brgyud gzungs kyi rjes su 'brangs pa'i mngon par rtogs
translated: The actual practice of Mahāmāyūrī🔽is as follows:

original: pa ni/_rgyu las pad+ma 'dab brgyad rim pa gsum bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni/
analyzed: pa ni/_rgyu las pad+ma 'dab brgyad rim pa gsum bskyed la/_lha bskyed pa ni/
translated: The generation of the deities is as follows:

original: dbus su bcom ldan 'das thub pa/_pad+ma nang ma la byang chub sems dpa' brgyad/
analyzed: dbus su bcom ldan 'das thub pa/_pad+ma nang ma la byang chub sems dpa' brgyad/
translated: In the center is Bhagavān Śākyamuni. On the inner lotus are the eight bodhisattvas.

original: bar pa la nyan thos brgyad/_pad+ma phyi ma la phyogs skyong bcu/_gru chad la bdug
analyzed: bar pa la nyan thos brgyad/_pad+ma phyi ma la phyogs skyong bcu/_gru chad la bdug
translated: On the middle lotus are the eight śrāvakas. On the outer lotus are the ten direction protectors. In the four corners are the four offerings beginning with incense.🔽At the four gates are the four great kings.🔽Recite the mantra:

original: sogs bzhi/_sgo bzhir rgyal po chen po bzhi bskyed la/_mu ni mu ni mu ni ma ha mu ni ye swa ha
analyzed: sogs bzhi/_sgo bzhir rgyal po chen po bzhi bskyed la/_mu ni mu ni mu ni ma ha mu ni ye swa ha
translated: oṃ muni muni mahāmuniye svāhā

analyzed: bzlas pa byas la dbang bskur ba ni kha 'bar ma'i dal gyi cho ga'o/_/
translated: The empowerment conferral is the ritual of the Maṇḍala of Mahālakṣmī.

original: rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las 'khor lo
analyzed: rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las 'khor lo
translated: The actual practice of Vajravidāraṇa is as follows:🔽The cause is the generation of the four-spoked wheel🔽with a courtyard.

original: rtshibs bzhi/_khyams dang bcas pa bskyed la/_der lha bskyed pa ni dbus su🔽rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa sku mdog mthing kha/_phyag g.yas rdo rje rgya gram bsnun
analyzed: rtshibs bzhi/_khyams dang bcas pa bskyed la/_der lha bskyed pa ni dbus su rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa sku mdog mthing kha/_phyag g.yas rdo rje rgya gram bsnun
translated: The generation of the deities is as follows:🔽In the center is blue Vajravidāraṇa,🔽with a crossed vajra in the right hand🔽and a threatening gesture and a bell held to the hip in the left hand.

original: pa/_g.yon sdigs 'dzub dang dril bu dkur brten pa/_zhabs skyang skum
analyzed: pa/_g.yon sdigs 'dzub dang dril bu dkur brten pa/_zhabs skyang skum
translated: He stands with the right leg straight🔽and the left drawn in.

original: du bzhugs pa'o/_/shar du rdo rje rtum po mthing kha rdo rje rtshe cig pa thogs pa lhor🔽rdo rje ki la ya 'thing kha phur pa thogs pa'o/_/nub tu rdo rje be con sku mdog
analyzed: du bzhugs pa'o/_/shar du rdo rje rtum po mthing kha rdo rje rtshe cig pa thogs pa lhor rdo rje ki la ya 'thing kha phur pa thogs pa'o/_/nub tu rdo rje be con sku mdog
translated: In the east is Vajra Amṛtakuṇḍali, blue, holding a single-pronged vajra.🔽In the south is Vajrakīlaya, blue, holding a kila.🔽In the west is Vajra Pañjara, blue, holding a club.

original: 'thing kha be con thogs pa/_byang du rdo rje tho ba 'thing kha tho ba thogs pa'o/_/🔽g.yon thams cad dril bu dkur rten pa/_khyams la phyogs skyong bcu dang bkra
analyzed: 'thing kha be con thogs pa/_byang du rdo rje tho ba 'thing kha tho ba thogs pa'o/_/ g.yon thams cad dril bu dkur rten pa/_khyams la phyogs skyong bcu dang bkra
translated: In the north is Vajra Mudgara, blue, holding a hammer.🔽All of them have bells crossed over their left arms.🔽Meditate on the ten direction protectors and eight auspicious goddesses on the courtyard.

original: shis kyi lha mo brgyad bsgoms la/_rnam 'joms kyi sngags ci rigs par bzlas la/
analyzed: shis kyi lha mo brgyad bsgoms la/_rnam 'joms kyi sngags ci rigs par bzlas la/
translated: Recite the mantra of Vidāraṇa as much as you can.

original: dbang bskur ba ni dpal rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i cho ga'o/_/
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni dpal rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i cho ga'o/_/
translated: The empowerment is the ritual of Śrī Vajravidāraṇa.

original: gtshug tor rnam par rgyal ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las pad+ma
analyzed: gtshug tor rnam par rgyal ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las pad+ma
translated: The manifest realization of the uṣṇīṣa conqueror is as follows: From the cause,🔽a four-petaled lotus with a door arises.

original: 'dab bzhi sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_der lha bskyed pa ni dbus su rnam par
analyzed: 'dab bzhi sgo dang bcas pa bskyed la/_der lha bskyed pa ni dbus su rnam par
translated: The deity is generated there: In the center is white Uṣṇīṣavijayā,

original: rgyal ma dkar mo/_zhal gsum g.yas ser/_g.yon sngo/_khro mo'i cha lugs
analyzed: rgyal ma dkar mo/_zhal gsum g.yas ser/_g.yon sngo/_khro mo'i cha lugs
translated: with three faces—the right yellow, the left blue—with the accouterments of a wrathful goddess.

original: spyan gsum pa dang /_phyag brgyad g.yas na rdo rje dang 'od dpag med dang mchog sbyin mdzad pa/_g.yon na sdigs 'dzub zhags pa dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin🔽pa dang gzhu dang bum pa 'dzin pa'o/_/g.yas na spyan ras gzigs dkar po
analyzed: spyan gsum pa dang /_phyag brgyad g.yas na rdo rje dang 'od dpag med dang mchog sbyin mdzad pa/_g.yon na sdigs 'dzub zhags pa dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang gzhu dang bum pa 'dzin pa'o/_/g.yas na spyan ras gzigs dkar po
translated: He has three eyes and eight arms. In his right hands he holds a vajra, Amitābha, and a boon-granting gesture; in his left hands he makes a threatening gesture, holds a lasso, grants protection,

original: pad+ma dang rnga yab 'dzin pa'o/_/g.yon na gsang bdag gos sngon po rdo rje dang rnga
analyzed: pad+ma dang rnga yab 'dzin pa'o/_/g.yon na gsang bdag gos sngon po rdo rje dang rnga
translated: holds a bow, and holds a vase. In his right hands he holds a lotus and a fly whisk. In his left hands he holds a vajra and a fly whisk.

original: yab 'dzin pa/_rgyab dang mdun na lha'i bu gnyis kyis ye shes kyi bum pa 'dzin🔽pa'o/_/sgo bzhir khro bo bzhi ni/_mi g.yo sngon po ral gri 'dzin pa g.yon
analyzed: yab 'dzin pa/_rgyab dang mdun na lha'i bu gnyis kyis ye shes kyi bum pa 'dzin pa'o/_/sgo bzhir khro bo bzhi ni/_mi g.yo sngon po ral gri 'dzin pa g.yon
translated: The two sons of gods in the back and front hold vases of timeless awareness.

original: sdigs 'dzub can/_'dod pa'i rgyal po sngon po lcags kyu bsnams pa/_dbyug
analyzed: sdigs 'dzub can/_'dod pa'i rgyal po sngon po lcags kyu bsnams pa/_dbyug
translated: The four wrathful ones in the four gates are as follows. Acala is blue and holds a sword in his right hand and makes a threatening gesture with his left hand.

original: pa sngon po dbyug pa thogs pa/_stobs po che sngo nag rdo rje thogs pa'o/_/
analyzed: pa sngon po dbyug pa thogs pa/_stobs po che sngo nag rdo rje thogs pa'o/_/
translated: Nīladaṇḍa holds a club. Mahābala is dark blue and holds a vajra.

original: om rgyu swa ha zhes bzlas pa'am/_gzungs ci rigs par bzlas nas dbang bskur
analyzed: om rgyu swa ha zhes bzlas pa'am/_gzungs ci rigs par bzlas nas dbang bskur
translated: Recite the dhāraṇī as much as you can.

original: ba ni rnam rgyal ma'o//_//
analyzed: ba ni rnam rgyal ma'o//_//
translated: Va is Vijayā.

original: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa mu tig gi phreng ba zhes bya ba
translated: The Abhisamayālaṃkāra-mālā-nāma

original: gtshug tor gdugs dkar mo can gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las
analyzed: gtshug tor gdugs dkar mo can gyi mngon par rtogs pa ni/_rgyu las
translated: The Abhisamayālaṃkāra of the Uṣṇīṣa-uṣṇīṣa-cakrā

analyzed: pad+ma 'dab brgyad 'khor lo rtshibs bcu drug dang bcas pa gru chad la sgo btod pa
translated: A lotus with eight petals, a wheel with sixteen spokes, and a gate on the square.
